loans.name: Sadorat

texts.ru: Садорат примерная женщина-таджичка. Ей 59 лет. Она вдова. Ее любимый муж умер несколько лет назад. После смерти мужа тьма стала частью ее жизни, и она очень страдала. Однако жизнь продолжалась, и ей было необходимо продолжать свой бизнес шитьем национального мужского халата «чапан». Она этому ремеслу научилась в молодости, и ее ремесло стало источником дохода в течение всей жизни. Она шьёт аккуратно и поэтому на местном рынке она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Введению бизнеса ее сын и невестка помогают ей. Садорат хочет развевать бизнес и увеличить доход. От полученного бизнеса она собирается улучшить условию проживания для своих детей и внуков. Она запрашивает займ для покупки ткани для шитья чапана. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sadorat is an exemplary Tajik woman. She is 59 years old and a widow.  Her beloved husband died a few years ago. After his death, darkness became a part of her life and she suffered a great deal. 

However, life went on, and it was necessary to continue her business sewing national men's robes ("chapan"). She learned this craft in her youth, and her craft became a source of income throughout her life. She sews accurately and because of this has loyal customers at the local market. Her son and his wife help her bring in business.

Sadorat wants to grow her business and increase her revenue. From the increased sales, she plans to improve living conditions for her children and grandchildren. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics to sew men's robes. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing men's robes

loans.name: Fotemogoban  V Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali :. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec SAFIATOU debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called FOTEMOGOBAN V are married women with an average age of 46 and on average, seven children, all living in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, their preceding loan having been correctly reimbursed.

Safiatou, the second person standing in the middle, cultivates sugar peas. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali :. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec   Djeneba debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called FOTEMOGOBAN VI are married women with an average age of 39 and on average, three children, all living in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, their preceding loan having been correctly reimbursed.

Djeneba, standing in the middle, cultivates sugar peas. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  VII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec   AFOU assise à l'extrême droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the FOTEMOGOBAN VII group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their second loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loan.

Afou, a member of the group, grows sugarsnap peas. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right. 

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and at the market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 75,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  VIII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le pois sucré  avec   ABI  ABDOULAYE assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the FOTEMOGOBAN VIII group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kapala, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their second loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loan.

Abi Abdoulaye, a member of the group, grows sugarsnap peas. In the photo, she is the woman seated in the middle of the front row.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Sikasso.

She is expecting to make a profit of 65,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora  Martha  tiene 59  años  de edad es soltera,  vive con sus hija y su nieto en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 40  años al negocio de venta de pescado, camarón, curil, etc.
Doña Martha en tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado de su comunidad, en su negocio ella vende todo lo relacionado a los mariscos, su clientela le prefiere por su buen producto.
Doña Martha es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, y gracias a su negocio tiene casa propia  y ha logrado  sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Martha está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pescado, camarón, culíes, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y así salir adelante, está muy contenta de poder solicitar préstamo en  Prisma,  su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Martha is 59 years old, single, and lives with her daughter and grandson in her own home. She has worked for 40 years selling fish, shrimp and curil [a type of mollusk] and other seafood. She has her business in her community market, where she sells all kinds of shellfish and seafood. She says her customers prefer her because of the quality of her products. Martha is a hardworking entrepreneur with a strong desire to get ahead. Thanks to her business, she has her own home and she has been able to provide for her children.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy fish, shrimp, curil and other seafood. With the help of the loan, she hopes to improve her income and get ahead. She says that she is very happy to be able to request a loan from the field partner, and that her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2013

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, curil and other seafood for her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. She previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to buy dresses, shorts and other clothing for kids, needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Marivic hopes her children will finish their studies. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional dresses, shorts and other clothing for kids, needed in her business.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen was born in 1981. She is single while all her siblings are married. Her father is deceased. Shireen lives with her mother in Zarqaa, Jordan. 

She started working in selling food from home two years ago, and she is planning to expand her project in the future. 

Shireen is requesting a loan now to buy new food merchandise in order raise her income.

loans.use: to increase her variety of products.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and farming rice. Elsie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, groceries, etc.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr: Annie est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. elle possède et gère un call-centre ambulant dans un coin de la ville depuis 3 ans où elle vend des crédits de communications.le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs Orange, MTN et Camtel). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Annie, aged 33, is single and has no children.  She owns and runs an itinerant call-center in one of her city's neighborhoods, where she has been selling phone credit for the past three years.

She is requesting a loan to make a bulk purchase of phone credit from operators such as Orange, MTN and Camtel.  With her profits, she will be able to increase her capital and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy phone credit.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 33-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband manufactures and renews spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of the engines of vehicles, renews the turbines and radiators. Her husband does lots of hard work for the sake of getting income for one day. 

Her husband wants to buy used spare parts of vehicles at cheap rates so that he can renew them and to sell them for high rates. But for this purpose he has insufficient money.

Shumaila requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to turn his business towards progress.
Shumaila hopes that this loan will improve the business of her husband positively. This improvement would affect their income and savings as well.

Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy used spare parts for renewal and then resale.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
This is Jenny. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of merchandise such as jackets, shirts, and polos for men and women, which are needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of merchandise such as jackets, shirts, and polos for men and women. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jenny dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise such as jackets, shirts, and polos for men and women.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 33 year old married woman. She is doing a business of milk sales with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

They sell milk to the people of their community and earn a good amount of income to lead a decent life. They have five children and want to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

For the improvement of the business, Asia requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. With the help of the loan, they will be able to increase their sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 21-year-old married woman. She has run her beauty parlor for five years. She offers her customers services such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to obtain more customers and for this she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. This is why she has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. 

She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move forward as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.fr: Elizabeth est une femme de 38 ans, marié et mère de 04 enfants. elle possède et gère un stand de vente de poissons fumés depuis 6 mois dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de matières premières afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses ventes/profits. les bénéfices ainsi générés seront injectés dans l'activité d'une part et vont subvenir aux besoins de la famille (éducation, logement et nutrition)
texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 38, is married and the mother of four children.  For the past six months, she has been running her own kiosk in one of the neighborhoods of her city, selling smoked fish.  

She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of fish in order to meet customer demand and increase her sales and profits.  

Part of Elizabeth's profits will be reinvested in her activity while the remaining money will be used to meet her family's needs (education, housing and food).

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is 57 years old and married. She has seven children. 

She owns and operates a business venture, elei (Samoan fabric printing). She has two years of experience in this line of business. 

Pamata needs a loan to buy materials, threads, screen print utensils, needles, paints and brushes. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, screen print utensils, needles, paints and brushes.

loans.name: Mauga

texts.en:
Mauga is a 51-year-old woman who is married and has seven children. She runs a business selling elei (a traditional fabric-decorating technique) materials in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Mauga has requested a loan to buy fabrics, paints, brushes and elei design boards. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, paints, brushes and elei (a traditional fabric-decorating technique) design boards.

loans.name: Union Y  Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforma tres emprendedoras mujeres una de ellas es Candida tiene 49 años de edad, casadas con tres hijos menores de edad. Su negocio es la venta de pan y nacatamales desde hace mas de dos  años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 3 años y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en una pulpería y comprar por quintal arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, jabones de olor, jabones de ropa, chiverías, etc. Ana tiene 45 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida, frescos, gaseosas y productos de Avon, Brigida tiene 44 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de tortillas y sopa.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Candida, who is 49 years old, married, and has three young children. Her business for more than two years now is selling bread and nacatamales [a steamed meat and vegetable pastry, cooked in banana or maize leaves].

Candida has been a client of the field partner for three years. She is requesting a loan to invest in a small grocery store. With the loan she would like to buy in bulk basic grains such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, toilet paper, scented soap, laundry detergent and snacks etc.

Ana is 45 years old and her business is selling food, soft drinks and Avon products. Brigida is 44 years old and her business is selling tortillas and soup.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, toilet paper, scented soap, laundry detergent and snacks etc.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia has been dealing in a business of stitching clothes for a period of about six years. She is a hardworking lady who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. 

She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. This will help her to stitch up more dresses on time. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Kassimou

texts.fr: Kassimou est un jeune homme de 26ans. Célibataire et sans enfant, il revend depuis 2012 des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile. Son premier crédit pris dans notre institution lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il espère multiplier ses boutiques et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en: Kassimou is a young man of 26, single and without children. Since 2012 he has been selling groceries and general merchandise  out of his home. His first loan from this institution will serve him to stock up on merchandise in order to meet the needs of his customers. As plans for the future, he hopes to have several stores and found a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and general merchandise.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 28ans, Ablavi vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 02ans à Lomé. Pour aider ce dernier dans les charges du foyer, elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure dans lequel elle coiffe ses clients et revend en même temps des mèches et divers produits. Aidée par 02 personnes, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère à l’avenir développer son commerce et s’acheter une moto pour les courses.
texts.en: A young woman of 28, Ablavi lives with her husband and their child aged two in Lomé. To help her husband with the household expenses, she opened a beauty parlor where she does hairdressing and also sells hair weaves and various other products. Helped by two people, she is now asking for her first loan to buy merchandise. She hopes in future to develop her business and buy herself a motorcycle for errands.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and various products.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan, age 56, deals in a business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, then she sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. 

She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase two more goats.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is in her late 20s and married. She has three children. She runs a general store in Waterloo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand.

Ramatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 44-year-old married woman; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She wants to provide good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jeanne Emilienne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme de 55 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. elle possède un stand dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des vivres, des produits alimentaire et des crédits de communication depuis 10 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de crédit de communication (orange, mtn)afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante pour engranger de nouveaux profits. les profits générés vont être injectés dans le capital de l'activité d'une part et améliorer ses conditions de vie (nutrition, santé) d'autre part
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of five children.  She runs her own kiosk where she sells food supplies and products as well as phone credit.  She works in her city and has been involved in this activity for the past ten years.

She is requesting this loan to boost her stock of phone credit (from Orange and MTN).  This purchase will allow her to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers and to make more profits.

Part of Jeanne's profits will be reinvested in her working capital while the remaining money will be used to improve her living conditions (nutrition and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy phone credit.

loans.name: Fuamoli

texts.en: Fuamoli is 39 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for two years. Fuamoli has requested a loan to buy a box of mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, foam plates, aluminum foil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, tomato sauce and gas. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuamoli will save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a box of mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, foam plates, aluminum foil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, tomato sauce and gas

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been working in milk sales for the past three years. She has three goats, two buffaloes and one cow in milk. Over the time she has become famous for providing good quality milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of revenue.  

Aziz has six children and she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  That is why she is happily running her business. She has some savings and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase another cow.  She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in increasing her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children ages 7 to 20 years.  In 2003, Aminata established her food business. She began her business because she was a housewife but she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute to taking care of the children.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has been selling mango fruits in the Philippines for 10 years now. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional mangoes to sell. In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mangoes to sell

loans.name: Konekro 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Konekro 1 fait partie de la coopérative CAAM qui est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 2 personnes. 
Koné a 81 ans. Il s’occupe de 10 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 10 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CAAM et il a 30 hectares de cacao certifiés Rainforest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une nouvelle maison.
texts.en:
The Konekro 1 group is part of the CAAM cooperative, located in Meagui, a small town in the southwestern region of San Pedro, in Côte d’Ivoire.  This is a two-person group.

Koné is 81 years old.  He takes care of ten people in his household.  He joined the CAAM cooperative ten years ago and he owns 30 hectares (74 acres) of Rainforest-Alliance certified cocoa, which means that he respects the standards and principles of sustainable farming.

This loan will help him to buy fertilizers for his farming business, which will in turn allow him to increase his production and his earnings.

With the remaining money, he will build a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia has an animal sales business that she started to support her husband financially, as he earning only a small income as an employee of a small factory. She purchases baby goats and calves at low prices, then raises and sells them in the market at higher prices.

Sadia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, and with a good repayment history is now requesting her third loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good quality education to her three children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura, a 20-year-old single lady with no children, has been running a small business selling pancakes in her community for two years now. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital and is now requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, a kerosene oven, a plastic container, a big pot and a frying pan. With her earnings, Laura will help provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, a kerosene oven, a plastic container, a big pot and a  frying pan

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa nació en la ciudad de Accha pero ahora vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y el puesto de venta esta implementado con la regular mercadería, ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Teresa was born in the city of Accha, but now lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in the Department of Cusco. She is 55 years old, married, and has seven children for whom she wants to move forward. Teresa sells clothing for men, women, and children. She has a small vending stall at one of the markets in the city of Paucartambo where she offers her products. Her stall is stocked with regular merchandise. Teresa attends to relatives, neighbors, and friends with a great deal of friendliness and courtesy. For this reason, her customers always return to vending stall. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mamacha Carmen”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy clothing such as sweaters, trousers, shirts, and other items. Teresa appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, trousers, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda. She previously accessed a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy merchandise such as undergarments to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.

Imelda would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise items like undergarments to further expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better the profit. Imelda's profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Imelda dreams to continuously expand her business and have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like undergarments to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana, de 19 años de edad, Vive en compañía de su esposo y su pequeño hijo en la casa que heredó de su suegro. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y de su esposo comenzó un negocio de entretenimiento en la zona comercial de su comunidad, ahí se dedica a atender a los diversas personas que llegan a jugar en las máquinas de video juegos que compró hace 2 años. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que es la única que se dedica a está actividad , por esa razón desea acondicionar su negocio no solo con juegos sino también con un espacio para poder vender bebidas heladas, ya que es un negocio rentable. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Johana, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en el mantenimiento de las máquinas de video juegos para que puedan funcionar sin dificultad.
texts.en: Johana is 19 and lives with her husband and her little son in a house she inherited from her father-in-law. Thanks to the support of her parents and her husband, she was able to start up an entertainment business in her city's commercial district, where she spends her time serving the different people who come to play the arcade games she bought two years ago. She tells us that things are going very well as hers is the only business of its kind in the area. She would like to install a frozen drinks stand on the premises, which she thinks will be profitable. This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support which will help her to get ahead. She promises to make her repayments in a timely manner. Johana will invest 1,000 soles on the maintenance of her arcade games so that they work without any problems.

loans.use: to maintain her arcade games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Adin

texts.es: Adin, tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con su madre en una aldea del municipio de protección, Santa Bárbara. Desde joven adquirió experiencia en agricultura. Hace 3 años que decidió establecer sus propios cultivos, donde produce  café y granos básicos. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local y obtiene los ingresos para sostener a su familia. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca para sacar buena cosecha y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adin is 23 years old and single. He lives with his mother in a neighborhood in the town of Protección, Santa Bárbara.

From a young age, Adin acquired experience in farming. Three years ago, he decided to plant his own crops, such as coffee and basic grains. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market and the income he earns is used to sustain his family.

Adin decided to request a loan of 10,000 HNL in order to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay for maintenance of his farm. This will result in a good harvest and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay for maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, which include food, health, clothing, and education. 

Rubina has been working in the agriculture industry with her husband for many years. She grows different fruits and vegetables and sells them in the local market. 

Rubina's husband helps her grow good quality crops by watering the soil. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Rubina has applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR), which she will use to purchase insecticides, pesticides and different types of seed. This will help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more income. 

Rubina is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, pesticides and different types of seed.

loans.name: Las Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SEMBRADORAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhoana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, tejido de bayetas, tejido de mantas, tejido de ropa en miniatura, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhoana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de frituras de papa y plátano; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su madre que también trabaja en esta área.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
“LAS SEMBRADORAS” communal bank has started their eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is composed of eight members, led by a Board of directors. Jhoana is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are various. Amongst them are selling fruit, weaving cloth, weaving blankets, weaving miniature clothing and carpentry. The loan will benefit these small enterprises of which Jhoana is a member.

Jhoana joined pro Mujer five years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She lives with a life partner and has three children. At present her business is the production and sale of fried potatoes and plantains. She learned this business through her mother who also works in this business. 

She will use this loan to increase her stock (buy potatoes) which she will get from wholesale sellers. She will prepare them in her selling space. This work allows her to maintain her household as best she can. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the Health services.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, tejido de bayetas, tejido de mantas, tejido de ropa en miniatura, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carcasas de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su amiga que también trabaja con este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de carcasas de celulares) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Unión" group will begin its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the German Busch Regional Office, it comprises nine members run by a board of directors whose president is Carmen.  Members engage in a variety of businesses, including: selling fruit, cloth weaving, blanket weaving, miniature clothing weaving, and cell phone sales. 

The loan they are seeking will benefit small businesswomen like Carmen.  She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who was a member.  Now she sells cell phone cases and tells us that she started the business on the advice of a friend who was also selling them.

Carmen will use her loan to buy more merchandise (cell phone cases), which she'll buy wholesale from vendors and sell at her locale. This type of work allows her to bring in income to support her household as much as possible; she has a common law spouse and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Carmen says she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy cell phone cases.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with one child and she goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells green banana and has been in this business for two years. 

Robinah has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green banana. She earns additional income from rental houses. 

Robinah works at the market seven days a week on a retail basis. The major challenges for her business include seasonality and transportation. Robinah aspires to sell on a wholesale basis and also to one open up another stall for different types of food. 

Robinah resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of green banana that she can on-sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 37-year-old married man who supports a family of seven.  His spouse, Ruth, adds additional income to the family. They are blessed with five children aged between seven and 12 years old. 

Joel owns a private primary school which has been in operation for seven years, earning himself an income of 120,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Joel is now servicing his first loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to construct a new classroom. The profit he earns will be used to help the vulnerable people living within the community.

He hopes for growth in his business.

loans.use: to construct another classroom.

loans.name: Ines Mariuxi

texts.es:
INES tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

INES se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesrio para trabajar la tierra. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es tener un negocio en donde participen toda la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar reuniones familiares.
texts.en:
Ines is 29 years old, single, and has one child. They live in the canton of Ventanas, which is Los Ríos Province.

Ines is a member of the Communal Bank “La Chonta”, which is located in the precinct of La Chonta in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farming and raising livestock.

Ines is a farmer who grows corn and soybeans. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and herbicides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for the work on her land. Her purchases will be made in Ventanas. Ines dreams of having a business in which her entire family can participate.

In her free time, Ines enjoys having family reunions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es: Luis de 33 años de edad se dedica a la compra y  venta de frijoles desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y a precio accesible, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus seis hijos, luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frijoles por mayor ya que tiene mucha demanda por ser un producto  muy vendible, y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 33 years old and has made a living from buying and selling beans for many years. His business is located in his home and he also sells in an itinerant fashion in the various neighborhoods near his place of residence. He has a large clientele, as his product is of very good quality at an accessible price. With his earnings from his sales he manages to cover some of his household expenses. He lives in a house he owns with his wife and their six children. 

Luis is asking for a loan to buy more beans wholesale, as he has a lot of demand because it is a very marketable product. In this way he will be able to improve his earnings to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beans wholesale

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a married lady and a mother of two. She has operated a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Zahida makes enough to provide for her family. Her husband also helps by purchasing different types of goods from the wholesale market. To ensure her store is fully stocked, she has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR), which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. With this loan, Zahida will be able to meet increasing demand. 

Zahida wishes to use part of her income to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Luz De Mi Camino Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Filomena mujer de 42 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de  23 y 20 años. Su negocio es venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 4 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año  y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en comprar ropa nueva y usada como faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, camisas, tollas de baño, talladores, chores, camisas mangas tres cuartas, etc.  y sandalias de todo estilo para dama. Sonia mujer de 32 años y su negocio es la venta  de ropa nueva, bisutería, perfumes y Ilsa tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de productos  naturales onlife y victoria secret.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members. One of them is Filomena, a 42-year-old woman who is married and has two children (ages 23 and 20). She has been in the business of selling new and used clothing for four years. Filomena has been a client of ADIM for one year. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of new and used clothing such as skirts, blouses, trousers, T-shirts, ¾ sleeve shirts, shorts, as well as bath towels, wood carvings, and all types of women’s sandals.

Sonia is a 32-year-old woman who has a business of selling new clothing, trinkets, and perfumes. Ilsa is 35 years old and has a business of selling Onlife natural products and Victoria’s Secret merchandise.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, trousers, T-shirts, ¾ sleeve shirts, shorts, as well as bath towels, wood carvings, and all types of women’s sandals.

loans.name: Totoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TOTORITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de afeitadoras, venta de pescado, venta de queso y verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de los vecinos que son socios de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña ayudando a su tía, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de pescado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor de la frontera de Bolivia y Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Totoritas" group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the Alto Lima Regional Center, it comprises six members and is run by a board whose president is Modesta.  Group members engage in a variety of business activities including: blanket weaving, selling razors, selling fish, and selling cheese and vegetables.

The loan they're taking out will benefit small businesswomen like Modesta.  She says she joined Pro Mujer a year ago on the invitation of her neighbors who were members.  She currently has a fish sales business.  She says she learned the business by helping out her aunt when she was a young girl, and then she decided to start up her own business. 

Modesta is seeking a loan now so she can increase her inventory by buying more fish, which she'll get wholesale from vendors on the border of Bolivia  and Perú and then sell at her locale.  This kind of work will allow her to support her household as much as possible.  She has a common law spouse and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Modesta says she likes the loans and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and furniture for her workshop.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao a 69 ans. Il fait partie de la coopérative CAAM qui est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la 
Il s’occupe de 12 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 10 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CAAM et il a 10 hectares de cacao certifiés Rainforest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va scolariser son fils à l'université.
texts.en:
Yao is 69 years old. He is a member of the CAAM cooperative located in Meagui, a small town in southwestern Ivory Coast. He has 12 dependents under his roof. He has been with CAAM for 10 years, and he has 10 hectares of cacao farmland certified by the Rainforest Alliance, which means that he adheres to the standards and principles of sustainable agriculture.

He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his cacao plantation. This will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He wants to use the additional revenue to send his son to university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: N'guessankro Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe N'Guessankro fait partie de la coopérative CAAM qui est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 3 personnes. 
Thérèse a 69 ans. Elle s’occupe de 7 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 8 ans qu’elle fait partie de la coopérative CAAM et elle a 30 hectares de cacao certifiés Rainforest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’elle respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, elle va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, elle va scolariser ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
The group N'Guessankro belongs to the CAAM cooperative located in Meagui, a small town in the southwest of Ivory Coast, in the region of San Pedro. The group has 3 members.

Thérèse is 69 years old and she has 7 dependents under her roof. She has been with CAAM for 8 years, and she has 30 hectares of cacao farmland certified by the Rainforest Alliance, which means that she adheres to the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her cacao plantation. This will allow her to increase production and to bolster her income. 

She wants to use the additional revenue to support her grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es:
Armando tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca de 10 manzanas, cultiva maíz, frijoles, repollo y café. Este último rubro es su principal fuente de ingresos y en los últimos 3 ciclos ha obtenido una producción de 150, 300 y 200 quintales de café pergamino en un área de 5 manzanas.

En el último ciclo tuvo una baja en el rendimiento debido al problema de la roya, que afectó las plantaciones de café en el país. Sin embargo, su objetivo es hacer frente a esta enfermedad que afecta las hojas de la planta, con un manejo integral de su finca. Para ello está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su plantación de café y poder garantizar todas las actividades de mantenimiento de este cultivo. Este pequeño emprendedor confía que con su trabajo, honestidad y transparencia en sus relaciones de negocios, podrá seguir creciendo y obteniendo mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en: Armando is 49 and lives with his wife and five children in a rural community of Nicaragua. On his small farm of 16.8 acres he grows corn, beans, cabbage and coffee. Coffee is his main source of income and in the last three seasons he has harvested 150, 300 and 200 quintals of Pergamini coffee from an area of 8.4 acres. The last harvest was smaller due to a blight problem which affected the country's coffee plantations. However, Armando aims to overcome this disease, which affects the leaves of the plant, through good management of his farm. In order to achieve this he is asking for a loan to buy fertilisers for his coffee plantation and to be able to guarantee the upkeep of the farm. Small-time entrepreneur Armando is confident that with his hard work, honesty and open business negotiations, he will be able to continue growing his farm and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the meals she sells.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 45 años, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Rosario se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, instala su mesa en el frontis de un jardín de niños, teniendo bastante acogida por la buena sazón  que tiene, lleva en ese negocio cerca de 04 años con el apoyo de sus hijos. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, tiene planes de alquilar un local y ampliar su negocio donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes con menús. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.  Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, y mejora de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old, is married and lives in a house she owns with her husband and their 4 children. She makes a living from selling fast food, installing her table in front of a playground. Quite well received for her good seasoning, she has had this business for about 4 years with the support of her children. She likes her business because it allows her to have financial income that she uses to support her partner with their household expenses. 

Rosario has plans to expand her business and rent a space where she will be able to attend to her clients more comfortably with menus. This will be her first loan from Kiva; she hopes for Kiva's collaboration so that she may nail down her plans. With the amount of 800 Peruvian nuevos soles she will invest in buying ingredients to prepare food and improve her sales stall.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food that she sells

loans.name: Godeagui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Godeagui fait partie de la coopérative CAAM qui est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 3 personnes. 
Yao a 54 ans. Il s’occupe de 11 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 10 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CAAM et il a 17.5 hectares de cacao certifiés Rainforest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group Godeagui belongs to the CAAM cooperative located in Meagui, a small town in the southwest of Ivory Coast in the region of San Pedro. The group has 3 members.

Yao is 54 years old. He has 11 dependents under his roof. He has been with CAAM for 10 years, and he has 17.5 hectares of cacao farmland certified by the Rainforest Alliance, which means that he adheres to the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his plantation. These products will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He wants to use the additional revenue to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Kouassi Koffikro Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kouassi KoffirKro fait partie de la coopérative CAAM qui est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 16 personnes. 
Koffi a 35 ans. Il s’occupe de 20 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 10 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CAAM et il a 6 hectares de cacao certifiés Rainforest Alliance et UTZ, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une maison et faire de l'élevage de bœuf.
texts.en:
The group Kouassi Koffirkro belongs to the CAAM cooperative located in Meagui, a small town in the southwest of Ivory Coast, in the region of San Pedro. The group has 16 members.

Koffi is 35 years old. He has 20 dependents under his roof. He has been with CAAM for 10 years, and he has 6 hectares of cacao farmland certified by the Rainforest Alliance and by UTZ, which means that he adheres to the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his plantation. This will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He wants to use the additional revenue to build a new house and start to raise cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is 29 years old from Tulkarem. He is married. Since 2010, he has owned greenhouses where he plants fruits and vegetables. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a new greenhouse and fruit and vegetable seeds.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his productivity and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a new greenhouse and fruit and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Dioscora works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Dioscora is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Dioscora has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy addititional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 32 años, tiene una hija pequeña con quien vive en la casa de sus padres. Juan tiene una mecánica que abrió en su propia casa hace ya 15 años. Comenta que en aquellos tiempos era muy solicitado pues no existía un lugar cercano para arreglar los vehículos y era el único que tenía el conocimiento para realizar ese trabajo. Es así que empezó a hacer crecer su negocio y a tener muchos clientes, aunque en la actualidad tiene algunos competidores no le restan ingresos, ya que es muy bueno , además tiene lubricantes y repuestos para sus clientes, “esto es la diferencia con los demás, yo brindo un servicio completo”, comenta. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Juan, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de lubricantes y repuestos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
32-year-old Juan has a small daughter with whom he lives in his parents' house. Juan has a mechanic's shop that he opened in his own home 15 years ago. He says that in those times he was very sought-after because there were no other auto-repair places nearby and he was the only one who had the knowledge to do that work. That's how he began to grow his business and to have lots of customers. Although he now has some competitors, they don't take away any of his income because he is very good. He also has lubricants and spare parts for his clients. "That is the difference between me and the others. I provide a complete service," he explains.

This is Juan's first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving so that he can keep making progress. He will invest the 1,000 PEN in the purchase of lubricants and spare parts to stock his business.

loans.use: to by lubricants and spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 25 years old and married with one child aged two years. She runs a palm oil business in Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to educate her children. 

She's been in this business since 2009 and sells palm oil at a particular market place. She describes her major hardship as being to travel to the provinces which is very difficult especially during the rainy season.  

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 42, deals in the business of milk sales. For three years, she has been running her business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo. Her aim was to support her family at a time when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf Officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Malia has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Malia hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a hard working man who works hard to meet the demands of his family.

Here again he comes to you requesting for another loan of KES 50,000 to buy seven goats to sell. 

He appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy seven goats to sell.

loans.name: Merhi Group

texts.en:
Merhi is a group of three Lebanese women, who joined hands to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to develop their socio-economic situations. 

Anisa is the featured borrower of Merhi group; she is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a hair dresser and makeup artist for five years. Her business is based at home, because currently she can't afford to open her own separate beauty salon.

She is the one wearing purple at the far left of the picture. Her loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special cosmetics released for the summer. She hopes that one day she can open a widely-developed beauty salon.

As for the other group members, Nada is the one wearing white, and Huda is the lady in black.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special cosmetics released for the summer.

loans.name: Safeera

texts.en:
Safeera, age 41, is a married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for many years to contribute to the family income. She beautifully pastes stones and pearls on shawls and clothes. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong., but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Safeera’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

To cope with the orders of her customers on time she needs to purchase spools of thread along with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 through Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her earnings by completing the orders of her customers on time. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread along with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Helen has been in this business for 26 years. She earns more income from boat-for-hire services.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en:
Solinuu is a 57-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Solinuu has requested a loan to buy a spade, bush knives, a backpack sprayer and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Solinuu hopes to save for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a spade, bush knives, a backpack sprayer and barbed wire.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman and has been blessed with four children who are all adults. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ngim

texts.en:
Ngim is married and has five children, one of whom is single and depends on his income. He makes his living in agriculture, growing rice on his own farmland located in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. From this business, Ngim is able to generate a net profit of 2 USD per day. He has support from his wife and some of his children. He learned the farming business from his parents. 
 
The loan that Ngim is requesting from HKL is for the purchase of a motorcycle, which his employed children will use to commute to work. They used to pay for taxi services, which increased their monthly expenses. With this purchase, Ngim will help his children save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his children.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 26 years old and married with two children, ages 3 years and 8 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. Her husband is a security guard but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take care of her family.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and roof her house for the rainy season. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old married father. He has worked repairing cars and vehicles for 25 years. 

This experience provided him with customers' sense of trust and commitment. Khaled works hard to improve his business, he has a very good reputation. 

Khaled had a very good experience with Kiva partner Al Majmoua and has a good repayment history.

He is as usual working hard to develop his business, that's why he is working hard on expanding it. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay back the remaining cost of the spare parts that he bought.

Khaled is developing his business to make sure that it is enough to cover his family and customers' needs.  He hopes to keep on expanding his business in the future as much as he can.

loans.use: to pay what he owes for spare parts that he bought.

loans.name: Torky

texts.en: Torky is a 26-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a person who is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed. He has only completed the secondary school. He intends to buy a cupboard but he doesn't have sufficient money so he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy cupboard for his house. He hopes to buy furniture for his house and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for his house.

loans.name: Alkaba

texts.fr:
Madame  Alkaba est âgée de 45  ans,  mariée  et mère de 4  enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et  ses enfants  dans la cours de l’école Bandiougou  Bouaré  de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle débuta les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle qui travaillait  dans la société Malienne D’importation et D’exportation (SOMIEX) de Djiré.  après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de ce dernier, elle évolua seule pour mener le commerce de blé, pâtes alimentaires et de couscous.   Elle mène ces activités  depuis 20 ans. Sa force de vente est due à son prix abordable,  son sens des affaires et surtout à la qualité de ses produits.
Pour faire face à sa demande clientèle surtout pour  les  fêtes qui s’annoncent  à savoir le Ramadan, le Tabaski, Noël et le 31 Décembre,  elle demande ce prêt,  qui est  d’ailleurs  est  à son 1er  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte l’utiliser pour acheter 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et 10 cartons de couscous. Elle s’approvisionne  à Djiré.  
Madame Alkaba    vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de boutiquiers et beaucoup de particuliers.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA, qui servira de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et de payer ses tontines.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alkaba is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their children behind the Bandiougou Bouaré school of Ségou, 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Unable to attend school for social reasons, she started early to earn a living alongside her uncle who was then working for Mali’s import/export corporation (SOMIEX) in Djiré. After many years of training with her uncle, Alkaba started her own activity selling wheat, pasta and couscous. She has been practicing this activity for 20 years, and her success is the result of affordable pricing, good business sense and quality products. 

To meet customer demand, especially during the upcoming holiday periods of Ramadan, Tabaski, Christmas and December 31, she is seeking her first individual loan. She will use the credit to buy 10 cartons of pasta and 10 cartons of couscous. She buys her stock in Djiré.
