Alkaba sells for cash and on credit to a clientele consisting of shopkeepers and lots of individual customers. With the help of this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000CFAF, which will allow her to cover family expenses and to pay her savings group.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 53 años de edad desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz, con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y sus tres nietos. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia, who is 53 years old, has worked in agriculture for ten years; it is her principal source of income. She grows corn, and she covers some of her household expenses with what she earns from her harvests. She lives with her two children and three grandchildren in a house that she owns. 

Virginia wants to buy the supplies she needs for her crops, such as soil amendments, fertilizers, and seeds, and to improve the land that she farms, which appears in the photograph. Given that she doesn't have the economic resources necessary for that investment, she has made the decision to request a loan, as that is the only way she can continue her cultivation process. 

Just like all farmers, Virginia puts her trust in agriculture since she has no other source of income; she wants to better herself by doing the best she can with her plantings. She hopes to reap an abundant harvest, which will allow her to continue bringing home the daily bread and to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizers, and seeds, and to improve the land that she farms.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi, 24 years old, is a married man and has no children. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to add to his inventory. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta, age 46, deals in animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, raises them and then she sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries).  She makes a good deal through her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is on her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 53 años, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo y su único hijo. Mary se dedica a la venta de periódicos para eso se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige a  comprar sus periódicos para venderlos en su puesto en un mercado conocido, lleva realizando éste oficio desde hace 10 años logrando hacerse conocida y contando con una clientela regular, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la venta. Le gusta su negocio pues con ese ha sabido sacar adelante a su hijo y mantenido a los largo de este tiempo que lleva realizando ese negocio, tiene planes de hacer arreglos en su casa y construir cuartos para alquiler. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de periódicos.
texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old. She is married and lives in her own house together with her husband and only child. Mary sells newspapers, which require her to get up very early in the morning so she can buy newspapers which she then sells in her stand in a well-known market. She has been doing this job for 10 years, so now people know her and she has regular customers. Her son helps her run the stand. 

She likes her job as it has enabled her to bring up her son through the years she has been running the business. She plans to renovate the house and build new rooms to rent. This will be her first loan with Kiva and she is eagerly waiting to work together with you in order to push on with her goals. She will invest the 500 nuevos soles in buying newspapers.

loans.use: To buy newpapers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 62 ans,  mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, sa coépouse, ses enfants et petits enfants au 2ème quartier de Ségou   (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons, parents trop conservateurs, elle débuta le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Après plusieurs années passées à ses  côtés, elle évolua  seule pour mener le commerce du  jus de fruits et de glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans  et jouit d’une grande renommée. Elle a constamment des commandes lors des grandes cérémonies (mariage, baptême, décès  etc.).
Pour faire son jus elle utilise du sucre,  du gingembre,   du Tamarin (fruit exotique très prisé), des sachets de sucres valines et  poudres de jus (banane et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans 3 litres d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché.  le breuvage ainsi obtenu est mis  dans des bidons soigneusement lavés  qui seront  finalement dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement. 
Dans  d’augmenter son stocks de matières premières  afin de faire face à la demande clientèle surtout en cette période de carême, elle sollicite un nouveau prêt,  elle est en relation avec l’institution depuis 72 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 3 sacs de sucre et 6 cartons de poudre de jus. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Madame Fatoumata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à payer ses factures d’électricité.
texts.en:
Madame Fatoumata is 62,  married, and the mother of five children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her co-spouse, and her children and grandchildren in the second district of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

Not having been at school for certain reasons, her parents being too conservative, she began petty trade together with her mother who sold cotton clothing. After several years passed at her mother's side, Madame Fatoumata went out on her own, selling fruit juice and ice. She has been in the same business for 20 years and is well-known for it. She constantly receives orders when there are important ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, funerals, etc.)

To make her juice she uses sugar, ginger, tamarind (a highly regarded exotic fruit), envelopes of vanilla sugar and juice powder (banana and orange). All this is  mixed into three liters of water to obtain an excellent flavor. The drink she makes in this way is put  into carefully  washed jerrycans, which are finally put in the refrigerator to cool. 

Wishing to grow her stock of ingredients so as to meet the demand of her clientele during this holy season of fasting, she is asking for another loan. She has been dealing with the institution for 72 months and has correctly reimbursed four solidarity loans and four individual loans. She is on her fifth individual loan which she intends to use to buy three sacks of sugar and six cartons of juice powder. She buys her ingredients right where she lives and works. 

Madame Fatoumata sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse her loan and pay her electric bills.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juices.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 33-year-old married mother of three. She started working in preparing conserved food in October 2012 to help her husband to cover their beloved family's increasing expenses.

Manal prepares pickles, vine leaves, traditional Kishek, groats, and special conserved dairy products such as Labneh and cheese. Her products are of a very good quality and are highly requested by customers. That's why she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials for her business such as eggplant, cucumbers, milk, vine leaves, nuts, garlic, and jars.

She hopes that in the future she will be capable of opening her own food production factory and shop to increase her income and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Las Entusiastas De La 3Ra Etapa De La Era Group

texts.es: Un grupo dinámico y responsables es “Las Entusiastas De La 3era Etapa De La Era” conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras que pasan a su 7mo ciclo. Yolanda es la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad.  Yolanda es casada y tiene 04 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. A sus 45 años Yolanda ha llegado a cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Hace 03 años que se dedica a la venta de sábanas, cubrecamas y edredones, la cual los ofrece a pedidos.  Se siente feliz pues cada vez aumentan sus clientes. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de cubrecamas y edredones. Su mayor es de instalar un espacio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo está agradecido con el crédito brindado  y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Yolanda es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negra y pantalón negro. Consuelo se encuentra en la parte superior lado izquierdo, no puedo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This dynamic and responsible group is called “Las Entusiastas de La Tercera Etapa de La Era” and consists of six hardworking women who are in their seventh loan cycle.

Yolanda is the treasurer of the group, a position she holds with responsibility. At 45 years of age, Yolanda has accomplished some of her dreams, such as improving her home and providing for her children’s education. For the past three years, she has been selling bed sheets, bedspreads, and quilts. She offers these products according to orders. Yolanda is pleased that she gains more customers each time.

Her most recent loan will be used to buy bedspreads and quilts. Her greatest wish is to have a space where she can offer her products.

The group is appreciative of the loan that has been provided and commits to continuing their good work. In the photo, Yolanda is first person on the left wearing a black sweater and black trousers. Consuelo is the member who appears in the smaller photo since she was not able to be present because of her work.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and quilts.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
Adamsay is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a general store in Waterloo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business for eight years and sells soda, milk, sardines, cocoa, and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Adamsay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, sugar, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, sugar, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Laura Yojana

texts.es:
La joven  Laura  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su hijo y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 6 años.
Laura el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, pollo, refrescos, café, pan, azúcar, leche, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La joven Laura  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando a sus hijos y a sus padres  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	


Choluteca, Honduras  – Junio  del   2013
texts.en:
Laura is a responsible, hardworking, and honest young person. She lives with her son and her husband in the south of Honduras. She has had a grocery store business for more than six months. 

Laura needs the loan to purchase shortening, rice, beans, meats, chicken, soft drinks, coffee, bread, sugar, milk, etc. She hopes that by having more products to offer because of this loan, sales will increase in her business and she will be able to better serve her customers. 

Young Laura hopes to cover the expenses that she has and to improve her and her family's quality of life a little bit. In a few years, she hopes that her business will continue growing and become one of the biggest and most well-known shops in the area, and that she will continue supporting her children and her parents, who have few economic resources. 

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2013

loans.use: to purchase shortening, rice, beans, meats, chicken, soft drinks, coffee, bread, sugar, milk, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Meet 21-year-old Hawanatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children aged 2 years to 8 years old.  In 2010, Hawanatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was train with business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lack of capital to expand her business.

Hawanatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Hawanatu plans to expand her business still more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and palm oil to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children, ages 2 and 11.  In 2006, Aminata established her roast chicken business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in this business. She works  from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges for her business are price inflation and lack of capital to expand.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase chicken, cooking seasoning, and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, cooking seasoning, and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi and his nice family live in the village Goght, which is in the Kotayk region. Nairi’s native village has a very rich nature. The landscape there is so beautiful; enormous green forests are in perfect harmony with mountains and ancient caves. Crystal lakes and cheerful rivers are all around. The water here is ice-cold and is the sweetest in the whole region, and among this magical nature and fresh air, which breezes from the mountains, Nairi’s two lovely and beautiful girls are growing up.

Nairi and his wife enjoy the work that they do in their colorful fruit garden, which they have cultivated with their own day and night work. They are mainly engaged in agricultural activities; they cultivate some vegetables for their family needs (greens, tomatoes, beans and cucumbers) and they also have a lot of fruit trees (apple, apricot, pear, peach and mulberry trees), the harvest of which they sell through the re-sellers. Nairi says that the region where he lives is perfect particularly for agriculture but the farming is not very developed here, which is why many families here like his, keep very few farm animals (he has only two bulls).

Nairi has taken loans from Nor Horizon three times and it is his first deal with Kiva lenders. He needs this loan in order to organize autumn harvest and hay gathering activities.

loans.use: to organize autumn harvest and hay gathering activities.

loans.name: Corapata Central Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAPATA CENTRAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su familia al observar que contaba con vacas lecheras, que es la materia primordial del producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza elaborara los productos para su comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
A.C. “CORAPATA CENTRAL” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is made up of 10 members and is run through a directive board. Susana is the Chairwoman of the board. The members of the community association have various businesses, including: milk sales, cattle sales, corner stores and cheese sales. 

The loan requested will benefit a number of small businesses, Susana's business among them. This is the first time Pro Mujer has taken part and Susana found out about the opportunity through a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she runs a business producing and selling cheese. She began the business on her family's suggestion, after they saw that she had some milking cows, which are the primary source of production. 
 
The loan will help to increase her animal stock which she will buy from neighbouring communities. After raising her cattle, she will then be able to make the product she sells. This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the benefits on health and liquidity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 8 children from ages 7 months to 25 years.  She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her children and herself. In 2000, Memunatu established her general store business. She began her business to help her family. She works there from 8:00am until 9:00pm, Monday through Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks, and milk to sell at her store. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Memunatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks, and milk for her general store.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 37 years old. She lives in Sagarejo District with her husband George and 16-year-old daughter, who goes to school. Manana requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

George is an artisan of plastic doors and windows, but nowadays he is unemployed. Unfortunately the family is out of a source of income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Manana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Manana will begin trade with used clothing. She plans to purchase a stock of used clothing at wholesale prices and then resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trade with used clothing.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents, retired grandmother, and two sisters. Zaza’s father works as an artisan locally and his mother stays home, taking care of the family. 

Zaza has worked from an early age and sells groceries and necessities from his own store. The store is very clean and comfortable and is much-visited daily. His business profit allows Zaza to help his parents with the household expenses, but the store needs more financial support for further development. 

Zaza’s plan now is to continue working on his business and to make it grow. He applied for the credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2000 will help Zaza to improve his store and increase the quantity of products. He will buy supplies such as soft-drinks, snacks, dairy products, etc., to better stock his store. He will also install an outdoor advertising banner to attract more customers. With this credit, Zaza will expand his business and increase the turnover gradually.

He hopes for and awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand his grocery store and install an outdoor advertising banner.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Maria de 74 anos de idade, solteira  e tem 4 filhos ,todos sao independente. Vive  tambem  com a sobrinha, filha dum dos filhos. Ela e negociante ha mais de 10 anos: faz a criacao de pintos, uma actividade  que aprendeu atraves duma associacao em grupo que vinha exercendo no bairro e que desidiu criar um auto emprego e que neste momento esta ser acompanhada pela  sobrinha. 
O presente emprestimo de sera aplicada para compra de pintos, vitamina,racao e bebidores para aumentar o volume do seu negocio na sua propria casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 74 years old, single and has 4 children who are all independent. She also lives with a niece, the daughter of one of her sons. She has been a trader for more than 10 years: she raises chicks, an activity she learnt through a group which used to operate in her neighbourhood. She decided to create her own business from it and is currently helped by her niece.

This loan will be used to buy chicks, vitamins, rations and water dispensers to increase the volume of her business which she runs out of her own home.

loans.use: buy chicks, vitamins, rations and water dispensers to increase the volume of her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un joven de 32 años, con 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales 2 están estudiando. En su pequeña finca de 11 manzanas cultiva maíz, frijol, cacao y café. De este último rubro tiene 4 manzanas, de las cuales ha logrado cosechar 75 y 50 quintales de café pergamino en los últimos dos ciclos de café.

Los desafíos de este pequeño productor para mejorar sus plantaciones de café son las plagas y enfermedades principalmente, por lo que para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos e insumos que le permitan garantizar el manejo adecuado de su cafetal y lograr rendimientos mayores a los obtenidos en los últimos ciclos.

Su meta en cinco años es contar con 3 manzanas más de café y tener una producción de 200 quintales de café pergamino; para lograrla está convencido que necesita recursos para inversión y continuar trabajando de manera semi-tecnificada sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young man who is 32 years old, with 3 children aged 14, 12 and 3, 2 of whom are in school. On his small, 19.25 acre piece of land, he grows corn, beans, cocoa and coffee. Of this last crop he has 7 acres, from which has managed to harvest 7,500 and 5,000 lbs of dried coffee beans in the last two cycles of coffee. 

This small producer faces various challenges to improving his coffee plantations, mainly in the form of pests and diseases, so in this cycle he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and raw materials that will allow him to ensure the proper management of his coffee plantation and to achieve higher yields than those obtained in previous cycles.

His goal is to have an additional 5.25 acres of coffee and to have a production of 20,000 lbs of dried coffee beans within five years. To achieve this he is convinced he needs the resources for investment and to continue working on his plantations using semi-technical methods.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and raw materials that will allow him to ensure the proper management of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es ama de casa  pero  eso no le impide dar apoyo  a  su esposo e hijos  en los trabajos de la siembra de granos básicos, ella relata con orgullo como su padre le enseño a realizar todas las actividades de la siembra como  fumigar, limpiar, sembrar, de servar, abonar, doblar la milpa, tapiscar  y  elaborar las tortillas (comenta con risa ), ella se desempeño desde niña en estas labores ya que su papá sufría  de fuertes dolores de espalda que le impedían realizar  la actividad 

Los insumos agrícolas como  abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas  los compra  en la ciudad, ubicada a unos 45 minutos  en pick up de donde realiza los trabajos agrícolas trasladando los insumos con gran dificultad y costos económicos por lo distante de la calle principal.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de abono, 2 litros de pesticidas que es lo que principalmente le falta para el buen desarrollo del cultivo, el resto del dinero  será utilizado para el transporte de los materiales  y  el pago  de trabajadores para realizar  las actividades de la siembra. La inversión, será realizada con la finalidad de solventara las actividades relacionadas a la siembra y obtener mejores rendimientos productivos.

El crédito  mejorara la calidad de vida familiar  ya que al tener la disponibilidad de dinero  para  la compra de los insumos obtendrán mejores resultados en el momento  de cosechar, generando  así mayores excedentes de producción para la comercialización dando mayor  oportunidad al desarrollo de los niños que están en educación básica para poder cursar al menos la educación media.    

Las proyecciones familiares, son mantener la siembra de granos básicos  y tratar de diversificar la producción esto con el fin de  tener oportunidades de ingresos para ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a housewife, but this does not stop her from supporting her husband and children with work planting basic grains.  She is proud that her father taught her how to do all of the work of farming, including fumigating, cleaning, cultivating, fertilizing, turning the corn fields, harvesting corn, and making tortillas (she says with laughter).  She has done this work since she was a child since her father suffered strong back pain that kept him from doing that work. 

She purchases farming supplies such as fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide in the city, located about 45 minutes away by truck, and brings them to where she does her farming work.  Transporting the supplies is very difficult and expensive because of the distance from the main road.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase five sacks of fertilizer, two liters of pesticides, since that is what is missing to develop her crops, as well as paying to transport her supplies and pay laborers to do cultivation work.  The investment will be realized when they finish the work related to the crops and obtain better production yields.

The loan will improve her family's quality of life since they will have money available to purchase supplies to obtain better results at the harvest.  Generating more production to sell will give more opportunities to develop her children who are in primary school so that they can at least attend middle school.

Her goals are to maintain her basic grain crops and try to diversify production so that she has opportunities for income to provide better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer, 2 liters of pesticides, pay for the transport of materials, and pay laborers to cultivate her crops.

loans.name: Yecenia Katherine

texts.es:
YECENIA tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Yecenia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas.
El sueño es tener un regadío propio para la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta ser competitivo y leer mucho.
texts.en:
Yecenia is 26 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children. She lives with her children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the "La Chonta" communal bank, which is located in the small rural settlement of La Chonta, which is part of Ventanas canton. Members work in farming and livestock.

Yecenia works in agriculture, growing corn, soy, and rice. She is requesting this loan to purchase insecticides, fertilizers, and soil amendments. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for farming. She makes her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

Yecenia's dream is to have her own irrigation system for farming. In her free time, she likes to read a lot.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, fertilizers, and soil amendments.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek and his wife live in the village of Tsakhkunk, located in the Gegharkunik region, where they are very experienced in farming and agriculture. Their children are married and live with their families separately.

Despite his age, Aghabek is full of energy, and plans to enlarge his farm, where he breeds cows, sheep, horses and chickens, This will be Aghabek’s fourth loan from Kiva. His previous loans, fully repaid, helped him to buy a truck, calves for his farm, and animal fodder; this time he plans to buy piglets and a cow. Aghabak also continues to sell meat and wool since his farm products, especially his clean and snow-white sheep-wool, are well known around their village.

Aghabek will be greatly touched and happy if Kiva lenders again support him. He promises to be responsible and punctual in his repayments, just as he has been in the past.

loans.use: To buy piglets and a cow in order to expand his farming

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is 22 years old from Gaza. Since 2008, he has owned a small grocery store. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator, ice cream, and some goods and shelves for the store.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase the amount of goods displayed and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, ice cream, and some goods and shelves for the store.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1977. She is married and has no children. Her husband works as salesman and a hairdresser. Sanaa started working trading wedding dresses and make-up ten years ago. She faced an obstacle at the beginning of her project which was to move her business from one place to another. She took make-up courses. 

Sanaa is planning to expand her project in the future by renting a store near her to launch her work. Now she is seeking a loan to buy more wedding dresses and a make-up stand.

loans.use: to buy more wedding dresses and a make-up stand.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
This is Rosaline from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is in her late thirties and is married with three children between the ages of seven years and 17 years. She began this business because she wants to create a permanent source of income.

Rosaline runs a general store; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Rosaline has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and change her family's status of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is a 48-years-old married woman with children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Katerina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, and barbed wire. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Katerina hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 27 years old  and from Gaza.
He has owned a kids clothing shop since 2010, and has one employee who helps him.
He has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electric generator and air conditioner for his shop.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator and air conditioner for his clothing shop.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila was born in 1974. She lives with her two children in Amman, Jordan. Laila started working as an artist, painting and drawing on school walls 18 years ago. She started her project as a hobby which she has done since her childhood. 

She is planning to increase the number of her paintings and sell them in showrooms. Now she is seeking a loan to buy fabrics, brushes, frame wood, oil colors and wall colors.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her artwork.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 25 years old. She is a responsible woman who works hard to have good financial standards. She lives in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. Sometimes, she suffers from a lack of money to buy what she needs. 

She would like to buy new fridge to use in her house but she doesn`t have the money. She applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances like a fridge to avoid rotting food.

loans.use: to buy home appliances like a fridge to avoid rotting food.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim was born in 1987. He is single and the youngest of his siblings. He has eight siblings, five of them are married. Ibrahim has been running a supermarket for one year. 

He is planning to expand this supermarket in the future and to add new products and let it the biggest supermarket in his area. Now he is seeking a youth loan to buy new foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy new foodstuffs.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra was born in 1981. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an employee of the government and also works as a farmer; this doesn't allow him to earn enough money to cover his children's needs. 

Yusra has been working trading blankets for four months. She found it a profitable project so she is planning to expand it in the future. To start expanding it she is requesting a loan to buy more blankets and trade them which will let her earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and trade them.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is 27 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has six children. He has owned a food stall for selling canned food since 2010. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more goods and a refrigerator. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and thus, improve his income to provide his kids with a better education.

loans.use: to buy more goods and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She operates a restaurant in the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. 

She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy bags of Irish potatoes, a bag of rice, sugar, flour and a jerrycan of cooking oil. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her goal and aspiration is to open up restaurant in the market. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bag of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo, the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 3 children, ages 8 and 28. In 2003, Salamatu established her food stock business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in this business.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days a week. She says that the main challenges of her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings, and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasoning, and palm oil.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 27 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his family which consists of five members. Saleh is studying for a Bachelor of Education and Water and Environment. He also works as a private English teacher at home. 

As Saleh is facing a financial crisis, he is requesting a loan to pay his study fees in order to be able to work in his field of study after his graduation.

loans.use: To pay his study fees.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children aged between 7 years and 25 years.  

In 2001, Salamatu established her general rice business within a busy market area. She began her business because she got married at a younger age, and she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to a big food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Hadeya

texts.en: Hadeya was born in 1972. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in a shipping company. Hadeya has been working in trading clothes and putting beads on clothes and embroidery since three years ago. She started her project at home. Hadeya attended a women's improvement center in the past, as she got benefit from it. In order to expand her project, Hadeya is requesting a loan to buy a bead machine.

loans.use: To buy a bead machine.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 53-year-old woman from Ambrolauri district. She lives with her husband, Eldar. They both are unemployed. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live under poverty.  

According to the above-mentioned situation, Manana lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Manana to get a loan of $1,000 and open a grocery shop. She will purchase a stock of merchandise such as groceries and household goods.  

Manana thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Manana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Jivia

texts.es:
Jivia, es una mujer de 37 años. Como madre soltera cuida con mucho amor de sus 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, en su casa propia de material rústico. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, se dirige al puesto de comidas regionales que tiene a orillas del puente, donde vende desde hace 8 años sus distintos productos además de refrescos preparados a base de fruta fresca. Según menciona los días sábado y domingos recibe buena cantidad de ingresos económicos y su mayor ambición es poder mejorar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan solventar los gastos de sus hijos, pues la pensión económica que recibe de parte del que fue su esposo, no le alcanza para poder brindarles una buena educación. Es así que ahora su misión es el trabajo arduo. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Jivia, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de frutas tales como naranja, mandarina , entre otros y verduras para preparar sus refrescos y comidas.
texts.en: Jivia is a 37-year-old woman. As a single mother, she cares for her 4 children, all of them minors, with a lot of love in her own house made of rustic materials. Starting very early every morning, she goes to the regional foods stall she has at the edge of the bridge, where for 8 years she has sold her different products as well as fresh fruit-based soft drinks. She says that on Saturdays and Sundays she earns a good income. Her greatest ambition is to be able to improve her business in order to earn more money that will allow her to cover her children's expenses, since the child support she receives from her ex-husband is not enough to be able to give them a good education. Thus her mission is now hard work. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to move ahead. She also promises to make her loan repayments on time. Jivia will use the 2000 soles to buy fruits such as oranges and mandarins, among others, and vegetables to make her soft drinks and food.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to make her soft drinks and food.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El banco comuna El buen pastor está conformado por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Daneysis es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, café, azúcar, detergente, leche, huevos, jugos, pan. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en  un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal EL buen Pastor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Buen Pastor” (The Good Shepherd) consists of eight members, seven women and one man. They are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. These individuals are known as hardworking and responsible people who have the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children. Unfortunately, due to the a lack of financial resources, they were not able to attend school and were obligated to work at a young age.

Daneysis is the coordinator of the Communal Bank. Her business is a store that is located in her home. She sells food and other products in small quantities such as rice, beans, coffee, sugar, detergent, milk, eggs, juices, and bread. Daneysis works at her business approximately 12 hours each day by offering her products. Her loan will be invested as operating capital for her business of buying and selling food products. In the not-so-distant future, she hopes to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “El Buen Pastor” is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders have provided to low-income people from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent form of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, detergent, milk, eggs, juices, and bread.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
For over five years, Mwaka has operated a business selling clothes from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, that she is requesting she wants to purchase a bale of kids' clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of three months and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Rugiatu established her plastic-rubber business. She began her business because she wants to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes the bowls break in transport. 

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers and plates to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers and plates to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 55 years old, widowed, and lives with her grown son in the capital city, Tbilisi. She works as a cleaner in the Kids store and gets a small monthly salary. Her son is an artisan and works on special orders. The existing income is only enough to cover everyday expenses. So Nana decided to start up a grocery store to increase the family income but she needs financial support to implement her plan. 

Unfortunately, Nana lacks access to financial institutions to obtain credit to start a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so called Start-up Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 1,200 $ Nana will purchase basic groceries to set up a grocery store. She will take care of her clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this assistance, she expects to improve her income and increase the turnover gradually. Nana will work hard to tackle her financial difficulties and make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 53-year-old Isatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children aged between ten years and 28 years.  In 2005, Isatu established her fried fish and cassava-bread business. She began her business because she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes vehicles break down on the way. 

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish and cassava. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business to a ground nut store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cassava.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Uganda, Kampala and is married with six children; five of her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses. 

She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 500,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van to transport charcoal to market. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Nongpok Ningthou Shg Group

texts.en:
“Our group believes unity is strength,” says Subadani. She is one of the members of Nongpok Ningthou Group. She is the featured borrower member for the group, and she is pictured with a raised hand. 

The group comprises seven women members, and all of them are quarry workers. Besides running their businesses to supplement their income, all the group members joined hands for renting the land for a quarry and generating income by sand-sieving. The other group members are also engaged in weaving and tailoring, also during the off-season of sand-sieving. Subadani says to earn as a hired quarry worker, the pay is very little. Therefore, the group members contributed equally for the rented plot and manage to earn a better income.

Subadani runs a shop which is located on the front side of her house plot, which is adjacent to the main lane in the village. She sells betel nuts, betel leaves, potatoes, various cereals, sugar, tea leaves, edible oils, ginger, onions and all essential daily items. With the meager income, she also shares the family expenses with her husband, who is a driver by profession. 

She usually gets the supplies from the main market and sells them in the village with a little profit. She says that during farming season, sales go down because most of her customers are farmers or daily wage-earners. Therefore, she also closes her shop for a time and engages herself along with the other group members and starts quarry work. With the income from both the shop and the quarry, she opened a bank account and started saving. She also joined a savings group along with the other group members.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase coated jewelry and summer garments. She will sell them in the shop and also take them door to door. She says the place where she lives is mostly inhabited by Meetei people, and these people use jewelry for many occasions and rituals. She wanted to sell them before the festive season starts. In both ways, jewelry and garments can be sold with the same purpose. 

Subadani thanked Kiva and WSDS. She says, “God helps those who helps themselves, and our group is a very hardworking group. Kiva and WSDS are a blessing in disguise. God bless the organization.”

loans.use: to purchase more stock of low-cost jewelry and summer garments for sale.

loans.name: Maria Victorina

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, papas, ejotes, chiles entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Maria  es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Maria asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home with her four children. She makes a living by buying and selling fruits and vegetables like strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, green beans, chilies, etc. She has been working this activity for many years, and it has given her a lot of sales experience which allows her to earn more money.

The place where she sells her goods is very strategic for this business and is also very crowded with people. She has many customers who prefer her business because the products are fresh, well-priced, high quality, and her service is excellent.

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her work, and wants to move forward. She is always looking for ways that will allow her to achieve success. 

In the last few week, demand has risen and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. Maria promises that she will be able to pay the debt and she also says that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, green beans, chilies, etc.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Mariama from Waterloo in rural western Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 12. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2011, Mariama established her business selling food containers. She began her business because she wanted to earn income to support her household. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and change her status of living. In the future, Mariama plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un pequeño productor de Nicaragua, que vive junto a su esposa y 4 hijos en su finca de 7 manzanas. En esta siembra maíz, frijoles, malanga coco y café. De este último rubro tiene 3 manzanas y en los últimos 3 ciclos ha cosechado un promedio de 30 quintales de café pergamino. Este rubro le genera el 80% de sus ingresos anuales, por lo que para él y su familia es mucha importancia, siendo su meta incrementar el área de este cultivo con variedades resistentes a las plagas y enfermedades. 

Para este ciclo 2013-2014, Francisco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de foleos y fungicidas que le permitan dar el mantenimiento adecuado a su cafetal, y obtener un incremento de al menos el 50% en su producción. El está seguro que con su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación a su finca podrá mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a small producer in Nicaragua, who lives with his wife and 4 children on his 7 manzana (about 12.2 acres) estate.
This season he will be sowing corn, beans, malanga coco (a root similar to taro) and coffee.  He has 3 manzanas (5.2 acres) of coffee crops and in the last 3 loans he has garnered an average of 30 quintals (300 pounds) of parchment (pergamino) coffee. This crop generates 80% of their annual income, which is very important for him and his family. His goal is to increase the area of this crop with varieties that are resistant to pests and sickness.

For the 2013-2014 loan, Francisco is requesting a loan to purchase fungicides and foliar fertilizers which would enable him to properly maintain his coffee crop and increase it by least 50%. He is confident that with his work, effort and dedication to his estate, he will be able to improve his income and the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase foliar fertilizers and fungicides to properly maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Vinicio

texts.es: Vinicio es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son maíz y frijol adicional a eso también cultiva caña de azúcar. Vinicio  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Vinicio is a very responsible man with household obligations. He currently lives with his wife and their three children. He is a very hard worker. He works in agriculture, growing the main staple grains of the region, like corn and beans. He also grows sugar cane.

Vinicio would like to increase his sales, so he visited INTEGRAL's offices to request a loan that will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land where he would like to grow crops, which is the land that is shown in the photo.

He would like to count on the help that he has requested since he does not have another source of income. This way, he will be able to continue to bring home the day's bread without any problems.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Malom Panthoibi Shg Group

texts.en:
"At work, you think of the children you have left at home. At home, you think of the work you've left unfinished. Such a struggle is unleashed within yourself and your heart is rent," says Ibemcha, who is the featured borrower member of the Malom Panthoibi SHG Group.  

Her life moved fast with an early marriage, and her husband left this world, leaving behind three kids in Ibemcha’s hands. Her husband used to be a quarry labourer during his time, which Ibemcha continues after her husband died. She is illiterate, and that paralyzes her to get a job but earned through hard manual work. She tried all possible means to manage her family’s financial expenses. She ploughs at others' farms and weaves to generate income, so that she could send her three kids to school and let them finish their education. That was her husband’s wish, and she is determined to fulfill it against all odds.

Ibemcha makes her living by working on the river bank, where she sieves sand, stones and pebbles. She usually works as a paid labourer and is paid only the labour charge. After she joined the group and availed a loan, she could contribute a share to rent land, although it was small in size. She started earning more with the surplus income after selling the sand, pebbles, soil and stones from the rented land. She purchased school uniforms, and gave admission fees and school fees, and also manages the family expenses. 

During the rainy season, she weaves all types of traditional attire for both men and women, and sells the finished products for profit to the women vendors in the city market. With the small profit, she could do some savings and also managed to join a savings group. Her one wish was fulfilled after the inception of the group’s formation, and she could have a share in the group savings. 

With the Kiva loan, Ibemcha is planning to contribute a share to rent a bigger plot of land for quarry purposes. She and her group decided to use the loan and their savings to rent a bigger plot of land for the said purpose. She said that just the loan is not sufficient because they require small and large cranes to excavate the land for sieving purposes. Therefore, they will utilize the group savings for a better outcome.

Her dream is to let all her three children complete their education and get a job on their own.

The rest of the group members are also quarry labourers and engage themselves in weaving and tailoring when they don’t work at the quarry sites.

Ibemcha thanked Kiva and WSDS for the help, and wishes them good luck, happiness and prosperity.

loans.use: to rent a larger plot of land for sand-sieving purposes for a bigger income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora de 40 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad. Su negocio es la venta de nacatamales desde hace 1 año, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad y quiere iniciar con una  pequeña pulperia en su domicilio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima de sus productos como hojas, mecates, quintal de maíz  carne de cerdo, sal, papas, achiotes, ajo, vegetales, arroz, leñas y para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, chiverías, papel higiénico, champo, etc.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who is 40 years of old, married, and has two children (ages 14 and 4). She has been in the business of selling Nicaraguan tamales for one year. Her products are sold in her community and she also wants to start a small general store in her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her products such as leaves, twine, corn, pork, salt, potatoes, annatto, garlic, vegetables, rice, and firewood. She will also buy basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, yogurt, toilet paper, shampoo, and other products.

loans.use: to buy leaves, twine, corn, pork, salt, potatoes, annatto, garlic, vegetables, rice, firewood, rice, beans, oil, sugar, yogurt, toilet paper, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Kerly Maria

texts.es:
KERLY tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y con el esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC LA CHONTA, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO LA CHONTA, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

Kerly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, herbicidas, insumos, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es comprar terrenos para la siembra de maíz.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Kerly, 27, lives in a free union and has four children, who live with her and her husband in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank La Chonta, located in La Chonta in Ventanas canton. She farms and fishes. 

Kerly grows corn and soybeans. She has applied for a loan to buy insecticide, herbicide, supplies, and fertilizer. She will be able to buy everything she needs for her crops with the loan, and she will make her purchases in Ventanas. She dreams of buying land to plant corn. She like to play indoor soccer in her free time.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, herbicide, supplies, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: María, tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su padre y una sobrina en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa. Hace 6 meses ha iniciado con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta de palma africana. Esta fruta la vende en las procesadoras de aceite a través de intermediarios. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más productos de fruta de palma para reventa. Con esta inversión va poder incrementar las ventas y crecer con el negocio. Su plan es mejorar los ingresos para tener bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
María, 41, is single and lives with her father and a niece in Esparta, Atlántida. She used to sell clothing. Six months ago, she began a business, selling African palm fruit. The fruit is sold to oil processors through dealers.

She has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy palm fruit to resell. She will be able to increase sales and grow her business with this investment. She plans to improve her and her family's well being with the higher income.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit to sell.

loans.name: Oscar  Alcides

texts.es: Oscar de 38 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad, comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Oscar solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Oscar, 38, is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife and two children. He works very hard on his own land, where he grows corn and beans. His crops are high quality, and he sells them in local markets.

Oscar has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizer, manure, and seed that he needs for planting. He hopes to increase his sales and income and give his family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizer, manure, seed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 23 años,  es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre junta solo ella. Carlos se dedica a la venta de comidas para eso tiene un pequeño puesto, lleva realizando este negocio cerca de 11 meses iniciándose por la necesidad económica con el apoyo de su mamá. Le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina, logrando vender y acabar lo que prepara, gracias a eso tiene buenas ganancias, ahora proyectándose desea ampliar su negocio y en un futuro abrir un restaurante. Esto será el primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto de 700 nuevos soles desea invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 23, is single and lives in his mother's house. Carlos operates a small food stand, a business he began 11 months ago with his mother's support so that he could earn a living. He enjoys his business because he knows how to cook. He earns a good living because he sells everything he prepares. He wants to expand his business and one day open a restaurant.

This is his first loan cycle with Kiva, and he hopes the collaboration will allow him to firm up his plans. He wants to use the loan of 700 nuevos soles to buy needed ingredients to prepare his food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food he sells.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es: Don ángel de 53 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el arroz comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, Don ángel esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  y así poder tener mejores ganancias y para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángel, who is 53 years old, has worked in agriculture for several years; this has given him the skills and knowledge necessary to tend to his crops. His main crop is rice. He sells his harvests in grain agencies that are close to his place of residence. With the earnings that he obtains from his sales, he manages to cover some of his household costs. 

Ángel lives with his wife and their five children. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies that will help him in the planting of his crops, such as soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. This will enable him to have better earnings so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Fatmata from Tombo in western rural Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages 10 years and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Fatmata established her food-container business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is traveling to the provinces to exchange food containers for chickens or gallons of palm oil because it is very difficult.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers and plates for resale.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 29 years old. He lives in the Rustavi District with his parents and his 22-year-old brother. Tengiz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tengiz works as a baker at a local bakery and gets a small income of 400 GEL in a month. This is the only source of income for their family, as other family members are unemployed. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tengiz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Tengiz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Tengiz will renovate his minibus and purchase new tires. As the minibus is renovated, Tamaz will rent it out and get additional income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate his minibus and rent it out.

loans.name: Morine

texts.en:
Morine lives in Kampala, Uganda, and is single with three children.  All her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members.

She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years and she works seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Rebecca from Waterloo in the western rural area of Freetown. She is single with 1 child age 6 years. She began this business because she dropped out of school and she needed to create income to support herself.

In 2010, Rebecca established her slipper business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Rebecca requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and try to attend a vocational school. In the future, Rebecca plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business

loans.name: Nupi Lup Group

texts.en:
Lata is the featured borrower member of the Nupi Lup Group. The literal meaning of "Nupi Lup" is “Women Group”, and all the group members are married women. Lata is pictured with her hand raised. 

Lata is a weaver and started weaving at an early age, and that was before her marriage. She studied to the primary level and cannot continue further, due to family financial problems. She learned to weave from her mother, and now uses her talent to generate income for the family. 
 
Lata says she usually weaves for others and gets paid only for the labour charge, which is a huge loss for a weaver. She could have generated more income if the thread and yarn were provided by herself. She could sell her work in the village or to the businesswomen who deal with woven products and sell them in the marketplace in the main market. She also gets the threads and yarns from shop owners on credit, and gives them back once she sells the woven products in the market. A small portion of the amount is left for Lata at the end of the whole process. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase yarn and threads for weaving. She will weave them and sell the woven products to the women vendors who sell woven garments in the main market. Through this activity, she could manage a monthly savings, and tension will be lifted for purchasing yarn and threads. 

She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the financial help, and says she will always remain thankful. God bless Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and threads to weave, and then sell the woven products to the women vendors in the market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with two children. He grew up in Thika, a town on the outskirts of Nairobi, but moved to the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi about ten years ago in search of better work opportunities. Over the past ten years, Peter has established himself as a businessman who owns several rental houses in Mukuru.

Due to the need for better sanitation facilities at his houses, Peter is seeking a loan to help finance the purchase of one Fresh Life Toilet. This toilet will be used by his tenants as a better sanitation center compared to the existing facilities. He also wishes to use the Fresh Life Toilet as a means to attract more tenants to his houses.

To Peter, the purchase of a Fresh Life Toilet for his tenants is not only a good means to market his property; this initiative also serves as a way for him to give back to the community by providing better sanitation for the residents of this area.
