loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Jane   S

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Jane from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 1 child age 6 years.  She began her business because she wants to create her own source of income instead of depending on her husband.

In 2000, Jane established her general stock business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Jane requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks and milk. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and buy a piece of land. In the future, Jane plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks, and milk

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijas, los cuales tienen edades de 7 y 15 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de comida y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar , lo realiza de forma independiente y le ayuda su sobrina, este oficio lo desempeña de 6:00am a 7:00pm y lo aprendió de su familia, ventaja que posee es que conoce bien del negocio y no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cocina térmica, asimismo pollo, carnes, verduras, condimentos y productos del hogar; esta inversión le ayudara  a brindarles una atención más eficaz y eficiente a sus clientes.
Su sueño es crecer más en su negocio y adquirir un local más amplio para poder vender más. Asimismo brindarle ayuda a sus hijas para que logren obtener su carrera universitaria  y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother and lives with her two daughters, who are 7 and 15 years old. She doesn't have any relatives living abroad. She works selling food and basic household products, which she does on her own and with the help of her niece. She performs this work from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm, and she learned it from her family. One advantage that she has is that she knows the business well and it doesn't pose any problem. 

The loan that she needs will allow her to purchase a buffet-style food warmer, as well as chicken, meats, vegetables, condiments, and household products. This investment will help her to bring a more effective and efficient service to her customers.

Her dream is to grow more in her business and to acquire a more spacious location so that she can sell more. She would also like to provide help to her daughters so that they can succeed in obtaining a university degree and to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a buffet-style food warmer, as well as chicken, meat, vegetables, condiments, and household products.

loans.name: Carpinteria Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias  empresarias una de ellas es Carmen mujer de 55 años, soltera madre de 4 hijos adultos su negocio es la venta de leña y una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa, sus hijos le ayudan en conseguir la leña para luego comercializarla, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de mercadería como zapatos de varón, zapatos de damas, zapatos de niños, y también compra de leñas por maquetas para luego distribuirlas al detalle, Teresa es otra integrante su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y tiene 53 años y Blanca tiene 52 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa variada, zapatos de damas, perfumen etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is Carmen, a 55-year-old woman and single mother to four adult children. Her business is the sale of firewood and a small grocery store located in her house. Her children help her to get the firewood to later sell. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise like men's shoes, women's shoes, children's shoes, and also to buy wood for models to sell at retail. 

Teresa is another member. Her business is the sale of Avon cosmetics, and she is 53 years old. Blanca is 52 years old and her business is the sale of various clothing, women's shoes, perfume, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of men's shoes, women's shoes, children's shoes, wood for models, etc.

loans.name: Vonyee

texts.en:
Vonyee lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba County is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Vonyee is 49 years old, She stopped her education after the sixth grade. She has eight children, only five of whom are in school. With a little money from her older sister, she established her business. She learned to sell from friends. She has been selling lappa (traditional clothes mostly used by African women) for the past eight years. She spends nine hours on her business each day, running her business from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. Her plan is one day to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothes mostly used by African women)

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 22-year-old single man. He has been working in the construction field since 2010. His work is specialized in floor covering. He also works at a local restaurant as a delivery man. Hasan works really hard to earn a good income and be able to live in good conditions, although today, he is in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a minivan. He states that the minivan will make his transportation easier to projects and will even allow him to stick with additional businesses which will return him a higher income. In the future, Hasan wishes to focus on one job and be able to build a good career and therefore enhance his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan to get to construction projects.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children who are still attending school. He is a contractor, working in this occupation for the past 13 years. He works on a freelance basis, responding rapidly to customers' demands. 

With his requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., he will purchase products needed for his work such as cement. Ahmad intends to reinforce his operation and expand his business with the aim of gaining higher income to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase products needed for his work such as cement.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Zainab from Waterloo, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with three children aged between 3 years and 10 years. In 2010, Zainab established her food stock business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in business. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Gilma Ines

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 45 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Gilma se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos t cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceado de engorde y crianza de pollos y polvillo para los cerdos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo poder superarse para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es trabajar este año para mejorar la condición de vida de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce los fines de semana en la casa con toda la familia.
texts.en:
Gilma is 45 years old, single and has three children. She lives with her family in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province.

She is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank located in Recinto Calabi, which is part of Ventanas canton. The members work in agriculture. 

Gilma farms, growing corn and raising chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers, manures, balanced chicken feed and feed for pigs.

She purchases the products she needs in the city of Ventanas every two weeks. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy supplies.

She faces challenges such as being able to better herself and improve her family's well-being. Her dream is to work this year to improve her family's living conditions. 

In her free time she likes to get together on weekends at home with the whole family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers, manures, balanced chicken feed, and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Chaokhat Shg Group

texts.en:
Chaokhat Group was formed recently by six hardworking women from a village. The village is about 40 kms from the main city of Manipur, which is one of the Northeastern States of India. The literal meaning of “Chaokhat” is “prosperity”. The group members join hands to prosper and encourage one another. 

Ranjana is the featured borrower, and she is pictured with her hand raised.  Ranjana’s husband is a paid driver. He is presently working as a paid driver for the district legislature. Managing the household expenses is difficult for Ranjana because she had two kids who study in private schools. The administration in the government schools in town is in fallout, and school kids are given less importance. Ranjana uses all means to supplement the family income. She weaves, quarries, and also runs a tea stall. 

Ranjana’s tea stall is located near the roadside of the village where they live. She wanted to run the tea stall at the main town market, but that is not possible at the moment. She needs a license from the town municipality department for registration. The tea stall is open at dawn for school-going kids, and she prepares toast, puris and fried potatoes, and serves the customers the morning breakfast. During the daytime, she prepares lemon tea, sugar-free tea, and milked tea for village elders. She usually closes the tea stall by 4:00 pm every day and does not run business on Sundays. 

During the farming and harvesting seasons, most of the villagers are in the field, and very few customers are left. Therefore, she and the rest of the group members engage themselves in quarrying. She sieves sand, pebbles and soil, and earns a wage. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase stocks of wheat, bags of flour, and edible oils for her tea shop. The small earnings are usually spent on the children’s education, such as fees, uniforms and textbooks. Ranjana is typically left with no capital to run the tea stall with abundant supplies, due to a small income and everyday household expenses. She is planning to make more income by selling more local delicacies when she purchases the stocks. 

Ranjana is planning to have her own vendor seat at the town market shed with a proper license in the future. She will save money as hard as she can, and will also pay back the loan regularly. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for fulfilling what she had desired for so long. 

The rest of the group members also quarry and weave for earning.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, bags of flour, and cans of edible oils for her tea shop.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 29-years-old and live in Sanniquille the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in nature resources, living conditions are much better than the capital city, and is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She completed fourth grade, and she is single and has four children between 12 to 9 years old. Three of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

Five years ago, with the little money she received from her mother, she was able to establish her business by running a table market where she sells palm, oil, vita and pepper. She spends nine hours a day on her business and faces no other problem except fewer goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm, oil, vita, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to one day move from a table business to a shop business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm, oil, vita and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en: Watfa is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. After gaining 20 years of experience working as a tailor, she decided in 2000 to start her own work from her home.  She is a talented tailor producing stunning and attractive designs. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase textiles to extend her production and therefore earn superior income. Watfa is very positive and she hopes to be able to open her own tailoring factory soon.

loans.use: to purchase textiles.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for 2 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated that milk vending is what he finds most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is disease outbreaks. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Lelkina, and The Black.

Mark was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "My group members informed me of Juhudi Kilimo's asset financing, which has low interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He replied, "The modern ways of dairy keeping."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked he said that this loan would help his family by expanding the number of cows he owns. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mark owns a cow and poultry, but does not own  a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in his house, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francisco Efrain

texts.es:
FRANCISCO tiene 49 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas. 

FRANCISCO se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para cuidar los cultivos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desfíos son los precios de la competencia. El sueño es que nunca le falte el dinero para dar una buena educacion al hijo. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar con la familia por el campo.
texts.en: Francisco, 49, is in a common-law marriage and has one son. He lives with his wife and son in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. He is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank, which is in the Calabi precinct in Ventanas canton. They work in agriculture. Francisco works in agriculture, planting corn. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and manure to care for the crops. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas. With the help from the loan, he will be able to buy the supplies. He faces challenges like the prices of the competition. His dream is to never lack the money to give his son a good education. In his free time, he like to walk with his family through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and manure to care for the crops.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 49-years-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 16 years and 30 years. She began this business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income.

Aminata runs a general stock where she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. She has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and change her family's standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Sento from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She started her business to get her daily survival for herself.
 
Sento runs a local food business and she sells cake from her house. She has been running this business for one year. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days.   Sento says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Sento has requested a loan in order to purchase food items such as cooking seasoning, oil and flour. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living. In the future, she plans to have good health. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items such as cooking seasoning, oil and flour.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 21-year-old Isatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is single with a child who is aged 4 years. Isatu started business to get her daily survival for herself.
 
Isatu runs a fast-food business; she sells roast meat around her community and she has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business every day from morning to night. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and beef. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to further her education. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and beef.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Mariama from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. In 2001, Mariama established her general ground nut business. She began her business because she was trained in business at an early age. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of ground nuts for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business to a ground nut store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Yedi's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising women who are in the business of selling provisions, clothing, minerals, and underwear. 
One of them is Comfort, who is 34 and married to 40-year-old Bright, who is a driver, with whom she has two children. Comfort has been selling clothing for 3 years through hawking and the customers appreciate her because she is time conscious and has good customer care strategy. This is her first loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she is requesting a loan of GHS 500 to buy one bale of second hand clothing.
The other members of the group are 29-year-old Regina, who sells minerals, 33-year-old Theresa, who sells provisions, and 20-year-old Susuana, who sells underwear.

loans.use: To buy one bale of second hand clothing

loans.name: Bess

texts.es:
Bess tiene 23 años, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo y su única hija. Bess se dedica a la venta de granos como arroz, fréjol, trigo, etc. en un local ubicado en su propia casa. Tiene más de 05 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su pareja es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos de su hogar, además de poder estar en la comodidad de su casa. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio buscando hacerlo crecer. Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. 
Con el monto de 700 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, fréjol, trigo, y otros para vender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bess is 23 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and her only daughter. 

Bess works selling grains like rice, beans, wheat, etc., in a shop located in her home. She has been working in this business for more than five years. So far, her husband is the one who helps her most by tending to customers. She likes this business because it generates a consistent economic income that she uses to pay for household costs, while enabling her to be in the comfort of her home. She considers her business worthwhile because of the good earnings it allows her, so she has plans to continue in her business and to try to make it grow. 

This will be Bess's first loan with Kiva, so she is waiting for your support so that she can make her plans a reality. With the amount of 700 nuevos soles [PEN], she will invest in the purchase of grains like rice, beans, wheat, and others to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice, beans, and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años siembra frijol y maíz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The client has worked in agriculture for eight years. He plants beans and corn and with the sales from his harvests, he is able to meet the expenses of his household. He is a responsible, honest, and hard-working man. He lives with his partner in his own home. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies for his harvest like: fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc, since what he earns is not enough to cover those expenses. He can have more income and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is a 40-year-old married man from Gori district. He lives with his wife, his 14-year-old son and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Nugzar has previously requested loans several times from local financial institutions in order to start up a family business but without any success. His loan requests have been rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nugzar’s wife works at a local printing house and gets a small monthly income. Nugzar is involved in salt distribution, But nowadays he has stopped because of a lack of salt to distribute. Nugzar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low income. 

With the received credit Nugzar will purchase a large stock of salt. After the salt is purchased he will wrap it into small packages to sell. As the stock will be increased, this will increase the realization and sales of salt. The start-up program will significantly improve the living conditions of their family thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of salt to wrap into small packages to sell.

loans.name: Kimaiyo

texts.en:
Kimaiyo lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has 5 children and has been doing milk production work for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and personal business.

Kimaiyo stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'milking'. His biggest challenge is 'marketing of his farm products.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'mur kuut.'

Kimaiyo was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'low interest rates'. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'proper record keeping.'

Kimaiyo's highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Kimaiyo replied 'increased food production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kimaiyo owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 6 and 10 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Mamusu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Mamusu says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Mamusu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Sento is 30 years old and married with 2 children between 6 and 13 years. She runs a palm oil business in Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She started business because she wants to educate her children. 

Sento has been in this business for 5 years and sells palm oil at a particular market place. She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business, and transportation problems.  

Sento requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Stella from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 11 and 16 years. Her children are attending school. 

Stella runs a television business; she sells used televisions and used shoes. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. Stella says that the main challenge to her business is an improper business location.

Stella has requested a loan in order to purchase used televisions and used shoes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase used televisions and used shoes for resale.

loans.name: Darwin Rolando

texts.es:
DARWIN tiene 34 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Darwin se dedica a la agricutlura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es comprar más terreno para la siembra. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos.
texts.en: Darwin, 34, is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province. He is a member of the La Chonta communal bank, which is located in the La Chonta precinct in the Ventanas canton. They work in agriculture and ranching. Darwin works in agriculture, planting corn, soy, and rice. He is asking for the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and herbicides. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for farming. His dream is to buy more land for planting. In his free time, he likes to take care of his crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Las Doradas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres integrantes, Dania tiene 36 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y ropa nueva y variada, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio y anteriormente se dedicaba trabajar a empresas privadas, tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de paca de pantalón jeans, paca de ropa de niño y paca mixta, Mariana tiene 56 años y su negocio es una pulpería e Isabel tiene 50 años y su negocio es la de un taller de costura  y una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three members. Dania is 36. Her business is the sales of new and used clothing. She has owned her business for 4 years and previously she worked in private businesses. She has been a client of the institution for 4 years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of bundled clothing - a bundle of jeans, a bundle of children's clothing and a mixed bundle. 

Mariana is 56 and she owns a convenience store. Isabel is 50 and she owns a sewing shop and a convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase bundled clothing - a bundle of jeans, a bundle of children's clothing and a mixed bundle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sarah from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with 4 children between the age of 3 and 14 years. She began this business because she dropped out from school and she needed to create income to support herself. In 2010, Sarah established her slipper business. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Sarah plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband, infant child and her mother in their home, located in the town of Kutaisi. Eka’s husband is a worker at the local confectionery and her mother works as a saleslady in the supermarket. Eka is unemployed at the moment, but she has a great desire to start a business and have a stable income.

As the existing family revenue is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Eka decided to start up a grocery store, but she needs financial support to implement her plan. Unfortunately, Eka lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of $3000 Eka will purchase stocks of basic groceries such as dairy products, beverages, hygienic items etc, and provide her clients with a wide assortment of production. The Kiva loan will be a great support for Eka to increase the turnover gradually and generate income.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Saffie from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Her children are currently attending school. In 2009, Saffie established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Saffie requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Saffie plans to open a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials to expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Mary from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no children for now. She has two additional dependents at home. She began this business because she wanted have a permanent source of income to take care of her parents.

Mary runs a cosmetics business within a busy market area. She sells creams, powders, perfumes, and baby oil. She has been running this business since 2 years ago. She works at the business from 8:00am to 6:00pm. At present she is facing insufficient capital to run her business.

Mary has requested a loan in order to purchase more cosmetics like creams, powders, and perfumes. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent residence with her family and increase her business. 

In the future she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics like creams, powders, and perfumes.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. In 2001 Mariatu established her general ground nut business. She began her business because she got married at a younger age and she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of ground nuts for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. 

In the future Mariatu plans to expand her business to a ground nut store level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. 

She has requested from MCDT–SACCO a loan of 600,000 UGX to buy a bag of beans, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and soap. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her goal and aspiration is to transform her retail shop into a wholesale shop and also to build a house. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a bag of beans, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wood to make crates.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: El Sr. Julián tiene 49 años,   tiene un hijo de la edad de 13 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, el se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y galletas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería El Sr. Julián enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Julián is 49 years old. He has a son who is 13 years old and of school age. He sells basic necessity items in his neighborhood store, which is in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. This loan is his first from this institution. He is going to use this loan to purchase merchandise to stock up his business such as groceries, sweets, and cookies. His reason for requesting this loan is that he has much demand and is going to use this to increase his sales. He needs to stock his store. Julian faces challenges in his business, which are the competition, because there are several other stores in the area. He is going to use the loan to purchase more merchandise for stocking his store and continue growing more each day. He wants his business to continue selling and to have a stocked-up store so that he will be able to grow his business to improve his revenues and ultimately improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase candies, beverages, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Santos Anastacio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura tarea que fue aprendida por sus padres, y antes de trabajar en la agricultura, trabajo en un beneficio de café, vive con su esposa e hijos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para desplazarse hacia la ciudad, donde compra los insumos agrícolas, por lo cual tiene que pagar el trasporte para que se lo lleven a su casa. El siguiente día se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para trasladar los productos hacia donde tiene su cultivo y aplicarlo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar seis sacos de abono, herbicidas y plaguitas y sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la compra de los insumos para su cultivo, espera tener una buena producción y no incurrir en perdidas. Además, de abastecer de maíz a toda su familia y generar ingresos para hogar con la venta de una parte de la cosecha. 


Él desea cuidar a sus hijos y darles lo necesario para que sean personas de provecho para la comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old, married, and has three children. For 20 years, he has worked in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. Before working in agriculture, he worked with coffee. He lives with his wife and children. He gets up at 5 am to go into the city, where he purchases farming supplies, which he pays for and takes back home. The next day he gets up at 4:30 am to take those supplies to his farmland and use them.

The loan that he is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Campo is to purchase six sacks of compost, herbicides, and pesticides and plant 7,000 square meters of corn. By purchasing these supplies, he hopes to have good production and not incur any losses. Also, he wants to supply his whole family with corn and generate revenue for his household by selling part of his harvest.

He wants to care for his children and give them what they need to be well-off people in the community.

loans.use: purchase six sacks of compost, herbicides, and pesticides and plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Jessica Jacinta

texts.es:
JESSICA tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil divorsiada tiene 2 hijos , vive con los padres y el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

JESSICA se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos y pago de mano de obra.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá tener mejores ingresos y comprar lo necesario para la produccion.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las plagas y la lancha. El sueño es viajar en avion. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasiar con la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and divorced. She has two children. She lives with her parents and son in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of VRC Bruniquilde communal bank, which is located in Recinto Calabi, in the canton of Ventanas. They work in agriculture.

Jessica works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, urea fertilizer, and compost, and pay for a helping hand.

The purchases will be made in the city of Ventanas. With the help of the loan, she will be able to have better revenues and purchase what she needs for production.

Challenges face her, such as plagues and other infestations. Her dream is to travel in an airplane. In her free time, she likes to go out with her family and play sports.

loans.use: purchase supplies, urea fertilizers, and compost, and pay for a helping hand.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan Angel, tiene 50 años, esta casado, tiene 8 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos ayudándole a su padre. Hace 10 años que tiene su propio cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles. La producción es vendida en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Su objetivo es tener una mejor producción para aumentar las ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Juan Angel is 50 years old. He is married, has eight children, and lives in a village in the municipality of Proteccion, Santa Barbara. He always has worked in farming basic grains, helping his father. For 10 years, he has had his own crops of coffee, corn, and beans. The harvest is sold in the local market. The loan that he has requested is for 10,000 Lempiras, and he will invest this in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers to maintain his crops. His goal is to have a better production to increase his revenues and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: purchase supplies and fertilizers for farming coffee, corn, and beans.

loans.name: El Trillo Group

texts.es: Este grupo de empresarios formado por tres socias una de ellas es Guadalupe tiene 52 años, soltera con un hijo mayor de 29 años, tiene 15 años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio, quienes le ayudan en el negocio es su hermano, su papa y ella que los administran, lo invertirán en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de  res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, cosméticos de la Avon como crema, crema para  manos, cremas para   cuerpos, cremas faciales, etc. Luisa tiene 59 años y su negocio es la venta de chiverías, zapatos de cuero y Yelba tiene una pulpería en su casa.
texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs is formed by three partners, one of whom is Guadalupe. She is 52 years old, single with an older 29 year old son. She has had a grocery story in her home for 15 years. Those who help her with the business are her brother, her father, and her, who manage it. 

She will invest it in the purchase of staple goods, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, milk products, Avon cosmetics like hand lotion, body lotions, face lotions, etc. Luisa is 59 years old and her business is selling dairy products and leather shoes. Yelba has a grocery store in her house.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, milk products, Avon cosmetics like hand lotion, body lotions, face lotions, etc.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. El se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería.  Hace  20 años que cultiva granos básicos como maíz,  frijoles y  Café. Este cultivo lo realiza en el campo del mismo municipio. El préstamo que Moisés solicito es por L.5, 000 el cual los invertirá al Mantenimiento de la Finca, comprara fertilizantes y utilizara una parte para limpieza de la misma. Su propósito es tener más oportunidades de trabajo y poder crecer como buen agricultor.
texts.en:
Moisés is 48 years old, single, has a son and lives in the city of Protección, Santa Bárbara. He makes his living through agriculture and raising animals. He's been growing staple crops, such as rice, beans and coffee, for 20 years. This crop is raised in the fields of the same city. 

The loan Moisés is asking for is for L. 5,000 (Honduran lempira), which he will invest in maintaining the farm, buying fertilizers and using a part for cleaning the farm. His purpose is to have more work opportunities and to be able to grow as a good farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cleaning his crops.

loans.name: Leiver David

texts.es:
Leiver tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil soltero tiene 2 hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Leiver se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desfíos los precios de los proiductos en el mercado. El sueño es tener siempre dienro para dar una buena educacion a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Leiver is 22 years old and single. He has two children who are 11 and 7 years old. He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the VRC BRUNIQUILDE, located in Recinto Calabi, which belongs to the canton Ventanas, dedicated to agricultural labor.

Leiver makes his living through agriculture, growing corn. He is asking for a loan to buy inputs, fertilizers and payment for labor.

He will hold purchase of products in the city of Ventanas every 15 days. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy inputs.

He faces challenged with the products' prices in the market. His dream is to always have money to give his children a good education. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs, fertilizers and payment for labor.

loans.name: Tesla Group

texts.es: Grupo integrado por cuatros socia, Virginia es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada,  con tres hijos de o2, 20, y 22 años. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y ropa usada desde hace 8 años. EL crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de cosméticos de la a Avon como cremas faciales, cremas nocturnas, perfumen de calidad de varón, perfumen de dama, máscaras, maquillaje etc. Los logro que alcanzo con el crédito anterior fue que adquirió Un artículo eléctrico un  abanico y  logro solventar sus deudas, Tesla tiene 34 años y su negocio es la venta de artículos escolares, Eveling tiene 30 años y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas bigcola, frijoles cocidos, hielo  y helado. Sandra tiene 52 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: The group consists of four members. Virginia is 48, married and has three children, ages 2, 20 and 22. She has had a business selling Avon cosmetics and used clothing for the past eight years. She plans to use the loan to purchase Avon cosmetics like facial creams, night creams, perfumes and colognes, mascaras, makeup, etc. The previous loan was used to buy an electrical fan and pay off some debts. Tesla is 34 years old and sells school supplies. Eveling is 30 years old and has a business selling soft drinks, cooked beans, ice and ice cream. Sandra is 52 years old and sells used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase Avon cosmetics like facial creams, night creams, perfumes and colognes, mascaras, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Campamento De Dios Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios una de ellas es Mariela mujer de 34 años, acompañada, con dos hijos de 14 y 07 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de frijoles cocidos, gaseosas, hielo desde hace cinco años. Este crédito lo  solicita para fortalecer su negocio con la compra de frijoles por quintal, gaseosas bigcolas, bolsas, leñas etc. sus metas es crecer su negocio y poner otro negocio como es una pulpería. Esperanza  tiene 28 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pan y Guillermo tiene 49 años y su negocio es la venta de hogdog y gaseosas.
texts.en: This group consists of three members, one of whom is Mariela. She is 34 years old and has two children, ages 14 and 7, with her common-law husband. She has had a business selling cooked beans, soft drinks and ice for the past five years. She is requesting the loan to strengthen her business by purchasing big sacks of beans (46 kg a piece), soft drinks, bags, firewood, etc. Her goal is to grow her business and start up a convenience store as another business. Esperanza is 28 years old and makes a living selling bread, and Guillermo is 49 and sells hot dogs and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase beans, soft drinks, bags, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Jesus

texts.es:
OSCAR tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la conyugue y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

OSCAR se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y pocas cantidades de cacao. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en la agricultura y en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos y semillas de cacao.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada semana. La ayuda del crédito le ayudará a  mejorar y superarce en lo económico.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos y la lancha que quema los cultivos. El sueño es tener dinero para comprar un vehiculo para salir a pasear con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y salir a caminar con la familia por el campo.
texts.en: Oscar is 40 years old and has four children with his common-law wife. He lives with his partner and their children in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the Bruniquilde community bank located in the precinct of Calabi in Ventanas, where the people work in agriculture. Oscar makes a living in farming corn and small amounts of cocoa. He is requesting the loan to invest in his farm and purchase supplies, fertilizers, urea, manure and cocoa seeds. He will make his purchases every week in the city of Ventanas. The loan will help him improve his finances and move up in life. He faces challenges such as pests in his crops and the blight that burn the crops. His dream is to have money to buy a car so he can go on drives with his family. In his free time he likes to play sports and go on walks with his family in the fields.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, urea, manure and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married with three children, and one is in school. She does not take care of additional family members. She sells cosmetics and also operates a beauty salon at the market. She has been in this business for three years. She works for seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, relaxers, oils and shampoo. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked stall of different types of cosmetics and also to open a bridal shop. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication for the children and school fees.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, relaxers, hair treatments and oils.

loans.name: Fatoumata Dite Tata

texts.fr:
Madame   Fatoumata dite Tata est âgée de 37 ans, mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants.  Elle  vit avec son mari et ses enfants au  quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 6 eme  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour  mener le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits et chaussures au marché de Kati. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle a pu maîtriser les rouages du petit commerce. Par la suite, elle a évolué de ses propres ailes pour mener la même activité que sa mère. Elle vend des habits depuis 17 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation dans le quartier. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du secteur et surtout elle a pu fidéliser sa clientèle.   
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice. elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois après 3 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 4ème prêt qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 10 complets brodés, 10 paires de chaussures et 10 complets draps. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et au Burkina Faso.
Madame  Fatoumata dite Tata   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra  de payer ses échéances de prêts  et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est  de faire le commerce à l’international.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata aka Tata is 37 years old, married with four children. She lives with her ​​husband and children in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She dropped out of school in 6th grade (Malian educational system) to begin retail trading with her mother who sold clothing and footwear at the market in Kati. After several years of learning at her side, she became able to manage the workings of small retail businesses.

Subsequently, she evolved on her own to conduct the same business as her mother. She has been selling clothes for 17 years and enjoys a high reputation in the area. Her sales strength comes from her mastery of the activity and in particular her ability to retain customers.

With the aim of increasing her business to make more profit. she approached Soro Yiriwaso 36 months ago. After three individual loans fully repaid, this is her fourth loan she will use to buy 10 sets of embroidered clothes, 10 pairs of shoes and 10 full sets of clothes.

She resupplies in Bamako and Burkina Faso. Mrs. Fatoumata aka Tata sells for cash and credit to a clientele mostly composed  of women and men.

With this loan, she expects a monthly income of 90,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to pay off her short-term loans and participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.).

Her ambition is to become an international trader.

loans.use: buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and married with two children. She runs a little bar in Waterloo in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. Her husband is a carpenter, but his income is not enough to take care of the home.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells stout, Star beer, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soft drinks, Star beer, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big bar and restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, Star beer, cigarette and biscuit for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, and five of her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. 

She is a timber seller at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy timber. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting her timber to market. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Isatu from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged 4 years. She began this business because she wants to empower her life and children.

Isatu runs a general store and sells food containers, baskets and umbrella. She has been running this business for two years. She works at the business every day, moving around the community to introduce her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as food containers, baskets and umbrellas. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as food containers, baskets and umbrellas.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
This is Ada from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown. She is in her late 30s. She is single with three children between the ages of 8 years and 15 years. She began this business because she wanted to empower her life and children.

Ada runs a general store; she sells baby pampers and pure water. She has been running this business for one year now. She works at the business every day, moving around the community to introduce her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Ada has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is in her late 30s and married with four children between the ages of 10 years and 20 years. She runs a general store in Waterloo, western rural area, in Sierra Leone. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to take care of the home.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells alcohol, soft drinks, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Agnes requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more alcohol, soft drinks, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol, soft drinks, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata  est âgée de 42  ans,  mariée  et mère de 4  enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et  ses enfants  au quartier Sébougou de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Fatoumata n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales. Elle débuta les activités génératrices de revenus  à côté de sa mère  qui vendait des condiments, après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle évolua seule pour mener finalement le commerce d’habits.  Elle mène ses activités  depuis 15 ans. Sa force de vente est due à son prix abordable,  son sens des affaires et surtout à la qualité de ses habits.
Pour faire face à sa demande clientèle surtout pour  les  fêtes qui s’annoncent  à savoir le Ramadan, le Tabaski, Noël et le 31 Décembre.  elle demande ce nouveau prêt  avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est depuis 36 mois. Après 3 prêts  individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 4ème qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 50 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne  à Bamako.  
Madame  Fatoumata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de  femmes.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA, ce dernier lui servira de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et de payer ses tontines.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata is 42 years old, married with four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her ​​husband and children in the Sébougou district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Fatoumata has not attended school for social reasons. She became involved with income-generating activities alongside her mother who sold condiments. After several years of learning from her, she evolved on her own, ultimately to become a retail clothing merchant.

She has been in business for 15 years. Her selling strengths are the affordability of her products, her business acumen and especially the quality of her clothes.

To meet her customers' demand, especially for the coming holidays - namely Ramadan, the Tabaski (important Muslim festival also known as Aïd El Kabir), Christmas and December 31 -  she is requesting a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been cooperating for the past 36 months. 

All  three individual loans have been repaid in full. This will be the fourth loan she will use to buy 50 lengths of wax cloth (colorful West-African fabric). She resupplies in Bamako. Mrs. Fatoumata sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. 

With this loan, she intends to make monthly profits of 50,000 FCFA, she will use to deal with family expenses and pay her tontines (participation in group savings).

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah lives in Uganda Kampala, is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She operates a bar and restaurant in a shop she rents. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 2,200,000 UGX to buy crates of soda, beer, and spirits. Her major challenge is seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, beer and spirits

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Margret from Waterloo, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with two children, aged 7 years and 17 years. Her children are attending school. 

Margret runs a wood business; she sells charcoal and wood. She has been running this business for the past 10 years. She works at the business nine hours per day and 7 days per week. Margret says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of transportation to travel with her goods during the rainy season as sometimes vehicles break on the way.

Margret has requested a loan in order to purchase charcoal and wood. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to change her business to be a local foodstuffs seller. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Bebe Rose

texts.fr: Bébé rose est une jeune camerounaise de 33 ans exerçant depuis deux ans dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires et des boissons. Veuve et mère de deux enfants de respectivement 13 et 7 ans , elle compte avec ce crédit augmenter son stock de marchandises pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Avec le bénéfice, elle voudrait d'une part accroître son activité et d'autre part assurer un meilleur avenir à ses deux enfants qu'elle élève et scolarise toute seule.
texts.en:
Bébé Rose is a young 33-year-old Cameroonian who has been marketing food products and beverages for the past two years

A widow and the mother of two children aged 13 and 7 years respectively, she hopes this loan will enable her to increase her stock of goods to satisfy the growing demand of her customers.

With the profits, she would like to expand her business and secondly ensure a better future for her two children she raises and educates by herself.

loans.use: increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with nine children ages 8 years to 25 years.  She began her business because she wants to create income to improve her status of living. In 2010, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she started a business to help her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like palm oil, bags of rice, soft drinks and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and buy a piece of land. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like palm oil, bags of rice, soft drinks and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sally is 48 years old and widowed with four children. She runs a food stand business in Waterloo eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells eggs at her house. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate financing to expand her business.
 
Sally requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cartons of eggs. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of eggs.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Jenneh from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children ages 5 years to 10 years.  She began her business because she wants to create income to support her children and herself. In 2009, Jenneh established her general stock business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Jenneh requires a loan in order to purchase gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Tenneh plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Augustin Group

texts.en:
Augustin is a member of this group, located in Dansoman where most of the citizens are a mixture of different tribes with different trades. He lives with his wife and children. With this effort, he can make extra income and help his car parts business in the long term. In the meantime, he enjoys doing business to take care of his family. 

Augustin is excited to be taking his ninth loan with ID-Ghana. He has had his business for nearly seven years.

Augustin is planning to use this loan to invest in his business by buying car spare parts in different sizes for different cars. He will reinvest the profits in his business by purchasing more car parts for new clients. He dreams of becoming an importer of these car parts since the import business would give him an advantage over his competitors.

The other member is named Lawrencia, and sell towels. Together they need a total amount of GHS 3300 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts in different sizes for different cars.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en: Radha is 42 years old. She is married and has two children aged 23 and 19.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and she used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe   DEMBAGNOUMA   sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à   KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  AMINATA fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe de femmes de DEMBAGNOUMA. Elle se tient  assise en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 20 kg de gombo séché, 3 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Dembagnouma group are essentially married women who on average are 36 years old with five children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a populous neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to meet the needs of their customers.

Ms. Aminata been trading condiments in the Dembagnouma group of women. She is the first person sitting from right to left in the photo.

She intends to use the loan to buy 20 kg of dried okra, and three 50-kg bags of onions. She resells them for cash at retail prices, on the spot assisted by family members, to a client base consisting for the most part of women.

She expects average monthly profits of 12,500 CFA francs, a portion of which is used to pay off the loan and its interest and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  MOUGNOU sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et  en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme KONIMBA fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe de femmes de MOUGNOU. Elle se tient  assise en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 25 kg de gombo séché, 150 kg d’oignon et 20 kg de poissons fumé qu’elle revendra en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeure partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Mougnou group are married women who on average are 42 years old with five children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a populous neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  to meet the needs of their customers.

Ms. Konimba been trading condiments in the Mougnou group of women. She is sitting in first position from right to left in the photo.

She intends to use the loan to buy 25 kg of dried okra, 150 kg of onions and 20 kg of smoked fish. She will resell for cash at retail prices, on site with family members, to a client base consisting of a majority of women.

She expects average monthly profits of 18,000 CFA francs, a portion of which is used to pay off the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Amabel works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling chicken in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amabel is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional chicken to sell.

Amabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken to sell

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. Apolonia has been in this business for 13 years. Apolonia earns more income from selling prepaid mobile load, farming corn and raising pigs.

Apolonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joesenette

texts.en:
Joesenette is 40 years old and married with two children.

Joesenette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles and eggs. Joesenette has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear clothes and pig fattening.

Joesenette aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 53 years old and married with six children, two of whom attend school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rodilyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rodilyn has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 41 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carina has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from direct selling beauty products, selling ready to wear clothes and raising ducks.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eugenio Leopoldo

texts.es:
EUGENIO  tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene 1 hijo de 17 años de edad, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.
