EUGENIO se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de patos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes urea, abonos y balanceado de crianza y engorde para los patos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada semanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los productos sin ningún tipo de problemas en lo que es el dinero.

Enfrenta desfíos los precios de los insuos en el mercado. El sueño es trabajar tener salud, vida. Es costumbre del Recinto reunirse los domingo a jugar bingo para sacar fondos para algun programa.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 58, is married and has a 17-year-old son; he lives with his wife and son in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the “Bruniquilde” communal bank located in Recinto Calabi which belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture. 

Eugenio is a farmer who grows corn and also raises ducks. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, manure and balanced feed for his ducks.

He buys his products in Ventanas weekly. With help from the loan he will be able to get the products problem-free with respect to money. The challenge he faces is the high market price of the supplies he needs. His dream is to work, to have good health and to stay alive. The tradition in Recinto is to get together on Sundays to play Bingo and raise funds for a certain program.

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, manure, and balanced feed for ducks.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita  tiene 25 años, casada con cuatro hijos de las edades de 2, 4, 9 y 12  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Limoncito,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá transportarse para realizar algunas compras para su negocio, la Sra. Margarita  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita, 25, is married and has four children, ages 2, 4, 9 and 12.  She runs a food stall in the town of Limoncito.  This is her first loan through the institution and she plans to use it to buy a motorcycle for transportation when making purchases for her business.

Margarita faces challenges such as competition since there are several people in the food business.  Her goal is to continue selling and open a restaurant one day so her customers can be more comfortable.  This will allow her to improve her income and quality of life for both her and her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 3 years. She began this business because she wants to create a source of income to support her family.

Fatmata runs a general store; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business every day, from morning to night.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Que

texts.en:
Que is 37 years old. She has two children who are learning at the 7th and the 5th grade. Her husband is a carpenter. He earns about 10,000,000 VND per month. Que helps her husband in the carpentry business. She has done this job for ten years. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Que also grows rice to earn more money. Que’s challenges in life and work are a lack of capital to invest in her work and the low output price of products. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. She can buy more wood for the business. Que is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.
She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In her last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more wood. She can expand her carpentry store, to increase her earnings and save the profit for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to resell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth, de 30 años de edad es una mujer soltera y viven en la casa de su madre. Janeth es una mujer trabajadora, posee un pequeño puesto en la zona comercial de su localidad en donde se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, además de bebidas refrescantes. Lo que hace su negocio diferentes, son los cajones de frutas que adquiere, ya que puede comercializarlos al por mayor y no al menudeo, de esa manera atiende a clientes que la competencia no puede, esta ventaja le ofrece el puesto que posee. Ahora desea ser una mujer triunfadora y convertirse en toda una comercializadora de frutas al por mayor. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Janeth, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de frutas al por mayor tales como naranjas, mandarinas , entre otras.
texts.en:
Janeth, 30, is single and lives with her mother.  She is a very hard-working woman who has a small stand in the commercial area of her town, where she sells seasonal fruit and soft drinks.  What makes her business stand out is that she buys crates of fruit and sells wholesale instead of retail.  This allows her to attend to the customers that her competitors cannot.

Now she wants to be a successful woman and become a wholesale fruit dealer.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support so she can get ahead.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

Janeth will use the 1,000 PEN to buy wholesale fruit such as oranges, tangerines, etc.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as oranges, tangerines, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es: Está formado por tres socias emprendedoras como lo es Lissette empresaria,  tiene 29 años de edad, casada con dos  hijos, su negocio es de estilismo a domicilio y venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat, desde hace 10 años tiene su negocio, tiene cinco años de ser cliente de la institución, este crédito lo quiere invertir en nuevos productos como sandalias de Masaya, y compra de tiempo aire de las empresas  Claro y Movistar uno de  los éxitos que obtuvo fue que compro materiales para el estilismo. Sadia es otra miembro su  negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla tiene 35 años y María tiene 52 años y su negocio es la venta de cereales y una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three entrepreneurs, including Lissette who is 29 years old, married and has two children.   She is a stylist who provides services to her clients in their homes; and she also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics.  She has been in business for ten years and working with the institution for five years.  

Lissette will use this loan to buy new products such as Masaya sandals, as well as phone time from companies such as Claro and Movistar.  One of the successes she had was buying styling products.  

Sadia, 35, is another member who makes and sells tortillas.  María, 52, sells cereals and runs a small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy Masaya sandals and phone time from Claro and Movistar.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à    TIALA , un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec NAMINATA  assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences,frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi I group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Tiala, one of the villages in Niena commune, Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

The group is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Naminata, seated second from the right [in the photo], grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay the costs of labor to cultivate one hectare of land.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the market to customers who are men and women. 

Naminata hopes to earn 100,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and to also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   Tiala, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   AWA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 80.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi II group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Tiala, one of the villages in Niena commune, Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Awa, standing in the middle [of the photo], grows groundnuts. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay the cost of labor to cultivate one hectare of land.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the market to men and women customers. 

Awa hopes to earn 80,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gilda has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending and an internet café.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband is working overseas and she supports their needs by providing motorcycle rental and transportation. She has been doing this for four years to earn a living. She borrowed from GDMPC micro-credit in order to repair her existing motorcycle for better service. She hopes to give her children better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to repair her existing motorcycle

loans.name: El Mercadito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está formado por tres socias, Claudia es una de ella y su negocio es la venta de prendas de plata y ropa nueva, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene un niño de 9 años.
De tener su negocio es 10 años consecutivos este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de plata como anillos, aretes, cadenas, pulsera de pie, pulseras de manos, chapas etc. Josefa es otra miembro y su negocio es la venta de fritanga diario en su domicilio y su edad es de 62 años y Ana tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y bisuterías.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three members, including Claudia, 34, who sells silver jewelry and new clothing.  She is married and has a nine-year-old son.

She has been in business for ten consecutive years and is planning to use the loan to buy silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, chains, ankle bracelets, bracelets, pins, etc.  

Josefa, 62, is another member of the group who sells fried food out of her house.  Ana, 25, sells clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, chains, ankle bracelets, bracelets, pins, etc.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором вместе со своей семьей живет и развевает бизнес далеко от города, в сельской местности. Дилором более 20 лет занимается бизнесом. Она выращивает картофель, пшеницу и т.п. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Они имеют 3 детей. 
Земледелие имеет большой риск, так как из-за неблагополучной погоды, они могут потерять всё вложенное ими в бизнес. Однако так как они живут в сельской местности, основным бизнесом является земледелие. Дилором хочет расширить бизнес скотоводством. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки скота и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Together with her family, Dilorom lives and conducts her business in a village far from the city.  She has been running her own business for more than 20 years, growing potatoes, wheat, etc.  Her husband helps her run the business.  They have three children together.  Agriculture is a high-risk business, as one can lose their entire investment after just one season of bad weather.  However, since they live in a village farming is their main business.  Dilorom wants to expand into raising livestock.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy livestock and mineral fertilizer.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Jamil

texts.ru: Джамилу 58 лет. Он женат на доброй женщине, которая занимается выращиванием сельхоз продуктов. Джамил и его жена воспитывают 4 детей. Двое старшие дети совершеннолетние и двое младшие не совершеннолетние. Джамил как заботливый отец упорно трудится для того, чтобы найти источника дохода и обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Он более 20 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции как виноград, яблоко, черешня и т.п. Он живет в сельской местности и поэтому как другие местные жители развевает и радуется своим бизнесом. Он имеет большой опыт в бизнесе и знает все тонкости своего дела. Джамил хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки минерального удобрения и топлива для развития садоводства. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jamil is 58 years old and he is married to a kind woman who is involved in raising crops.  He and his wife have four children - the two older ones are already grown and the two younger ones are still at home.  Like any caring father, Jamil tries hard to find sources of income so he can provide for his family's needs.  For more than 20 years, he has been involved in raising crops like grapes, apples, cherries, etc.  He lives in a village and, like other villagers, he conducts his business with pleasure.  He has a lot of experience and he knows every aspect of how to conduct his business.  Jamil wants to develop his business further, which is why he is asking for a loan of $3,000 to buy mineral fertilizer and soil to expand his orchard.  He is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for his gardening business.

loans.name: Olegaria

texts.en:
Olegaria is a 50-year-old married mother with six children, who lives in Liposong, Ozamis City, the Philippines. To support her family's daily expenses, she has been running a grocery store for 15 years and currently earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. Aside from this business, she also helps her husband plant and harvest corn on their farm, which is their main source of income. 

In 2007, Olegaria joined GDMPC and she is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 38 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Jessica has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling feed. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is 60 years old, married and has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 35 years.

Teresita has requested a 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from providing motorcycle transportation services, raising pigs, selling charcoal, and farming sugarcane and rice. Josephine is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items like sugar, oil, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, etc. for her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, oil, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Mr LAMINE est né en janvier 1944 à IFOLA Cercle de Sikasso. Il vit à IFOLA avec ses enfants et épouses dans une famille traditionnelle (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales et des produits alimentaires depuis maintenant  7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, depuis 6 ans, les prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat et la revente d’environ 50 sacs de 50 kg de maïs et 300 kg de pois sucré. Il s’approvisionne à IFOLA ainsi que dans les villages environnants tel que Lobougoula. Les ventes sont faites à Niena ainsi qu’à Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes du village. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Lamine was born in January 1944 in Ifola Cercle in Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). He lives in Ifola with his children and wives in a traditional family. He has been buying and selling cereals and food products for the past seven years and his experience in this field has earned him a good reputation; he receives orders from a variety of customers. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy this customer demand he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, six years ago and all his previous loans have been repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy and resell 50 sacks (of 50kg each) of corn and 300kg of sugar peas. He gets his supplies in Ifola as well as in surrounding villages such as Loubougoula. He sells his products in Niena and in Sikasso. His customer base is made up of men and women from the village. 

With this loan he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay the interest on his loan an reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and sugar peas.

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna, de 25 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su pequeña hija en la casa que alquila hace 3 años. Todos los días de las primeras horas hasta el atardecer, Jovanna sale con su canasta a ofrecer piña picada, cítricos lavados, maduros y dulces a buenos precios. Su trabajo consiste en ofrecer los frutos a los turistas que llegan constantemente a su ciudad, tiene mucha clientela por está razón lleva 4 años dedicándose a este negocio y comenta que le va muy bien pues procura comprar frutos dulces y de calidad para que sea la preferida entre sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Jovanna, invertirá el dinero en la compra de cajas de frutas tales como naranjas y mandarinas.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a 25 year old hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and her young daughter in a home they have been renting for 3 years. 

Every day from the early hours until sunset, Jovanna goes out with her basket offering pineapple chunks, and washed ripe citrus, sweet at good prices. Her work consists of offering fruit to the tourists that constantly visit the city. She has a lot of customers because she has been doing it for 4 years and she says that she is doing well since she buys sweet fruit of a quality which might be preferred by her clients.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to continue going forward, and she agrees to make her payments punctually.

Jovanna will invest the money in the purchase of boxes of fruit such as oranges and tangerines.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges and tangerines.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 42 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For more than 10 years, Mario has owned a motorcycle transport business. He earns 3,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC in 2010. Mario is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan to buy motor accessories and tires. He plans to use the profit from his loan to purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Guissel Group

texts.es: Grupo formado tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, tiene 28 años joven, casada, y con dos hijo menores. Tiempo de tener su negocio 7 años. Este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de varón, camisolas, chores, faldas, etc. María es otra socia quien tiene 27 años y su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y repochetas y María tiene 18 años su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.

One of them is Maria. Her business activity is buying new and used clothing. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 young children. She has had her business for 7 years.

She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of new clothing such as pants for ladies and men, shirts for men, undershirts, shorts, skirts, etc.

Another Maria is 28 years old and her business is the sale of tamales and “repochetas” [a quesadilla which is eaten like a taco, has been grilled, and can include meat with beans and rice, and is covered with a cole slaw like mixture, and finally topped with Mexican cream]. 

Another Maria has had her home based grocery store business for 18 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing for ladies and men such as pants, shirts for men, undershirts, shorts, skirts, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, two of whom are in school, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle she uses in her transport business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, including spices, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and noodles. Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, including spices, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilibeth has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lilibeth applied for a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Lilibeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Andrada

texts.en: Andrada is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Andrada is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Andrada has been raising pigs for 23 years. She earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: As a married mother of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling other foods. Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe    BADENYA    sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogamiques à OUAYERMA II  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme AICHATA  fait le commerce de condiments et de produits alimentaires dans ce groupe de femmes de  BADENYA. Elle se tient  debout en première position de la   gauche vers la   droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 100 kg de gingembre  et  3 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Badenya group are married women who are, on average, 36 years old with five children each. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  They are on their sixteenth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they have joined in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Among these women from the Badenya group, Aichata sells condiments and food products.  In the photo, she is standing first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy 100 kg of ginger and three bags of onions, each weighing 50 kg.  She resells her food products locally, with her family and for cash, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan, while the remaining money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy ginger and onions.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 6 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe DANAYA habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles. Elles  font de la vente de savon, de riz, de la fabrication  et vente de soumbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame AMINATA, debout au milieu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paniers de 30 kg de soumbala, 50 kg d’oignons, 1 carton de cube maggi .  Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Bougoula et à Sikasso ensuite fait la vente à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame AMINATA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  45.000  francs CFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
NB/ Sur la photo elles sont au nombre de 6, c’est la nommée MAWA qui est absente pour des raisons personnelle.
texts.en:
Most of the seven women of the Danaya group are married within traditional families. They are, on average, 47 years old with six children each. They all live in the hamlet of Bougoula, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and they know one another through neighborhood, family and professional ties. 

They sell soap and rice, and are also involved in the preparation and sale of soumbala (a traditional condiment prepared from néré seeds).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and this is their eighth solidarity loan cycle.

Aminata (standing in the middle of the group) plans to use her loan to buy ten baskets of soumbala (each basket weighing 30kg), 50 kg of onions and one box of Maggi bouillon cubes.

She buys her merchandise locally in Bougoula and Sikasso and then resells to a customer base which consists of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of some household needs.

Note:  There are only six women on the photo, as Mawa, another group member, is absent for personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy condiments (soumbala, onions and bouillon cubes)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 6 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe BENKADI habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de savon, de riz, de la fabrication  et vente de soumbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame LALA, debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 400 kg de pomme de terre, 5 paniers de 30 kg de soumbala.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Bougoula et ensuite fait la vente à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame LALA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  50.000 francs CFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
Mostly married into traditional families and having an average age of 47 and six children, the seven women of this Benkadi group all live in the Bougoula Hamlet area of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali.) They met through bonds of kinship and neighborhood and through their professional activities. They sell soap. rice and make and sell 'soumbala' (a local condiment). Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their twelfth solidarity loan. 

 Madame Lala, standing, first person from left to right, intends to use her loan to buy 400 kg of potatoes and five baskets of 30 kg of soumbala. She buys her wares right in Bougoula and then sells her goods to a clientele composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Madame Lala expects to make  an average monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay for certain needs for her household.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NIABOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  DJENEBOU debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt,  elle compte acheter le labour, 2 sacs d’engrais et 10 kg de semence d’arachide pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 140.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the group called BENKADI I are married women with an average age of 41 years, 4 children, and all living in polygamous families in NIABOUGOU, a village in the municipality of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali: SIKASSO. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities successfully during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, past loans having been  correctly repaid. 

Djénébou, standing, second from left to the right in the photo, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing, two bags of fertilizer, and 10 kg of peanut seed to maintain one hectare. Her production is sold at the village level and SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 140,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs, agricultural seed and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Shaodat

texts.ru: Шаодат добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Шаодат более 15 лет занимается скотоводством. Шаодат является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж учитель в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Шаодат имеет большой опыт в данной отрасли бизнеса и справляется с бизнесом сама. Шаодат имеет хорошие условия для развития бизнеса, так как она живет в сельской местности. Она выращивает сама сено для своего скота и поэтому ей дешево обходится откорм скота. Шаодату очень трудно справляться с расходами семьи, так как ее муж получает маленькую зарплату, и ее сын не имеет место работы. Ее сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию и подрабатывать там. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2300 сомони для покупки авиабилета для своего сына.
texts.en:
Shaodat is a conscientious and hard-working woman. She is married and is raising three children. For over 15 years, Shaodat has been working in animal husbandry. Shaodat is the main breadwinner of the family, since her husband is a high school teacher and earns a small salary. 

Shaodat has extensive business experience and manages her business by herself. Shaodat has good conditions for developing her business since she lives in a rural area. She grows the hay to feed the cattle herself, so that fattening cattle is inexpensive. 

It is very hard for Shaodat to support her family, since her husband receives a small salary and her son doesn't have a job. Her son wants to go to Russia to earn additional income. She is applying for a loan of 2,300 somoni to buy a plane ticket for her son.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her son to go to Russia to look for a job

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она не замужем и живет с матерью. После смерти отца, ее семья осталась без кормильца, и наступили трудные времена. Они были вынуждены переехать в дом дедушки, так как ее мать нигде не работала. С помощью родственников они купили дом и начали жить отдельно. После окончания школы, она начала работать на поле наёмным работником, зимой, в не сезонное время она работает официанткой и посуда мойщицей в столовых. Ее мать работает техничкой, и ее месячная зарплата составляет 200 сомони. Шахноза за займом обращается во второй раз. Она хочет отремонтировать их дом, так как их дом имеет плохое состояние и не отвечает стандартам жилья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young and energetic woman. She is 26 years old. She isn't married and lives with her mother. After the death of her father, her family was left without a breadwinner and difficult times began. Since her mother didn't work, they were forced to move to her grandfather's house. With the help of their relatives, they bought a house and started living independently. 

After finishing school, she started working as hired help in the fields, and out of season in the winter, she works as a waitress and dishwasher in a cafeteria. Her mother works as a technician, and her monthly salary is 200 somoni. 

Shahnoza is applying for her second loan. She wants to renovate their house, which is in poor condition and doesn't meet housing standards. She is applying for a loan of 3,000 somoni to purchase building materials. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Nuuruyatu

texts.en:
Originally from Ghana, self-made entrepreneur Nuuruyatu has always had a passion for the art of cooking. When she moved to the United States four years ago, she wanted to create employment opportunities for herself and other immigrants and to provide high-quality African food. 

She began her business with a $50 investment and started making kenkey (a fermented cornmeal dumpling-type dish that is a staple in parts of West Africa) from her own kitchen. She had her church community, friends and family test out the flavor. 

In hope of expanding her business, she began working out of a commercially licensed kitchen in June 2011. Her business, Kadosh Foods Enterprise, does food processing, cooking, marketing, and distribution of Kenkey, Shito (a hot black pepper sauce ubiquitous in Ghana), friend fish, and shrimp. The next year, she moved into her own space, allowing her to produce and ship/cater her food to other restaurants, markets, or events. 

The largest challenge for her business at the moment is that her clientele is growing quickly and demand is high, but she does not have the machinery to produce as quickly as she needs to. It takes approximately seven hours to cook and prepare a batch of Kenke. One of the steps in the process that could decrease time is the vacuum sealing step to prepare the packages for shipment. She feels that if she cannot produce the amount her clients are demanding, they may turn to other suppliers. 

This $3,000 Accion loan will help her to purchase the vacuum seal machine while simultaneously building a credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum seal machine while simultaneously building a credit history.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is an entrepreneur who lives in Ozamiz City with her family. She owns and operates a business selling grilled chicken, assorted viands and a variety of other foods in the community. She has been in this business for many years, and she was able to support her children as they finished their degree courses. She joined GDMPC in the 2009, and it has helped her to improve her business. She is taking out a loan of 60,000 PHP in order to buy additional ingredients and pots. She hopes her business expansion into other places in the province will be successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and pots for her food business.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is from Cabatuan, Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Charlyn is married and has four children. Charlyn has a business venture in the retail sector, selling a variety of home use products. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Charlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles and spices. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles and spices.

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba is farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been farming for more than 3 years. This is the source of her income.

Columba is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these inputs, she hopes to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Columba dreams of making her farming business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   Tiala, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   AWA debout à l'extrême droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called BENKADI III are married women with an average age of 42 years, 5 children, all living in polygamous families in Tiala, one of the villages in the municipality of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali: SIKASSO. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities successfully during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, past loans having been correctly repaid.

Awa, standing at the far right in the photo, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to pay for seeds, plowing expenses, and fertilizer to maintain one hectare. Her production is sold at the village level and at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 95,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   NOUGOUME, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   MAMOU debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi IV group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Nougoume, one of the villages of the Niena commune, in the region of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Mamou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, in the middle of the group.

She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and at the Sikasso market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 150,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Gertrudez

texts.en: Gertrudez is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Malibangcao, Clarin, where she sells goods for a living. Her husband works as a driver while she operates a retail store. She borrowed 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from GDMPC in order to buy goods like noodles, canned goods, sugar and sachet products. She hopes to generate and save more income for the purpose of having a comfortable house in the future.

loans.use: to buy goods like noodles, canned goods, sugar and sachet products

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Jhona is 25 years old, single and lives in Calamba. Her family helps her in taking care of the bananas she has been growing for more than two years, yielding an income of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jhona joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to cover the costs of banana replanting. She hopes to have a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to cover the costs of banana replanting

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She owns and operates a service-based business providing transportation in the community. She has been in this business for more than ten years to make a living. 

In 2010, she joined GDMPC and recently requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tires. She planned and hoped to buy another vehicle to use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Dianne Michelle

texts.en:
This is Dianne Michelle, whose previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy an additional washing machine for her laundry shop. Her business income assisted her in her child's education as well as their household expenditures.

Dianne Michelle is requesting a new loan for 20,000 PHP to buy an additional washing machine and laundry supplies. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dianne Michelle hopes to open another laundry shop, and dreams of having a computer shop. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional washing machine and laundry supplies

loans.name: Las Profes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las profes está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes se dedica a la docencia, les gusta mucho trabajar en esta profesión ya que su satisfacción es ver como los niños día a día van aprendiendo, también les gusta porque su ambiente de trabajo es alegre, todos son solidarias y respetuosos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de mucha naturaleza y de una arquitectura colonial que se mezcla con la moderna, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Gloria, forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Profes y es una de las socias fundadoras de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, profesionales y muy carismáticas, también son solidarias y siempre se encuentran al pendiente de sus compañeras. 

La Señora. Gloria tiene 52 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 21 años que está estudiando en la universidad. Su esposo es artesano de profesión y se dedica a la relojería, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del sacrificio conyugal.

Doña Gloria es una mujer que es muy sociable que desde hace algunos años se dedica a la docencia, labora en una escuelita de la ciudad y le gusta mucho estar con los niños, también se dedica a dar charlas de motivación familiar. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en el pago de la universidad de su hija ya que estudia la carrera de Odontología. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea una gran profesional
texts.en:
The “Las Profes” communal bank consists of six females and one male member who are teachers. They like working in this profession and have satisfaction seeing the children learning day after day, and also like it because of the happy working environment, all of them supportive and respectful. They live in the city of Cuenca, a city that has lots of nature and colonial architecture mixed with modern. Its people maintain the old culture and traditions. 

One of the members of this group is Gloria, she is a part of the “Las Profes” communal bank and is one of the founding members of this group of fighting women, professionals, who are all very charismatic, all of them supportive and always looking out for their companions. 

Gloria is 52 years old, married and through this relationship has a 21 year old daughter who is studying at college. Her husband, a craftsman by trade, works in watchmaking. The house they live in is the fruit of their combined efforts. 

Gloria is a very sociable woman and has been engaged in teaching for some years. She works in a little school in the city and she likes being with the children, and she also gives family motivational talks.

She is going to invest the money from the loan to pay college fees for her daughter who is studying dentistry. 

Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs for her daughter

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en: Clarissa is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs and from her E-loading (selling prepaid mobile phone loads) and food-vending businesses. Clarissa is borrowing PHP 28,500 through NWTF in order to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle transport vehicle. Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities with her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle she uses in her transport business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: As the widowed parent of four children, Rosalina works hard to support her family. She has a food-processing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from videoke (music) rentals. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her chicharon (fried pork rind) business. Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities with her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her chicharon (fried pork rind)  business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 40 years old, married, and has three children, who are in school. Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Ann applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Mary Ann has been raising pigs for three years, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to maintain her business. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Rosalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalie aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kahraman

texts.en: Kahraman is 53 years old. She is widowed and lives in Amman, Jordan, with her five children. Kahraman has been working in flowers and trees in addition to brides' and nannies' grips coordination. One of the obstacles that she faces is the lack of marketing for her work and products. She is planning to expand her project in the future with her partner. Now Kahraman is requesting a loan to buy string, grips, artificial flowers and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy string, grips, artificial flowers and fabrics.

loans.name: Chollhanu B Shg Group

texts.en:
"The thought of bringing up two boys and one girl used to haunt me before I was engaged in earning and [was] entirely depending on my husband’s income,” says Tingneikim.  

She belongs to Chollhanu Group and she is the featured borrower member. She is pictured with hand raised on the extreme left in the picture. She has been an active member in the group. 

Tingneikim's husband drives a mini-van and makes a living for the family. Monthly bills and everyday expenses were all paid only by her husband's income. The insufficient income from her husband made it hard for the family to sustain itself. Then, she joined the group, availed a loan and started weaving. The woven products were sold for profits. She successfully paid back her loan and managed to have a small savings.  

With the second cycle loan, she started selling vegetables at the town market and she says her "business runs good." 

Tingneikim switched from weaving to selling vegetables. She says she wanted a daily regular income and wanted to join a local agency for daily savings. The town market is open six days a week and it is closed only on Sunday. She started purchasing fresh vegetables from village farmers and neighbouring villagers. She takes them to the town market shed and sells them. The town market is the busiest place in the whole town. People from all corners of the districts throng in to purchase. After her vegetable selling business started, she joined the group savings plan and also manages daily savings against the local investment agency. The savings will be matured after a period of six months with interest. 

She is also happy to say that both her husband and she work hard and are now in a position to own a used mini-van, which her husband drives and also uses for money making.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more stocks of vegetables and also buy seeds and saplings to sell at the market. She is planning to construct a house ten years down the line, if her savings plan is successful. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the financial assistance and says she will remain obliged for the welfare and support that has been shown her as well as towards the group. Thank you, Kiva.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: To purchase various vegetables, seeds and saplings to sell and earn profits.

loans.name: Sanarei Group

texts.en:
Sanarei is a group of six members and they are the residents of a small hilly village in the state of Manipur, which is located in the northeastern part of India. They are a new SHG group and they all possess the same kind of business: they sell vegetables in the town market on a regular basis. Though they do not generate a huge amount of profit from this activity, yet they say that they are able to sustain and support their families when they manage the family expenses prudently. hough they carry out their business in the hill town, they all reside in the village, which is 1 ½ km distant from the town. They come to the town market every morning and carry out their activities. 

The group is represented by Apabi, who is pictured with her hand raised. Apabi's husband is a daily wage earner who works in the field in the village. She has two daughters and one son. She sells some local delicacies such as boiled egg, fruits, tomatoes, chillies, dried fish, and she also sells vegetables and other items in the market. With the profit she gets, she pays the monthly and daily expenses of the children's schooling, and she is also able to manage the family's expenses. But the income that she generates from her activity is not enough to meet other requirement of the children and the family. 

She says she manages the daily expenses of the family but is not able to have savings. The shortage of capital for the shop is also a factor that diminishes the income from the shop. She says if she can do some savings, which will be her capital as well as her future savings, then she is shooting two birds with one stone.

With the Kiva loan, she will refill her shop with more dried fish, different local delicacies and other essential commodities. She will also open an account for savings and make sure that her son gets the best education to have a successful career in the future.

She thanks Kiva and WSDS for their support and wishes them good luck in the future.

loans.use: To refill her shop in the town market.

loans.name: Lenlai Lom Group

texts.en:
Kimneo owns a drug shop in the village, which is about 2 ½ kms away from the town market. The town is about 40 kms from the city capital of Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states of India. 

Kimneo belongs to Lenlai Lom Group and she is the featured borrower for the group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Kimneo is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer and during off seasons, he helps Kimneo run errands for the drug shop.

Kimneo has been running a drug shop for more than a couple of years in the village where she resides. She usually get the drugs from the main city wholesalers and sells them in the village with a little profit. Her purpose for running the drug shop is to facilitate the villagers with first aid kits and also to earn an income. The village where she lives is not easily accessible; therefore, she makes sure that the essential drugs are stocked in the shop. The Primary Health Centre in the village is defunct due to irregular attendance of the staff. The villagers and neighbouring villagers ask for first aid kits in Kimneo’s drug shop before they visit hospitals in the main capital city.
 
With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more stocks of advanced drugs for the drug shop and sell them. She will also purchase baby diapers, adult diapers, baby soap and sanitation pads. These were not available before, but she is planning to include them once she avails the loan from Kiva.

She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the wonderful work that has been shown towards the group. 

Her dream is to let one of her children pursue a pharmacy degree. She wants her children to continue what she has started. She says, “We earn to live, but we live more when we could help others.” 

The presence of Kimneo’s drug shop has been one of the relieving factors for the villagers. They can now purchase cough syrup or a dextrose injection available at her shop, and that saves the villagers the fares from going to the town market. 

The rest of the group members are engaged in different income-generating activities like piggery and weaving.

loans.use: To refill her drug shop with more advanced drugs for the people around the village.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy’s grandma was a very good gourmet chef in Los Angeles and, by growing up with her, Nancy inherited her spirit to make gourmet food. 

For years, she always cooked gourmet food to treat her friends at home as a hobby. She was a primary school teacher, but her dream of making her gourmet food available for more people was always in her mind. She could not pursue her idea, however, because she had to take care of her grandmother and her mother. 

Now, her grandma and her mother have passed away and she recently was laid off from the school district too. She thought that maybe this is the time to start her business. The Viola’s Gourmet Goodies brand was created by Nancy’s grandma. She decided to inherit this brand and use the formula she created to make the jellies. She worked 24/7 to market her jellies throughout California. Her hard work paid off. Whole Foods Market chain decided to carry her products. She had already invested her savings in the marketing and sample productions. Now, she needs money to produce the products to fulfill the order. 

Because she doesn’t have income now, no bank would give her a loan. The $6,500 Kiva loan will help her to buy the materials to fulfill the order for Whole Foods Market.

loans.use: To purchase the material to manufacture her jellies.

loans.name: Donnyette

texts.en:
Growing up, Donnyette was always the one her friends went to for advice.

“I’ve always been that person who thought I knew everything,” Donnyette says with a smile. “People would come to me, lean on me for advice and I’d tell them what I thought. I always thought I’d be the next Dear Abby or Ann Landers, actually!”

As a Licensed Clinical Social Worker in her hometown of New Orleans for 18 years, Donnyette has certainly helped many people, particularly children, through her work, even if she hasn’t landed a syndicated newspaper column just yet. 

Donnyette’s next challenge is taking her work to the next level by starting a behavioral health agency, strategically named Positive Direction Support Services, LLC. 

Throughout her career, Donnyette has worked with people of all ages, but her passion is working with children. Most recently, she has served as a school social worker in the Orleans Parish School District. 

Before Hurricane Katrina, she launched a program at her church called Sister to Sister Devotion, which aimed to build self-esteem and peer support among teenage girls. This was Donnyette’s passion for eight years until Hurricane Katrina displaced the group’s membership. The now adult members of the group are still in touch with Donnyette and want to organize a reunion, to re-connect with what they call their “foundation.”

It was the experience from that first entrepreneurial – albeit volunteer – venture that inspired Donnyette to launch her own practice. Positive Direction is engaged in a partnership with the Louisiana Office of Behavioral Health to provide counseling and teaching services, clinical assessments and psychiatric evaluations for children in the New Orleans metropolitan area. “I’m responding to a significant need in New Orleans for quality social work services that are offered directly in the community" (in clients’ homes, in schools and other settings such as churches), she says. 

While Donnyette’s experience speaks for itself, finding funding for the relatively small amount needed to open her practice was a challenge and she is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan. 

Donnyette plans to hire more social workers as she grows her practice and aims to build the kind of team spirit and commitment that she experienced at some of her past workplaces. 

“The kids deserve it; they didn’t ask to have the issues that they have,” she says. “We want to promote hope, healing and wholeness to all the children and their families in [the hope] that it will become infectious throughout our ailing community.”

So while Donnyette is taking on a new business venture and now must focus on the details of the business side as much as directly counseling clients, she maintains the same dedication to helping people that she had as a child.

“I still have that save the world mentality,” she says. “It’s just a little different now.”

loans.use: To purchase office equipment and supplies, furniture and signage for new clinical social work practice.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is 43 years old and married. She has one child.

Mailyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. 

Mailyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice grains, snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Mailyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Mailyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice grains, snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Araceli has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from tailoring.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 35 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a wood lamination business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a 13000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her wood lamination business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for five years now, and is requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, etc. In the future, Christine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Anacleta requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

She has been in this business for 40 years.

In the future, Anacleta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and a married mother of six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Donecia

texts.en:
Donecia is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Donecia is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Donecia has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Donecia requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Donecia has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Donecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Merlinda has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is being offered to Lurdes to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and also a refrigerator to keep drinks in. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2001. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José es un pequeño empresario rural que se dedica a la producción y acopio de café en la zona Norte – Segovia de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una pequeña finca de 5.6 Hectáreas de las cuales 2 son de café. El está integrado a las plataformas de negocios promovidas por la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a través de las cuales comercializa el café que produce y acopia de otros productores más pequeños ubicados en su comunidad, pero que no pueden acceder a servicios de micro-crédito por ser montos muy pequeños. La red de productores de café que atiende este pequeño empresario es de 15, la cual ha venido incrementando desde que inició su actividad de acopio hace 4 años.

Para este ciclo este pequeño empresario está solicitando un crédito para habilitar a los 15 pequeños productores de café que atiende, a los cuales facilitará los insumos que requieren para el mantenimiento de sus cosechas. Su meta en unos 5 años es duplicar el número de productores atendidos y manejar una cartera de US$4,000. 

José se siente satisfecho al poder facilitar a productores pequeños, recursos para que puedan atender sus plantaciones de café y ayudarlos a crecer para que más adelante ellos puedan ser sujetos de crédito de parte de organizaciones financieras.
texts.en:
José is a rural small business owner who works producing and storing coffee in the northern part of Nicaragua in Segovia.  He has a small farm of 5.6 hectares, of which 2 hectares are planted with coffee.  He has joined the business platforms promoted by the Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).  Through these, he sells the coffee he produces and the stores from other small producers located in his community, but who are too small to access micro-loan services because the amounts are so small.  The network of producers that he serves has 15 members in it, which has been growing since he started this work four years ago.

For this cycle, this small businessman is requesting a loan to set up the 15 small coffee producers he serves since he provides the supplies they need to maintain their crops.  His goal is to double the number of producers he works with in five years and manage a portfolio of $4,000.  

José feels satisfied that he can facilitate for the small producers and provide them with resources so they can care for their coffee crops and help them grow so that later they can request loans from financing organizations.

loans.use: to set up his network of small coffee producers with farming supplies.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Махбуба является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Деньги, которые он отправляет, не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Махбуба с детства всегда мечтала открыть свой бизнес шитьём одежды, так как она является опытной швеёй. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьём женской одежды. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки ткани и швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult life conditions can force one to redirect one's energies and motivate existing resources. Mahbuba is one such person, as she tries to improve her life and stimulate the economic well-being of the family. She is 38 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. The money that he sends back is not enough to cover all of the family's necessary expenses. 

Since her youth, Mahbuba has dreamed of opening her own clothes sewing business, since she is an experienced seamstress. With that goal in mind, she took the course "To Get Ahead" from the organization Association of Business Women. Now she can finally start her business and become successful in this field. She wants to start a business sewing women's clothing. From the resulting income, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food products. 

She is applying for a loan of $3,000 USD to purchase fabrics and sewing machines to start the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabrics to start a new business

loans.name: Lustrica

texts.en:
Lustrica is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 8 years. She is a married woman with eight children. 

Lustrica is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to buy fuel for the tractor. With these inputs, she hopes to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Lustrica hope to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to buy fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has two children. She is 51 and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. Jocelyn raises fish and crabs for sale to earn a living. To add to her income, she also has a store selling goods in her neighborhood. 

Recently, she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles and milk. In 2011, Jocelyn became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and milk

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
