Danilo is a 52-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has six children. The oldest child is 15, while the youngest is 7.

Danilo engages in tailoring services such as dressmaking and alterations. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy cloth and other sewing materials to continue to serve his customers. 

In the future, Danilo would like to expand his tailoring services to provide his children with good living conditions and to send all his children to college.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other sewing materials

loans.name: Fiffawa 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFFAWA 1 est composé de dix neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Celestine Dina est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Celestine Dina est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Parfait. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Celestine Dina vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Celestine Dina n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges du ménage, Celestine Dina vend depuis six ans, des tissus, des produits cosmétiques, des mèches et des bijoux de façon secondaire à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Celestine Dina s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Celestine Dina sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FIFFAWA 1, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The FIFFAWA 1 group comprises nineteen members who live in the same neighborhood. It is the second time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise its level of activity. 

Celestine Dina, the group's representative, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 43 years old and married to a man named Parfait with whom she has three children.  Some of their children are in school and all are their dependents.  Celestine Dina lives with her husband and children and jointly takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

Celestine Dina did not go to school. In order to contribute to the household's various expenses, she has been selling fabrics, cosmetics, hair extensions and, additionally, some jewelry, from her home, for the past six years.  This activity procures her a non-negligible source of income. She buys her merchandise from a market located in Benin.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the FIFFAWA 1 group.  Their first loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, who is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is a 57-year-old widower with five children. He lives with his married child. In order to support some of his needs, Alfredo operates a business providing "trysikad" (pedicab) services in the local community. He has been in this business for more than five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Alfredo joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 5,800 PHP to repair his tricycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his tricycle.

loans.name: Laverna

texts.en: Laverna lives in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is 56 years old and operates her own sari sari store selling goods in their community. In 2009, she became a member of GDMPC and recently borrowed a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy rice for sale. She plans to save a portion from her generated income for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy rice for sale

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias desde 2 años, le gusta este tipo de créditos por la rapidez y por solidaridad y compañerismo de todas las integrantes de este grupo. Vive en el cantón de Paute lugar que goza de un clima cálido, cuenta con una geografía accidentada por lo que tiene bellos paisajes, sus tierras son muy fértiles por lo que se cosechan las más hermosas flores, se da una gran variedad de frutas, su gente es amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y  a la agricultura.

La Señora Rosa tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 2 son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y ayudan en la económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña tiene una tienda desde hace dos años en la cual labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, como pasa en casa también cría gallinas y cuyes, siembra hortalizas que son para el consumo de su casa y también para la venta. 

El dinero de su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de víveres para su tienda. 

Su meta ampliar más su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa has been part of the Mujeres Solidarias (United Women) communal bank for 2 years. She likes this type of loan because of the speed and because of the solidarity and camaraderie of all the members of this group. She lives in Paute canton, which enjoys a warm climate. It has a rugged geography, due to which it has beautiful landscapes. Its land is very fertile, so the most beautiful flowers are grown and a great variety of fruit is produced. Its people are friendly and courteous and still maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples. They work in business, raising animals, and farming.

Rosa is 53 years old. She is married and has 4 children from this union. Two are married and live independently. Her two single daughters work and help with the finances. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They live in their own house.

She has had a shop for two years in which she works every day without a fixed schedule. Since she is at home, she also raises chickens and guinea pigs and plants vegetables for her household's consumption as well as for sale.

The money from her loan will be used to buy provisions for her store.

Her goal is to further expand her store.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Mylene has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from farming coconut.

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell for her buying and selling dried coconut meat business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ruby has a general store business in the Philippines. Ruby has been in this business for three years.

Ruby requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, bread, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, bread, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 57, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Tomas and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Teresita operates the 'buy and sell' business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are women’s clothes and other like products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy Ready-To-Wear products and merchandise items like women’s clothing to expand her product inventory.

Teresita dreams of being a successful businesswoman and hopes that her business will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of Ready-To-Wear products like women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish and fruit to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for eleven years now, and also earns additional income from selling fruit.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jalyn

texts.en:
Jalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a 'buy and sell' banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell.

Jalyn has been in this business for 15 years now,.

In the future, Jalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is 30 years old and is happily married to Robinson. God has blessed them with three loving children. Her eldest is the only one who goes to school since her other two children are still very young. Life indeed is hard. But, by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Jeralyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the stores are connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 PHP of cooking oil, an egg, or other products. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price. Then she will sell them per piece, for a higher price, to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting 17,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help to her to add more products to her store.

Jeralyn hopes that her business will grow and expand. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Maica

texts.en:
Maica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Maica has been in this business for five years. Maica earns additional income from pig fattening and selling home products. Maica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Joset

texts.en:
Joset works hard to support her family. She is married and has a operated a fishing business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Joset has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет троих замечательных детей. Живут они вместе с семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Хорошо оплачиваемую работу в этом посёлке найти очень трудно, поэтому Зафар занимается собственным бизнесом, который приносит ему стабильный хороший доход. Он занимается разведением и убоем телят и коров. Зафар покупает телят на рынке за низкую цену, затем откармливает их и потом продаёт полученное мясо. В этом бизнесе ему помогает его жена. Для продажи мяса у них имеется собственный мясной ларёк на местном рынке. Зафар имеет уже постоянных клиентов, которые ему доверяют в качестве мяса. Доход, который он получает расходуется на пропитание семьи. Но дети Зафара растут и их потребности увеличиваются. Поэтому Зафар хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получать больше дохода и полностью удовлетворять нужды своей семьи. Сейчас Зафар обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить трёх телят для дальнейшего откармливания и продажи. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zafar is an upbeat and hard-working 30-year-old man.  He is married with three excellent children and they all live in a small village.  It is very hard to find a well-paying job in the village, and this is why Zafar has his own business which brings him a good stable income.  He raises and slaughters cows and calves.  Zafar buys calves for a low price at the market, then he fattens them and sells their meat.  His wife helps him in this business.  To sell their meat, they have their own butcher's stall at the local market.  Zafar already has a regular clientele who trust him and the quality of his meat.  He uses the income he receives to feed his family, but his children are growing and their needs are increasing.  For this reason, Zafar wants to expand his business so he can increase his income and fully satisfy his family's needs.  Zafar has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy three calves to raise and sell.  He is expecting a positive result and he thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en: Guilhermina is taking a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and runs a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after applying for her first loan. Guilhermina will buy some additional merchandise for her store such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes, and secondhand bags. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, shoes, and bags

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Pen, 51, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Moung Russey district. She has seven children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and selling grocery items for several years, and the current business earns her family about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Pen has been with VisionFund for three cycles while her group member has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Pen is now leading her group to ask for another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the vicinity of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband makes iron chain by hand in his workshop. The chain is made on a hearth by hammering cut lengths of red-hot wrought iron rod into oval links, one link passing through the next to form a cable. A few days ago the iron rod's coil was stolen from his workshop, and now he is unable to make any chain to sell in order to earn income.

Robina has requested a loan of  PKR 50,000 from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a new iron rod coil to start his business again.

Robina is the mother of 8 children, and it is very difficult to feed all of them each day. Her dream is to provide all of the necessities for each of her children.

Robina is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: To buy thin rods of iron and coils for making chain.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 41 years old and the widowed mother of 3 children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lucille runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Lucille would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 44 years old, married, and the father of 8 children. Three of his children are in school.

Vicente has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and to pay for maintenance for his motorcycle.

Vicente has been in this business for three years. In the future, he would like to save enough money so that he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Monorom's Group

texts.en:
Monorom, 26, lives with one daughter in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. To feed their family, she and her husband earn a living as farmers who grow rice. Having been in this business for 3 years, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to spend for family’s needs. 

Monorom has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to improve her family’s livelihood. As the leader of her group, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. Monorom is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her family’s business. She hopes to increase her crop yields in order to generate more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her family’s farming business

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 30 years old and married with one child. Girlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Girlie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from food vending.

Girlie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 29 years old and married with one child. Gerlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gerlie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gerlie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 37 years old, is married and has three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a general store business in the Philippines. Joseline has been in this business for two years. 

Joseline has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, soap, shampoo, sardines and other groceries for her store.

In the future, Joseline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, soap, shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Mercedes is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell at her food stall.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun, 62, is married with seven dependent children, two of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Sangke district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice, buying and selling garbage and raising cows. She has been running her business for 11 years, earning about KHR 60,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Noun has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has effectively used her loans to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. With a good business, she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying garbage to resell. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past 4 years to support her family. She was inspired by her neighbor Tasleem, who has been doing the same business for 6 years, and she is also a member of BRAC Pakistan.  Naseem beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough dolls to contribute to the family income. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

Naseem is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her larger sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy thread, cloth and wool for sewing dolls.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un productor de Nicaragua, con una finca de 105 Has, de las cuales 10 son de café. Con su esposa se ha dedicado a su finca desde hace 15 años, en la cual cultiva además granos básicos, musáceas, malanga y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero. Sus dos hijos de 19 y 12 años están estudiando.

La producción de café obtenida por este productor en los últimos 3 ciclos, ha sido en promedio de 50 quintales de café oro. Durante el año genera alrededor de 15 empleos temporales en su comunidad. La actividad que más le gusta es cuando se cosecha el café porque es en este tiempo cuando genera más mano de obra y siente que de esa forma puede ayudar a otras familias de su comunidad. 

Para este ciclo, Lorenzo está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar insumos y cubrir una parte de la mano de obra que necesita para las actividades de mantenimiento del café. Su objetivo es que su finca sea una referencia para otros, por el manejo de su plantación de café y sus altos rendimientos, en lo cual continúa trabajando.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a Nicaraguan farmer with a 105-hectare farm, of which 10 are coffee. He started his farm with his wife 15 years ago. On it, he grows staple grains, bananas/plantains, and taro, and he also raises milk cows. His two children, aged 12 and 19, are students.

In the last 3 cycles, this farmer has obtained an average coffee harvest of 5000 pounds of green coffee beans. During the year he creates about 15 temporary jobs in his community. The activity he likes most is when the coffee is harvested, because it is at this time when he creates more work, and he feels that in this way he can help other families in his community.

For this cycle, Lorenzo is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy supplies and cover part of the manual labor that he needs for his coffee maintenance activities. His goal is for his farm to be a model for others because of the management of its coffee crop and its high yields, and he continues to work on it.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay labor for maintaining his coffee crop

loans.name: Noé Ulises

texts.es: Noé es un pequeño productor que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 14 Has., de las cuales 6 son de café. Los rendimientos de este rubro en los últimos 3 ciclos de cosecha han sido 50, 80 y 40 quintales de café oro. La disminución de la producción en el último ciclo se ha debido a la afectación de la roya en la producción de café en el país. Esta y el resto de enfermedades que pueden atacar el cultivo son consideradas por este productor como un desafío, lo cual considera que puede enfrentarse con un manejo integral de su plantación, que incluye la aplicación de fertilizantes en tiempo y forma. Para lograrlo, Noé está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra que necesita para las labores de mantenimiento de su café. Sus planes son ir mejorando las condiciones de su finca y los rendimientos de su café, para obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Noé is a small farmer who lives with his wife and their two children in a rural community in Nicaragua. His farm is 14 hectares of which 6 are coffee. The yields of the crops in the last 3 cycles of harvest have been 50, 80, and 40 quintals of green coffee. 

The decline in the crop in the last cycle was the consequence of coffee rust in the production of coffee in the country. This and other diseases that can attack the crop are considered a risk by the farmer with which he thinks he can cope by integrated management of his farm, which includes the application of fertilizer in a timely manner. To achieve this, Noé is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the laborers he needs to care for the coffee.

His plans are to go on improving the conditions of the farm and his coffee harvest so he can obtain higher earnings and so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the laborers to maintain his coffee.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio  esta en el 1er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 11  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero son consientes y siguen luchando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Noelia, se dedica a la venta de comestibles, y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que con ejemplo de lucha muestra a sus compañeras que por medio del esfuerzo se puede salir adelante y con ese esfuerzo ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles, como ser harina, aceite, leche etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its first cycle of its committee of women program, where everyone works and helps each other get ahead. They are doing the poverty survey in which 11 women are below the poverty line, that is, they have very low incomes, but they are aware and keeping struggling to improve.

One of the members is Noelia who sells groceries and with plenty of effort is moving forward. She is a selfless women, and by example of her fight is showing her partners that through effort it's possible to get ahead and help their families.

Noelia is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to keep selling groceries, including flour, cooking oil, milk, etc. This will help her to settle on her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: purchase flour, cooking oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Anamecer es un grupo muy trabajador, que ha aprendido a salir adelante y a hacer todo tipo de actividades para ir mejorando sus vidas. Están en su ciclo numero 23 del programa de comité de mujeres, y es fiel reflejo del trabajo que hacen. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación, lo que mostró que ninguna esta con ingresos por debajo, pero son conscientes de que deben seguir trabajando para seguir creciendo.
Lucia es una de las integrantes, quien tiene una pequeña, pero surtida despensa en su casa, y cuenta que por medio de su grupo y a la ayuda de ellas pudo ir mejorando bastante. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles de todo tipo para poder venderlos en su despensa y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Amanecer is a hardworking group whose members have learned to get ahead and do all sorts of activities to keep improving their lives. They are in their 23rd loan cycle of the women’s communal bank program and it is an accurate reflection of the work they do. They took the poverty elimination survey, which showed that no one had income below the poverty line, but they are aware that they should keep working to continue growing. 

Lucia is one of the members and she has a small but stocked store in her home. She says that through her group and their help she was able to progress quite a bit. She is requesting this loan to use to buy groceries of all kinds in order to sell them in her store and thus continue giving her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel es un excelente cliente de la fundación, cuenta con una casa de venta de artículos de electricidad y ofrece sus servicios de electricista.
El opto por el crédito con la Fundación para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser cables, focos,  artículos de electricidad y demás, ya que su local va en crecimiento, y su intención es ir aumentando la variedad de artículos para satisfacer en mayor medida las necesidades de sus clientes, de esta forma que todo lo que uno busque lo encuentre ahí, esta incorporando de a poco también accesorios para el mejoramiento de la vivienda.
El esta muy contento por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que por medio de esto esta mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is an excellent client of the Fundacion.  He has a store where he sells electrical supplies, and he offers his services as an electrician.  He chose to obtain a loan from the Fundacion so that he could invest in supplies for his business, such as cables, bulbs, electrical supplies, and other items, because his business is growing.  His plan is to increase the variety of items in his business so that he can better meet the needs of his customers.  This way, whatever they are looking for, they will find in his store.  He is also starting to sell home improvement accessories.  

Angel is very pleased with the opportunity that he is receiving, because through this loan he will be improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy cables, bulbs, electrical supplies, and other items

loans.name: Callei Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Callei  están en el 7mo ciclo, cuentan con una gran expectativas, recibieron la capacitación del manual del emprendedurismo y quieren salir adelante por medio de el.
Maria es una de ellas, quien tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que después poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo fue mejorando.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para la compra de comestibles para poder surtir su despensa, y también bebidas en general, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando su atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
The Callei Group is in its seventh loan cycle. They have great hopes for the future. They have received the entrepreneurs' training manual and want to use it to help them get ahead. 

Maria is one of the members. She runs a small well-stocked store where she works every day starting very early in the morning providing her customers with everything they need.  She says that she started with very little but over time and by making a great effort life is getting better.

Today she is seeking a loan to buy stock and a range of soft drinks to improve her store.  In this way she will be able to keep the store going and improve service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy stock and drinks for her grocery store

loans.name: Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Unidas de San Antonio, se encuentra en el 8º ciclo del programa de comité, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, desean seguir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo del programa que les ayudará ir mejorando día a día.
La Sra. Ana es Comerciante, tiene una pequeño puesto de ventas variadas, vive en casa propia con su marido e hijos,  es la presidenta del grupo, y ella trata de mantener motivada a sus integrantes para que siempre estén unidas y poder lograr alcanzar el objetivo de cada una con ayuda mutua y solidaridad.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de comestibles y frutas para su negocio, ella vende su propia producción en un puesto frente a su casa y a ello le anexa frutos cítricos, miel de abeja y miel de caña, con paciencia va incrementando sus ventas para obtener un mayor ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
The Unidas de San Antonio community bank is in their 8th cycle with the program.  All of the group members work in different areas and they all want to continue growing and count on the support of the program to help them improve day by day.

Ana is a saleswoman.  She has a small stall where she sells a variety of items.  She lives in a house she owns with her husband and children.  She is the president of the group and tries to keep the members motivated so that they are always united and each member can achieve their objectives with mutual help and solidarity.

Ana is requesting this loan to purchase food items and fruit for her business.  She sells her own production at a stall in front of her house and adds citrus fruits, honey, and sugarcane.  With patience, she is increasing her sales to earn a better family income.

loans.use: to purchase food items and fruit.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres están en la colonia Fortuna,  son mujeres indígenas , de una zona bastante alejada y con poco acceso, y si se puede decir un poco carente de seguridad. Ellas están recibiendo esta oportunidad de recibir un crédito para ir mejorando sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cirila, quien se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, y por medio de ese trabajo está luchando por salir adelante. Tiene la idea de ir mejorando su negocio, y es por eso que está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, ya que de esa forma podrá emprender algo nuevo y luchar por mejorar sus ingresos  para poder ayudar a su familia.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que es la primera vez que esta pudiendo acceder a una.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is in their first loan cycle of the women's committee program in Fortuna.  They are indigenous women from an area far away, with little access, and a lack of security.  They are receiving this opportunity to take out a loan to improve their lives.

One of the group members is Cirila, who works raising animals.  With this work, she is fighting to improve herself.  She had the idea of improving her business and decided to request this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing items.  This will allow her to learn a new business and improve her income to help her family.   

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving since this is the first time she has been able to access a loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia 2  está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Delia forma parte de este grupo, que con mucho esfuerzo esta integrando. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace. Comenta también que tiene buena habilidad para las comidas, y que por eso le está yendo bien y está aumentando día a día la cantidad de clientes. Su sueño es poder tener algún día un gran puesto de comidas y deleitar a más personas con las delicias que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, etc. y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Sagrada Familia 2 group is in their 4th loan cycle with the program.  They are from the city of Concepción, which is an area not far from the central zone that is growing.  It is an area that is difficult to access, so the members of the group want to fight for it to continue growing and give the area where they live a better environment, and it is growing slowly.

Delia is a member of the group who joined with a lot of effort.  She says that she works selling food that she makes.  She also comments that she has a skill for food and this is why it is going well and she is increasing her number of customers every day.  Her dream is to have a large food stall and delight more people with the delicious things she makes.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for her food such as vegetables and meat.  This will help her continue to grow her business and give her family what they need to live a life without privation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food such as vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Gena owns and operates a "balut" food stall in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns 12,600 PHP a month. 

Gena joined GDMPC in 2008. She requests a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more eggs for her balut-vending business. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for her balut-vending business

loans.name: Jekafo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAFO 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec NAMINATA debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called Jèkafo I are married women with an average age of 44 years, five children, all living in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages in the municipality of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali: SIKASSO. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities successfully during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, past loans having been correctly repaid. Naminata, standing second from right to left, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy seeds, pay labor costs and purchase fertilizer to maintain one hectare. Her production is sold at the village level and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 95,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Jekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAFO 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec FATOUMATA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The members of the group called Jèkafo 2 are married women with an average age of 45 years, five children, all living in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages in the municipality of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali: SIKASSO. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities successfully during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, past loans having been correctly repaid. 

Fatoumata, standing in the middle, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to pay labor costs, buy seeds,  and purchase fertilizer to maintain one hectare. Her production is sold at the village level and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Jekafo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAFO 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec CHATA MOUSSA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called Jèkafo 3 are married women with an average age of 41 years, four children, all living in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages in the municipality of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali: SIKASSO. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities successfully during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, past loans having been correctly repaid. 

Chata Moussa, standing in the middle, cultivates peanuts. With her loan, she intends to pay plowing costs and buy fertilizer to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold at the level of the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 90,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Yanuncay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Yanuncay está formado por 11 mujeres quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias, las socias son mujeres amables, gentiles y siempre mantienen su carisma, aun conservan su cultura y tradiciones. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de mucha naturaleza, su arquitectura es colonial, Cuenca es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía es muy variada por lo que cautiva el paladar de todos los turistas que la visitan.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosenda, forma parte del grupo de crédito Yanuncay, grupo que le gusta mucho por la unión e integración que existe ya que todos son muy buenas amigas y comparten gratos momentos en cada reunión.

La Señora. Rosenda tiene 61 años, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos que son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo es de profesión ebanista y labora en un taller de carpintería que es de su propiedad.

Doña Rocenda se dedica a la docencia desde hace 38 años, tiempo en el que ha sido muy gratificante ya que ha enseñado a muchos niños, algunos les ha visto crecer y convertirse en profesionales, siendo eso su mayor orgullos. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de madera para el taller de su esposo trabajo que le ayuda en sus tiempos libres y también en materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su hogar. 

Su sueño es continuar creciendo en el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
The “Yanuncay” communal bank consists of 11 women who work in different activities  that enable them to pay the household expenses and get ahead with their families. The members are friendly, gentle, and always maintain their charisma still keeping their traditional culture. They live in the city of Cuenca, a place full of nature and colonial architecture. Cuenca has been a World Cultural Heritage Site since December 1999. Its cuisine is varied so that it captivates the palate of all the visiting tourists.

One of the members of the communal bank “Yanuncay” is Rosenda, who likes the group very much because of the support and integration that exists as they are all good friends and they share great moments at each meeting.

Rosenda is 61 years old, married and through this relationship has four children, all adults, married and independent. Her husband is a cabinetmaker, and works in a carpentry shop that he owns.

Rosenda has been working as a teacher for 38 years, a time that has been very rewarding as she has taught many children. She has seen some of them grow up and become professionals, and this has made her very proud.

She is going to invest the loan to buy wood for her husband’s workshop that he can work on in his free time and will also buy construction supplies for home improvements.

Her dream is that the family business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy wood and construction supplies.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 46 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Vicenta has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, bread, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 39 years old.

Vilma has a business selling medicines and vitamins in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of medicine and vitamins

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es: El cliente pertenece a Fortín.  Anteriormente vendía zapatos recorriendo, pero en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas en su local, lo cual le ha resultado exitoso.  Trabaja desde temprano en la mañana hasta la 1:30 pm aproximadamente.  Tiene una conviviente y todos sus hijos ya tienen compromiso.  Espera en un futuro poder terminar de construír su vivienda.  Por el momento necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertirlo en la adecuación del local de su comedor.
texts.en: César Augusto lives in the Fortin neighborhood of Guayaquil.  He previously sold shoes on the street, but now he has a business selling food from his eatery, and this business has been successful.  He works from very early in the morning until about 1:30pm.  He has a partner, and all of their children are already in committed relationships.  In the future, hopes to be able to finish construction on his house.  At this time, he needs a loan to make improvements to his eatery.

loans.use: to make improvements to his business premises (eatery)

loans.name: María Bernarda

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra desde hace 2 años en el grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias. Vive en el cantón de Paute lugar que goza de un clima cálido, cuenta con una geografía accidentada por lo que tiene bellos paisajes, sus tierras son muy fértiles por lo que se cosechan las más hermosas flores y se da una gran variedad de frutas, su gente es amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Le gusta el grupo por la integración, amistad y compañerismo de todos los miembros.

La Señora. María tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María se dedica a las tareas del campo y lo que cosecha vende en el mercado del cantón, también cría cerdos, pollos y cuyes, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de tener su solvencia económica. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios del colegio y poder estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the Mujeres Solidarias [Women Together] loan group for 2 years. She lives in the Paute canton. This is a region that enjoys a warm climate. Its rough terrain makes for beautiful landscapes. The land is very fertile and produces lovely flowers and a wide variety of fruit. The people are friendly and kind; they still maintain the culture and traditions of their heritage. They work in commerce, animal production and agriculture. She likes the group because of the inclusiveness, friendship and companionship of all the members.

Maria is 22. She is a single mother of a 2-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents and shares living expenses with them. They own their own house.

Maria works in the fields and sells her harvest in the regional market. She also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs. These activities give her the opportunity to have economic solvency.

She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to finish high school and be able to study at a university.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias, vive en el cantón de Paute lugar que goza de un clima cálido, cuenta con una geografía accidentada por lo que tiene bellos paisajes, sus tierras son muy fértiles por lo que se cosechan las más hermosas flores y se da una gran variedad de frutas, su gente es amable y gentil,  aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora Rosa tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20,18, 16 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas y viven  independientes, su tercer hijo trabaja  y le ayuda económicamente, su última hija está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la dura tarea del campo como es la agricultura, lo que cosecha  vende y lo utiliza en su hogar, también cría cuyes, cerdos y pollos. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y en alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es agrandar su galpón de pollos.
texts.en:
Rosa is doing her second loan alongside her friends and partners in the borrowing group Women United. She lives in Paute county, a place that enjoys a warm climate and has a rugged terrain with beautiful landscapes. The soil is very fertile, so it reaps the most beautiful flowers and produces a great variety of fruits. The people are friendly and gentle, and they still maintain the culture and tradition of their villages, doing trade and agriculture and raising animals. 

Rosa is 40 years old, married, and has conceived four children ages 20, 18, 16 and 15. Her first two daughters are married and live independently. Her third son works and helps her economically, and her last daughter is studying at the local high school. Rosa's husband works as a carpenter, and they own the home they live in. 

Rosa does the hard work of the field, which is agriculture, and what she harvests she sells and uses in her home. She also raises guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens. 

She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs and animal feed.

Rosa's goal is to expand her chicken coop.

loans.use: purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Bunlin's Group

texts.en:
Bunlin is 29 years old and married. She has two children. Living in a village in the Sangke district, Bunlin farms rice while her husband is a paid construction worker in the village. Having been in business for six years, she manages to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children. 

This is the first loan for Bunlin’s group with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Bunlin is going to use her portion to buy a tractor for operating her farming business. She hopes to plow her paddy field in a timely fashion so as to get a high crop yield.

loans.use: To buy a tractor for operating her farming business

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 33 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Her family lives in a village of the Sampov Meas District of Pursat Province. Se earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Her husband helps to earn extra income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the village. 

Ry has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. Now, she is applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to buy buffalo. With this loan, she hopes to grow more crops and sell them for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 8 children. She is living in a very small house with her huge family. She is facing so many hurdles to sustain the life of her family. Her husband is the only person earning money in the family. He is a tailor by profession. He has excellent tailoring skills. His customers appreciate his work. He needs to purchase one more sewing machine to complete the demands of his customers on time. By purchasing one more machine he will be able to satisfy his customers more efficiently. 

His wife Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and he is therefore unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es:
Epifanio es un hombre de familia vive, con su pareja en unión libre y es padre de 2 hijos. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias hace aproximadamente 20 años. Actualmente labora en fincas como mayordomo, encargado especialmente del cuidado, cría y engorde de lechones, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para el sustento de su familia durante todos estos años.
El prestatario es un hombre luchador, entregado a su familia y a su trabajo, por eso se motivó a solicitar el segundo ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más lechones (crías de cerdos), para criarlos y engordarlos, ya que en el segundo semestre del año las ventas de éstos se incrementan, permitiéndole aumentar sus ingresos para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.  
Epifanio sueña con poder comprar muchos más lechones, para poder tener disponibilidad suficiente cuando sus clientes lo requieran y de esta manera recibir más ingresos y poder ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Epifanio is a family man who lives with his partner in a common-law marriage.  He is the father of 2 children.  He has lived in the countryside all of his life, and this is where he learned to do agricultural work 20 years ago.  He now works on farms as a supervisor who is in charge of raising and fattening pigs.  This is how he has obtained the income to support his family over all of these years.

This borrower is a tenacious man who is dedicated to his family and his work.  This is why he was motivated to request his second loan.  His goal is to invest in more pigs to raise and fatten, because in the second half of the year sales tend to rise, and this will allow him to increase his income so that he can continue to support his household.

Epifanio dreams of being able to buy many more pigs so that he could have sufficient quantity to meet his customer's needs.  In this way, he could generate more income and be able to offer his family a better quality of life and his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: San Juan Bosco Group

texts.es:
San Juan Bosco, se formo en ciudad del Este, gracias al deseo de crecer y superarse de sus miembros, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada y por medio del trabajo de todas ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Mercedes es una de ellas , quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella se dedica a ser empleada domestica y también se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como se puede ver ella es una mujer que trabaja arduamente y lucha por salir adelante. Se esfuerza bastante y además lleva la responsabilidad de ser la presidenta del grupo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles y ayudando a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Juan Bosco Group was formed in in the city of Este, and thanks to its members' desire to grow and overcome, they are doing the "Poverty Spotlight" program to find out each members' situation. Through everyone's work, they keep improving their economic situation. 

Mercedes is one of the members, and in her survey showed that her poverty level is within level one, that is, she has a very low income. She is employed domestically and also works selling groceries. As can be seen, she is a woman that works hard and struggles to get ahead. She is trying very hard, in addition to having the responsibility of being the president of the group. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of meats, vegetables, condiments and other supplies to keep selling her groceries and to keep helping her family through her income.

loans.use: purchase meats, vegetables, condiments and other supplies to make food.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio tiene 56 años, esta casado con la señora Matilde hace más de 30 años, tiene una hija quien es mayor de edad y profesional que gracias al esfuerzo y lucha de ambos, hoy es una persona de bien.
Julio empezó con el cultivo de tomates, y posterior venta en el mercado local, luego de un buen tiempo habilita para su propio local, vendiendo sus productos como tomates y cebollas, además de frutas variadas. Don Julio todos los días empieza bien temprano realiza el recorrido para llegar hasta su puesto de venta en el mercado. Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada, pues uno de los pioneros en el rubro en su comunidad.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de verduras que el no cultiva como papa, cebolla, zanahorias, y frutas, y de esa forma surtir mas su negocio y dar a sus clientes lo que buscan.
texts.en:
Julio, age 56, has been married to Matilde for over 30 years.  He has an adult daughter who is a professional thanks to both of their efforts and struggles.  She is now an upstanding person.

Julio started growing tomatoes and later selling them at the local market.  After some time he was able to have his own place where he sells his products like tomatoes, onions, and various fruits.

Julio starts every day very early to make his journey into his stand at the market.  He currently has established customers, and he is one of the pioneers in this field in his community.

He needs the loan to buy vegetables that he does not grow like potatoes, onions, carrots, and fruits.  This way he will stock his business more, and he will give his customers what they are looking for.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, and fruits in order to stock his business.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ada es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 48 años, es Viuda, tiene 2 hijos, los que crió con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, quienes hoy en día ya son personas de bien.
Ella tiene una Mercería en el centro de la ciudad, con muy buena clientela. Ella es una persona que no se deja abatir, lucha y se esfuerza por poder cumplir con sus metas y lo está logrando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de artículos en general, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, calzados y demás, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad de prendas.
texts.en:
Ada is from the city of Santani.  She is 48 yeas old, widowed, and has two children who she raised with a lot of effort and dedication and are now respectable people.

She has a clothing store in the center of the city with a good customer base.  She is a person who does not stop fighting and making an effort to be able to meet her goals and she is achieving them.

Ada is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of general merchandise such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, shoes, and other items.   She wants to be able to continue giving her customers a good variety of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts, shoes, and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Ciudad Nueva Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ciudad Nueva está en su ciclo número 17° del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y que están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, son 15 integrantes, pero esta vez solo 13 retiran crédito, y de ellas todas se encuentran con un nivel medio de ingresos, pero siguen luchando por ir mejorando.
Florencia, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar para su despensa, y por medio de ese negocio ayuda a su familia. Ella empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su trabajo esta como hoy esta.
Solicita de este crédito para comprar comestibles, bebidas, leche, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de buena calidad. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo todas juntas por medio de este crédito.
texts.en:
The group called Ciudad Nueva ["New City"] is in its 17th term of the women's committee program.  They are hardworking women and they are doing the poverty elimination survey.  There are 15 members, but this time only 13 are taking out loans.  Of these, all are middle income, but continue to fight to get ahead.  

Florencia is a very hardworking woman who, through her efforts and sacrifice, was able to start a small grocery store, and through this business, help her family.  She started with very little, but thanks to her work, it is what it is today.  

She is applying for this loan to buy groceries, drinks, milk, vegetables and other ingredients in order to be able to continue offering her customers good quality products.  She is grateful for this opportunity that they are all receiving together through this loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, milk, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor es una persona que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante, este es su segundo crédito en Kiva, y comenta que su crédito anterior le sirvió para poder surtir su negocio y poder dar así un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita de este nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de corona, cadena, piñón, ejes etc., y así seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que le piden. Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando para ayudar a su familia
texts.en:
Victor is a person who, through a lot of work and effort, is getting ahead.  This is his second loan with Kiva, and he says that his previous loan helped him to stock his business and thus offer good service to his customers.

He is applying for this new loan in order to invest it in purchasing sprockets, chains, pinions, axels, etc., and thus continue giving his customers everything they ask for.

He is very grateful for the opportunity he is getting, since he will be able to continue growing and improving in order to help his family.

loans.use: to buy sprockets, chains, pinions, axels, etc.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El joven Edgar de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, él tiene un taller de refrigeración para automóvil hace 7 años, anteriormente él trabajaba para otra persona pero con el tiempo fue adquiriendo sus propias herramientas y así se independizo, y ahora tiene su taller en su casa.
También recibe trabajos de otras personas, está casado y tiene dos hijos, por quienes lucha incansablemente para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida mejor.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su taller, y para que de esa forma pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edgar, age 28, lives in the city of Itá.  He has had an air conditioning shop for automobiles for seven years.  He used to work for another person.  However, in time he was getting his own tools, and he became independent this way.  He now has his own workshop at his house.  He also gets jobs from other people.  

He is married and has two children.  He works tirelessly in order to be able to give them what they need to have a better life.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy replacement parts for his shop.  This way he will be able to continue giving good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his air conditioning workshop.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es alumna regular de la cerrera fisioterapia y también trabaja desde hace tres años. Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, y es por eso que está estudiando arduamente.
Comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia y también convertirse en un profesional que sea útil, no solo a si mismo sino también a la sociedad.
Solicitó el crédito para el pago total de la cerrera ya que la misma es un poco costosa. Su deseo es recibirse para poder trabajar y ayudarle a las personas.
texts.en:
Nora is a full-time student in physiotherapy and has also been working for three years. She wants to make something of herself in life, so she is studying hard.
She notes that she hopes her studies will enable her to help her family and have a career that is useful not just to herself but also to society as a whole.
She requested this loan to pay for her university education, which is somewhat expensive. She wants to graduate so she can find a job and help people.

loans.use: to pay all of her tuition and fees for university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bananas, pork, sugar, cooking oil, gas and other ingredients needed in her business

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children ages eight, six and three years old. She is engaged in a pottery-making business. She makes pots made of clay and a mixture of cement. She has been operating a pottery for almost nine years. Aside from the pottery  business, she also makes baskets made of nito (native palm).

Emerenciana requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more clay, cement, and materials for basket weaving like nito (native palm). In the future, Emerenciana would like to expand both her business to support her family and also to continue send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy clay, cement, and materials for basket weaving like nito (native palm).

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells groceries in Kangundo town and the business has been profitable.

This is her third loan term with KADET Ltd. and she plans to buy more stock of bananas, sweet potatoes, fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to have enough stock to sell as well as make more profits which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Janet hopes to expand her business and open a bigger grocery store as well as add more varieties of groceries to boost her business further.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bananas, potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta does farming in Kangundo town where she plants vegetables, maize, beans and bananas and also keeps dairy cattle. She has been in the farming business for six years and it has been profitable. She is 34 years old and married with three children. 

This being her first loan term, she plans to buy vegetable seedlings to plant in her farm and fertilizer to enhance her farm. She also plans to buy feed for her cows. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her farming business by planting more varieties of cash crops and thereby become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells clothes in Tala town and has been in this business for the past five years. 

This is her second loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She hopes to make more profits with which she will use to educate her children by paying for their school fees. 

She hopes to grow her business by selling more varieties of clothes, making more income and being able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 65 years old, married and has eight children. She does farming in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans and vegetables to sell. 

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant in her farm. She hopes to get more harvest which will increase her income with which she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes grow her farming business, get more income and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Angelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 12 years now.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear like pants, t-shirts and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabelle is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Annabelle has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Helcunida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helcunida works hard to support her family.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Helcunida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her handicraft business.

Helcunida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 41 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

Jenalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Cecilia is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Luna has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy raw materials like shells and nylon thread for her business.

Luna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like shells and nylon thread for her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
