Mercedes is 49 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Mercedes would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a hardworking man who does his best to satisfy his family needs.The previous loan helped her to boost her business and earn extra income.Here again he comes to you requesting for another loan of 50,000 KES to buy metallic jikos (charcoal burning braziers) for sale, and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy metallic jikos (charcoal burning braziers) for sale

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Jerlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jerlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jerlyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Jerlyn would like to build and expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, salt, sugar, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for 20 years. Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, salt, sugar and vegetables for her food production business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has four children and has been doing this work for three years.His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'rearing his animals'. His biggest challenge is 'vaccination prices of Animals E.C.F.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'the browns'.

Daniel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Juhudi Kilimo officer told us about it.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'assets financed generates income all the time.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Daniel replied 'he doesn't borrow milk anymore.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daniel owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old, married and has seven children. Three of her children are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her cows.

Mary Jane has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Fabio Andrés

texts.es:
Fabio es un hombre de 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Durante toda su infancia vivió en el campo y fue allí donde aprendió sobre las labores agropecuarias, gracias a la enseñanza de sus familiares. 
Nació en una familia bastante humilde y su situación económica solo les permite sobrevivir el día a día. Fabio es un hombre emprendedor y enérgico, quiere salir adelante y por eso se decidió a solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el montaje de un galpón (madera, clavos, rejilla), compra de pollos y alimento (cuido y vitaminas), de esta manera los cría y luego los vende, para obtener ingresos que le permitan cumplir una de sus principales metas, que es tener la oportunidad de llevar el sustento a su familia, satisfacer las necesidades del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos con una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Fabio, age 22, is single and has no children.  He lived in the country during all of his childhood.  That is where he learned about farm work thanks to his family’s teachings.

He was born into a very humble family, and their financial situation only allowed them to survive day to day.  Fabio is an enterprising and energetic man, and he wants to get ahead.

He decided to request his first loan cycle in order to invest in buying materials to erect a chicken coop (wood, nails, grating).  He will also buy chickens and feed (care and vitamins).  This way he will raise them and later sell them.  He will do this in order to get income that will allow him to meet one of his main goals.  His goal is to have the opportunity to support his family, to satisfy the needs of the household, and to improve the quality of life for all of them with good financial stability.

loans.use: to buy materials to erect a chicken coop (wood, nails, grating), and to buy chickens and feed (care and vitamins).

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 53, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband offers sheltering services. Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business to eventually construct a small house for his family. Nasreen hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia, Chanthou is 29 years old and married. The main source of her family’s income is from work in a local garment factory. She and her husband have been garment workers for six years. With her current job, she can earn about 28,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is Chanthou's  second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully paid back the first loan with VisionFund. She is now asking for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to run a new business as a clothing seller. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her new business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To run a new business as a clothing seller

loans.name: Iffat's Group

texts.en:
Iffat, 33, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, her husband's rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of that, he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. Due to a lack of money, however, he is finding it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Iffat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the repair costs. This investment will help him continue his business. Iffat is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom, 33, lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. A married mother of two, for the last eight years Sarom has been working as a farmer growing rice and cassava, while her husband earns extra income working as a motor taxi driver. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This will be Sarom's first VisionFund loan, while her fellow group member has received five previous loans. They are each requesting 1,000,000 KHR; Sarom will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes these purchases will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Ky's Group

texts.en:
Aged 34 years, Ky is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kampong Cham district of Ponhea Krek province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living through growing rice and also buying and selling cows in her village. Having been in this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 27,000 per day from the current business and are able to save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Ky’s group with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 51-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She is facing so many hurdles to sustain her family's livelihood. Her husband is the only person earning in the family. He is a tailor by profession. He has excellent tailoring skills. His customers appreciate his work. 

He needs to purchase one more sewing machine to complete the demands of his customers on time. By purchasing one more machine he will be able to satisfy his customers more efficiently. Therefore his wife Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en:
Saniya is a 23-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly. As a result, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Saniya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saniya is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Faryad

texts.en:
Faryad is a 52-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is the only person earning in the family. He delivers construction supplies. 

Currently he needs to purchase cement and sand to sell. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Faryad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the profit amount they will make some savings. Faryad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, age 46, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Rehana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Rehana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles.

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es: Diana, a sus 37 años de edad es madre cabeza de hogar, tiene una hija adolescente de 15 años y tras el abandono de su esposo ha tenido una situación traumática y muy difícil, pues en el momento se encontraba sin empleo y la situación económica no era favorable. A pesar de todas las dificultades y obstáculos que se le presentaron, ella no desfalleció, pues tenía una motivación por la cual luchar, su hija. Con visión, decisión y ganas de salir adelante, hace siete años montó su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa y mercancía en general, actividad que complementa con la pintura de figuras en cerámica. Con esto ha logrado obtener los recursos para el sostenimiento de las necesidades del hogar y para brindarle educación a su hija. Actualmente solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de más mercancía (blusas, jeans, accesorios, relojes) con el fin de ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, que satisfagan sus necesidades y así incrementar sus ventas. Su meta principal es continuar con su negocio, luchando para que sea próspero y de esta forma conseguir el sustento para su familia y brindarle una excelente educación a su hija, para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana, at 37 years of age, is a mother and head of household.  She has an adolescent daughter who is 15 years old.  After her husband left, she has had a traumatic and very difficult situation. At the time, she was without a job and her economic situation was not good.  In spite of all the difficulties and obstacles she faced, she didn't lose heart, because she had something to fight for -- her daughter.

With vision, determination and a desire to get ahead, she started her own business seven years ago -- a store for clothing and general merchandise, a business that she complements with painting ceramic figurines.  With this, she has been able to obtain resources for maintaining household necessities and for educating her daughter.

She is currently applying for her second loan, to invest it in the purchase of more merchandise (blouses, jeans, accessories, watches), with the goal of offering greater variety to her customers, to satisfy their needs and thus increase her sales.  Her primary goal is to continue with her business, fighting to make it thrive so that she can continue supporting her family and providing an excellent education for her daughter, so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (blouses, jeans, accessories, watches).

loans.name: Duván Antonio

texts.es: Duván, a sus 21 años de edad, se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pues tiene siembra de fríjol, arveja y papa criolla, en un pequeño lote que le presta su padre. El joven siempre ha vivido en el campo y es por ello que aprendió la actividad, gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y sus hermanos. Duván pertenece a una familia humilde, pero es muy trabajador y le gusta lo que hace, a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa su familia. Es un hombre emprendedor y por ello solicita su cuarto ciclo de crédito, para invetirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, semillas, fungicidas) con el fin de sembrar otro lote de papa criolla, para luego venderlo y así generar más ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia. Duván sueña con tener a mediano plazo una parcela de su propiedad, donde pueda continuar realizando las labores agrícolas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en: Duván is 21 years old and works in agriculture growing beans, peas, and potatoes on a small parcel of land that belongs to his father. He has always lived in the countryside, which is how he learned farming, thanks to instruction from his father and siblings. Duván's family is not wealthy, but they all work very hard and enjoy their work despite their difficult financial circumstances. Duván has a lot of initiative and is requesting his fourth loan to invest in buying agricultural supplies (fertilizer, seeds, fungicides) so that he can plant another crop of potatoes and sell them to bring in more income to support his family. Duván dreams of acquiring his own parcel of land in the medium term, which he would use to continue farming and improve his quality of life, offering a more comfortable life to his father and siblings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, seeds, fungicides).

loans.name: Minor

texts.es: Minor, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona, además pagar mano obra en la preparación del terreno y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Minor is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to his bean crop and achieve better germination, and high-quality seed that adapts well to local conditions, as well as to pay for laborers to assist him in preparing the land and planting the crops once it is ready. He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and soil in his area, which favor this crop, as well as to put into practice his years of experience growing staple grains and to be able to buy higher-quality products so that his crops are well developed and healthy and provide a higher yield in the short term. He will use the income from his harvest to improve his family's well-being, fulfill some family goals, and continue investing in his crops. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this more accessible loan at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, high-quality seed, and other products for his bean crop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa  y su hijo los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes  adecuados para este tipo de cultivo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona, además pagar mano obra en la preparación del terreno y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his highest priority. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his bean crop, other products to apply for better germination, and high-quality seed that adapts well to local conditions, as well as to hire laborers to assist him in preparing the land and planting the crop once it is ready. He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and soil in his area, which favor this crop, as well as to put into practice his years of experience growing staple grains and to be able to buy higher-quality products so that his crops are well developed and healthy and provide a higher yield in the short term. He will use the income from his harvest to improve his family's well-being, fulfill some family goals, and continue investing in his crops. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this more accessible loan at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other products, as well as high-quality seed for his bean crop.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are in school. For eight years now, she has had two activities, namely a clothes selling business and a beauty salon. She is doing fine in her all projects. She starts working from  8 a.m. to  9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be Mariam's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy beauty salon equipment so as to offer extra services for her customers. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house together with expanding her projects. 

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Bega Kwa Bega," which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment so as to offer extra services for her customers.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a 28-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has no children. Her husband owns a cosmetic shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of cosmetics in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Asma, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the help of the loan amount, he will purchase makeup kits, facial creams, lotions and lipsticks. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Asma is sitting in the middle.

loans.use: To purchase makeup kits, facial creams, lotions and lipsticks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a dairy farmer in Kangundo town. She supplies milk to various milk shops and has been in this business for 13 years. She is 46 years old and married with two children. Besides dairy farming, she also plants cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables.

This is her second loan term, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more dairy feeds for her dairy cattle. She also plans to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to grow her farming business and be able to make more income so as to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en: Sabiran is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. As a result, he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sabiran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sabiran is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is a cash crop farmer in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans, bananas, and vegetables to sell. She is a 64-year-old widow and has seven children. 

This is her second loan term, and she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She also plans to buy feed for her poultry and cattle. She will use the generated income to complete the construction of her house. 

She hopes to grow her farming business, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesús

texts.es: Humberto, a sus 47 años de edad es casado y padre de 2 hijos. Siempre ha vivido en el campo y gracias a su familia aprendió a cultivar diversos productos y a cuidar animales. Por falta de educación y de oportunidades laborales, ha decidido emprender su propio negocio, para lo cual solicita su primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche y en insumos agrícolas (semillas, abono, fungicidas) para realizar una siembra de hortalizas, que le permita generar ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.  Humberto sueña con tener una plantación escalada de cultivos, vender los productos que cosecha y así poder brindar una mejor educación a sus dos hijos y ofrecer bienestar y calidad de vida a toda la familia.
texts.en: Humberto is 47 years old, married, and has two children. He has always lived in the country, and, thanks to his family, he learned to cultivate a variety of plants and to tend livestock. Due to a lack of education and employment opportunities, he has decided to start his own business, for which he is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow and agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, fungicides, etc.). With this he will plant a vegetable crop that will allow him to generate income in order to provide for the basic needs of his family. Humberto dreams of having a tiered plantation of crops, selling his produce that he harvests, and thus being able to provide for a better education for his two children and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow and agricultural supplies (fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide, seeds).

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, gaseosas y pan entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a consumir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fideos, detergentes, gaseosas y otras cosas más para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Emilia lives together with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco. She is 38 years old and is in a common-law relationship, by which she has three children who she helps get ahead. She alternates between the responsibilities of the household and selling essential goods such as rice, sugar, pastas, detergents, soft drinks, and bread. She has a small storefront in her home where she sells her goods. She manages her business and tends to her customers with great kindness and courtesy, which is why they always come back to shop. She has managed this business for a few years now and things are going quite well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Emilia is a member of the Mamacha Carmen Communal Bank and this cycle she requires a loan to purchase pastas, detergents, soft drinks, and other items in order to increase her business's capital. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her monthly bills responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase pastas, detergents, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: María Ruth

texts.es: Maria Ruth, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hija los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano en la preparación del terreno y de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Ruth is 23 years old and married. She lives with her husband and daughter, who are her first priority.

With this loan, María Ruth will buy good-quality seeds, as well as fertilizers and other products to apply to the seeds once sown so that they germinate well. She will also pay for the labor to prepare the fields, apply the fertilizers and other products, and assist with the crops once they have started to grow. She hopes in this way to be sure of doing a good job.

María Ruth wants to take advantage of the climate and the soil of the region where she lives, which are both good for growing beans. She also wants to put into practice her several years of experience of working with basic grains. She plans to buy the best-quality products so that her crops grow well, are healthy, and produce a good harvest. Before too long she hopes to have a substantial production.

María Ruth hopes to use the income from the harvest for her family’s welfare and education, and also to meet some of the goals that her family has set. She also wants to continue investing in more crops.

This is the first loan that María Ruth has received from the field partner. She had not previously had loans from state banks, but the field partner provided her the loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow beans.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 53 años, es soltero, y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en el cantón Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. 

Es miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

Carlos trabaja en la agricultura y crianza de cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz,  también a la cría de chanchos.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Carlos.

A Alberto le gusta divertirse en el campo y hacer deporte en la comunidad.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricutluara. Su meta es mejorar su situación económica para beneficio de la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una casa decente para vivir.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53, single and has four children. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the rural communal bank Aso. 10 de Septiembre, which is located in Lechugalito, a precinct belonging to the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. There are 21 partners in total, and they are mostly an agricultural and livestock community.

Carlos works in agriculture and pig breeding to improve the economy of his family. The crops that stand out are corn, and also raising pigs. He sells the products in the market of San Carlos.

Carlos Alberto likes to have fun in the field and play sports in the community. The partner is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticide and compost. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he lacks for agriculture. His goal is to improve his economic situation to benefit his family. The challenge he faces is to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, compost.

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años, es soltero, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

José trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz. Vende los productos en el mercado de Mocache. A José le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una vida tranquila.
texts.en:
José is 53, single and has three children. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The partner is a member of the rural communal bank Aso. 10 de Septiembre which is located in Lechugalito, a precinct belonging to the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. There are 21 partners in total, and the community is majority agricultural and livestock.

José works in agriculture to increase his family's economy. The crop he most excels in is corn. He sells the products in the Mocache market. 

José likes to play sports in the community.

The partner is asking for a loan to buy inputs for work in the field, above all for fertilizers and compost. His goal is to have a good economic activity for his family. The challenge he faces is having a quiet life.

loans.use: to buy inputs for field work, above all, for fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Sath is 64 years old and a resident living in Reussey Keo district, which is about 10 km away from Phnom Penh. Sath, at her age, doesn't depend on her children, but instead she operates a vending business at a market near her house. She buys fresh fish from local suppliers to make dried fish and sells them at a profitable price. Normally, she is able to generate a net income of $5.00 per day to support her daily costs of living.

Since Sath has frequent and new customers who come to buy her dried fish often, she is looking for a loan amounting to $1,000 US dollars to buy more fish to dry in order to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her selling business, and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry in order to sustain her business

loans.name: Jekafo 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAFO 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec FATOUMATA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, les semences  et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group known as  JEKAFO 4 are married women with an average age of 42, five children, and all live in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages of the municipality of Niena, in the third administrative region of Mali: Sikasso. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Fatoumata, standing in the middle, cultivates peanuts. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate one hectare. Her produce is sold at the level of the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de productos de agro veterinarios como fertilizantes, semillas entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abonos para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco. She is 30 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has two children for whom she provides. She manages looking after her home and children, while at the same time selling agricultural products such as fertilizers and seeds from a small store she has in her home. She manages her business, sells her products and waits on her customers in a very kind and courteous manner, and for this reason her customers always come back to her with their purchases. She has now been working at this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the determination and effort she puts into it.

Luz Marina belongs to the Mamacha Carmen communal bank. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers to increase the capital of her business. She says that she appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and that she promises to responsibly make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pelleted feed and a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sweets, cookies, chocolates and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. Marilou earns more income from a general store.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is a 51-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a hardware store, selling water pipes with various shapes and sizes. She has been operating a hardware store for three years. Aside from operating a hardware store, she also raises hogs to augment her income.

Expedita requested a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy various water pipes and additional pigs. In the future, Expedita would like to expand both of her businesses to become a successful entrepreneur and to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various water pipes and additional pigs.

loans.name: Norady

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Norady works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal sales. Norady is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Norady has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 54-year-old married woman from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Aida is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to purchase feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising venture, thus augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Gayatree Group

texts.en:
Gayatree, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by six active and energetic women of Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India. 

Premsi is one of the members of this group; she is sitting in the front row with a raised hand. She is a very energetic lady with advanced thinking. She is thirty-eight years old and lives with her husband, two sons of fifteen and twelve years and one daughter of eighteen years, who are continuing their study. Presently, Premsi is residing in a small house with her family. 

Premsi has been running a grinding unit in her house for the last twelve years with the help of her husband. She grinds spices like chili, onion, garlic, etc., and black gram and green gram (mung beans), etc. for the tiffin centers (meals packed to go) and restaurants of the town. Around twenty tiffin centers and restaurants depend upon the grinding unit of Premsi. 

Every day for eight to ten hours, she keeps herself busy in grinding the pulses (legumes). Premsi earns 300/400 INR daily from her unit. 

This is the third loan for Premsi from Mahashakti Foundation. With the last two loans, she has added some new things to her grinding unit and has constructed a small cabin for her business. So she extends her thanks to Mahashakti Foundation. 

From the present loan, she wants to purchase another grinding machine specially for grinding of ginger and garlic. This will help her to give wider service and fetch some extra income for her family. Premsi hopes to extend her business into a big one and construct a good house for her family.

Among the other five members of the group, Anjana, Indu and Bina are running tiffin centers, whereas Kalpana and Dalimba are running a betel nut supply business and vegetable vending business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.name: Jaya Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Katarkela is a remotely located rural village of Balangir district in Odisha, India. In the year 2010, five active women entrepreneurs of this village formed a group named Jaya Maa Laxmi to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Hem is one of them. The lady standing at the extreme left near the paddy de-husking machine is Hem. She is an energetic lady of forty-three years, lives with her husband, and four sons of  twenty-eight, twenty-three, nineteen and seventeen  years. 

Hem has been running a paddy milling business in her village for the last 15 years. Apart from that she is also running a dairy farm and a General Grocery shop. Her husband and two elder sons help her in these businesses. She earns a daily net income of 600 INR from the existing businesses. Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses in a decent manner. 

 Hem is planning to increase her income by expanding the business. Looking into the demand of the locality, from the present loan Hem wants to put in a wheat roller milling machine. She is certain that this will generate a handsome income for her because in a radius of eight kilometers, this type of facility is not available. Hem hopes to save enough money to start a milk processing unit and pay for the marriage of her eldest son. It is an encouraging fact that during this year her husband has been awarded the honor of best dairy farmer by the state government.

The other four members of the group are Kasturi, Saraswati, Kousalya and Dhanmati running general store, soap vending, puffed rice and fish vending businesses respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a wheat roller milling machine.

loans.name: Jai Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Mamata, aged about 28 years, resides with her husband and two children at Bissam Cuttack of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. The lady standing on the right in the photograph with blue colored saree  is Mamata. In the year 2010 she accessed her first loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Presently Mamata is running an aluminum utensil and bell shop in her locality. She earns about Rs.9,000 per month from her business. According to Mamata, the present income is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

She has already accesssed three loans from Mahashakti. This is her fourth cycle loan. From the present loan she wants to invest in purchasing more utensils and bells to increase the turnover of her business. Mamata has an ambition to educate her  children in a better school.

Another member of her group, K. Durga needs a loan to invest in her Ornament Shop & Photo Studio.

loans.use: to pay for purchase of utensils & bells

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Group

texts.en:
Arunarani is a housewife aged 31, who lives with her husband and one child in a rural village named Bissam Cuttack in Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. The lady standing on the right, wearing a green colored blouse, is Arunarani. She is running a grocery shop along with her husband. From the above her family gets a monthly income of 8,000 INR which is very difficult to maintain her family with. 

She has already accessed three loans from Mahashakti beginning in 2010. Now she wants a loan to purchase rice, oil, sugar, salt, washing powder, soap, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, etc. for the expansion of her business. She has an ambition to run a wholesale rice shop to increase her family income and to educate her child in a better school. 

Another member of her group Mrs.Tribeni wants a loan for Fancy Goods & Electronics shop.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, salt, washing powder, soap, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, etc.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 47 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Ashot has a vocational education; he has graduated from Agricultural College, Veterinary Department. Now he works as a butcher at the Vanadzor city food market in a rented stall. He has been engaged in this business for three years and already has many loyal customers who trust Ashot. They know that they can buy fresh and clean products from his stall. Ashot buys the meat from the farmers of nearby villages twice in a month. 

Ashot asks for a loan in an amount of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy a car in order to be able to bring the meat from different villages by his own car; it will lighten his work and save his money, which he uses on renting a car for the meat transfer.

loans.use: To buy a car in order to be able to bring the meat from different villages by his own car to lighten his work and save money that he uses on renting a car.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice to sell to her customers.

Jona has been in this business for three years. Jona earns additional income from her general store.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, es casado, tiene 3 hijos. El estudió la carrera de arquitectura la cual es su profesión. Se dedica al negocio de billares deportivos desde hace 13 años, el local que utiliza es propiedad de su mama, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo ya ha sabido administrarlo. Solicita el préstamo para cambiar los paños de las mesas de billar y remodelar los baños de su negocio. Su expectativa es tener el mejor centro de billares deportivos de la ciudad, obtener mejores ingresos, hacer crecer su negocio y garantizar un mejor porvenir a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is from the city of Estelí, he is married, and he has three children. He studied and works in architecture. He has managed a billiards hall for 13 years, the location of which is owned by his mother. Little by little his business has grown. He is requesting this loan in order to change the cloth on his billiard tables and remodel the bathrooms in his establishment. His goal is to have the best billiards hall in the city, earn greater income, grow his business, and secure a greater future for his family.

loans.use: change the cloth on his billiard tables and remodel the bathrooms of his establishment.

loans.name: Gregorio Justino

texts.es:
Gregorio es soltero, tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas de la Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

Gregorio trabaja en la agricultura y la crianza de gallinas, para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es la siembre de maíz, los productos vende en el mercado de Mocache Y San Carlos.
A Gregorio le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad.

El socio solicita el crédito  para la siembra de maíz comprar fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas.  Su meta es seguir prosperando y así salir adelante con el apoyo de la Cooperativa, para tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta es luchar por la familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is single, and he has three children. He lives in the county of Ventanas of the Ríos province. 

The partner is a member of the rural communal bank Aso. 10 of September that is located in Lechugalito, a precinct that belongs to Ventanas county of the Ríos province.  There are a total of 21 members, and it is mainly an agricultural and livestock community.

Gregorio works in agriculture and breeds chickens to increase his family's business. The crop that stands out most is corn, which he sells in the markets of Mocache and San Carlos. Gregorio likes playing sports in the community. 

Gregorio is asking for the loan to sow corn and to buy fertilizers and herbicides. His goal is to keep thriving and to succeed with the support of the Cooperative, for his family's business. The challenge that he faces is struggling for his family.

loans.use: to sow the corn and to buy fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 57-year-old married woman and a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 13 years now. She also works with her husband on their rice farm.

Aida is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their ventures and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Johane

texts.en:
Johane is a 32-year-old married woman from Getafe,Bohol.  She ha a 3 year old daughter. She operates a motorcycle transport service. Her husband is the one who transports the passengers from one place to another. She has been operating a motorcycle transport service for almost 3 years. Aside from  operating  a motorcycle transport service, Johane also engages in seaweed farming, to augment their income.

Johane requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fuel, tires, pay maintenance fees for her motorcycle and buy food for the family. In the future,Johane would like to expand both businesses to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fuel, tires, pay maintenace fees for her motorcycle and buy food for the family

loans.name: Ma. Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 34 years old, married and has five children ages eight months to twelve years. She and her family lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. For the past seven years Lorna has farmed vegetables such as eggplant and okra. This earns her an average of 6000 PHP per month.

Lorna is applying for a 5000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy fertilizer plus eggplant and okra seedlings. She is confident that with hard work and her loan she can make her farm even more profitable.

In the future Lorna would like to see her children be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer plus eggplant and okra seedlings

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 45, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods to the people in her neighborhood.

Alma is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, etc. By doing so she will be able to enlarge her inventory and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is a 55-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He is the father of three children, ages 23, 21 and 18 years old respectively. 

He is engaged in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been into fishing for five years. To be able to sustain his fishing livelihood, Lazaro requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish net, to improve his daily catch. 

In the future, Lazaro would like to expand his fishing business to provide his family with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish net.

loans.name: Dionee Nohelia

texts.es: Nohelia vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, cemento, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales construcción como arena, yeso, cemento y piedras para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (En la fotografía la socia está acompañada de su esposo).
texts.en:
Nohelia lives with her family in the beautiful city of Puacartambo in the department of Cusco. She is 31 and in a common-law marriage; together they have two children whom they support. Nohelia alternates her housework with her business selling construction materials, such as sand and cement. She has had this business for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. She belongs to the "Mamacha Carmen" communal bank, and needs this loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, plaster, cement, and stones. This will increase her working capital. She is grateful for this loan and values it. She promises to repay her monthly quotas with great responsibility.
(In the photo she is shown with her husband).

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, plaster, cement, and stones.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 62 years old, married, and has five children.  

Ninfa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ninfa requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ninfa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ninfa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva is 26 years old, married, and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer, and she is the one who manages and operates their own farm.

In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC, and it helped improve her quality of life and ability to engage in business. She borrowed a loan of 50,000 PHP in order to cover the costs of the cocoland (land on which coconuts are produced) mortgage. 

She plans to save a portion of her generated income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the cocoland mortgage.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is from Northern Poblacion, Baliangao,Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him by running her general store to earn a living. She borrowed a loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC in order to buy rice and corn grits for resale. She plans to make her general store a full merchandise store in order to have a better and comfortable future.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is married and has four children. She lives in Manla, Sapangdalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sell fish in town, for a living. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC, in order to acquire a motorboat to be used for fishing. She hopes to earn more income, to provide for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to acquire a motorboat, to be used for fishing

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55-year-old married woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has five children. Her eldest is 30 and the youngest is 17. For five years now, she has operated a Sari-sari (variety) store in her community. She sell items such as detergent, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, seasonings and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory and buy soft drinks such as Coke, Sprite, as well as oranges, detergent, canned goods and seasonings. She wants to increase her business profits so she can provide her family a better life.

In the future, she hopes to expand her store and increase the variety of merchandise that she is selling for higher profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks such as Coke, Sprite, as well as oranges, detergent, canned goods and seasonings

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a motorcycle driver from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income.

Arnold is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains, fuel and other items. With this, he will be able to transport more passengers, thus increasing his income. 

In the future, Arnold hopes to make his business a success and a stable source of income. Furthermore, he wants to save money for the schooling of his four young children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains, fuel and other items.

loans.name: Dadyluz

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Dadyluz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Dadyluz is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Dadyluz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is 44 years old, married and has eight children, two of whom are in school. 

Rosy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosy has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosy would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melorna

texts.en:
Melorna is 43 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Melorna works very hard to provide for them.

Melorna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, snack foods, bread and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell, such as soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, snack foods, bread and other groceries, in her general store.

Melorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, snack foods, bread and other groceries, in her general store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old, married and has eight children, one of whom is in school.  

Nelly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelly has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rosa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc. for her business.

In the future, Rosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like shells, nylon thread, wire, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 52 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school. Mirasol works very hard to provide for her family.

Mirasol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory (groceries) to sell.

Mirasol has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Mirasol would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Wilma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marlyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marlyn has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugar cane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Darie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Darie works hard to support her family. She sells fruits and vegetables and earns additional income from farming rice and fattening up pigs to sell.

Darie has been sustaining her work through her past two loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Darie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Morie

texts.en:
Ma. Morie is 43 years old and married. She has four children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns additional income from rug making.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, candies, noodles, and cooking oil. Ma. Morie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, snack foods, noodles and cooking oil

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years.

Rema requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rema has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her pig-raising activity. In the future, Rema would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ruth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ruth has been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from rug making, fishing and meat vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, rice, seasonings and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Janet would like to save money expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paladie

texts.en: Paladie is 27 years old. She sells different products but especially TV sets and radios and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more TV sets and radios for sale. The profits will be used to buy a cow for providing milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more TV sets and radios for sale

loans.name: Bellancille

texts.en:
Bellancille is 48 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 27 years old. She has been selling beers and sodas for one and a half years. She is married and has four children, only two go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda for resale. She is planning to buy cows for providing milk in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda for resale

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, meat, vegetables, salt, etc. for her business.

Salud has been in this business for 15 years. Salud earns additional income from rug making.

Salud has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, meat, vegetables, salt, etc., for her business

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 29 years old. She owns a retail business selling different items. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and flour for resale. She is expecting to reinvest in her business with the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and flour for resale

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 31 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She belongs to a poor family. She is facing many hurdles to support the life of her family.

Her husband is the only income-earning person in the family. He is a tailor by profession. He has excellent tailoring skills. His customers appreciate his work. He needs to purchase one more sewing machine, to enable him to complete the orders of customers on time. By purchasing one more machine, he will be able to satisfy his customers more efficiently. Therefore his wife, Asiya, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband, by buying the sewing machine he needs. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Maisom's Group

texts.en:
Maisom lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 45 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are still in school in the local area. To support her family, she has been growing rice, cassava and rubber trees. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day, and she can save 15,000 KHR each day, after living expenses.

Maisom is just on her first loan from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each. Maisom, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan money to buy fertilizer for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 32 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to their lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazia is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw.

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en: Kubra is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business in spare parts eight years ago. Kubra, a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of spare parts of motorbikes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customers' needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Kubra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, Gocha, and two daughters (11-year-old Mariam and 8-year-old Nino) in Sagarejo district, Kakheti Region. Gocha trades in wood seasonally. This is the only source of income for their family, which is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. 

So, Tea decided to start a farming business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Tea’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative, the Kiva and Credo Start-up Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 4,000 GEL, she will purchase three milking cows and feed for them. After buying milking cows, Tea will milk them and start producing dairy products for selling. 

The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase three milking cows and feed for them.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida que se dedica a la sastrería y  con quien convive desde hace 35 años, y procrearon 4 hijos, de los que solo vive con ellos una hija de 30 años de edad.


Él Se dedica a trabajar como albañil desde hace mas de 30 años, este oficio lo aprendió con un tío que lo apoyo cuando fue joven y en lo que se refiere al cultivo de maíz y maicillo lo hace desde que era muy pequeño, sus padres se dedicaban y dependían de estos cultivos.

Las materias  primas las adquiere en la ciudad y se desplaza aproximadamente 10 kilómetros en autobuses  que hacen este recorrido. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar $100.00 en alquiler de la tierra, $250.00 en compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas, $150.00 en la mano de obra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo. La cosecha será comercializa con  ganaderos de la zona que hacen ensilajes.


A través del préstamo, se fortalecerá con capital de trabajo a la familia para que realice el cultivo que han hecho desde hace 8 años y que no les dejara quedar mal con sus clientes.


Desea, Seguir trabajando,  hacer mejoras a la vivienda; es decir, ampliar su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan vivir con mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Julio is 62 years old and lives with his wife and one of their four grown children. Julio's wife makes a living as a seamstress, and Julio works as a mason. He has over 30 years experience working as a mason, and he learned the trade while working with and helping his uncle. In addition to masonry, Julio also learned many farming techniques at a young age from his uncle, including tactics for tending corn and sorghum crops. His parents also worked in agriculture and depended on their crops for their livelihood.

Julio buys his raw materials in a nearby city 10 kilometers from his town. With the support from this loan, Julio plans to put $100.00 toward renting arable land, $250.00 toward the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides, and $150.00 towards covering labor costs for planting and tending 14 square meters of sorghum crops. Once harvested, he plans to sell his crops to local grain exporters who can store large quantities in silos.
